Name: El Salvador Finca Plan de Hoyo
Review: A balanced, high-toned, cocoa-driven washed El Salvador with complex citrus and gently spice tones.

Name: Finca Retana
Review: A deeply floral, richly chocolaty Guatemala cup complicated by sweet nut and resonant aromatic wood notes.

Name: Finca San Ramón
Origin: San Juan Sacatepequez, Sacatepequez Department, Guatemala
Review: A bright, balanced, juicy Guatemala Geisha Malawi, a rare and ancient variety of Arabica worth seeking out for its novelty and vividness.

Name: Todos Santos Cuchumatanán Pacamara
Origin: Todos Santos Cuchumatán, Huehuetenango Department, Guatemala
Review: A sweetly nut-toned, gently floral Guatemala Pacamara with especially inviting, viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Finca Huixoc Pacamara
Review: A friendly, accessible Guatemala Pacamara, crisply chocolaty with spice-toned florals and rich aromatic wood throughlines.

Name: 5a Poniente
Review: A deep-toned, chocolaty, roast-rounded Guatemala cup with undertones of spice-laden florals.

Name: 5a Sur
Review: A chocolaty, spice-toned Guatemala with an aromatic wood throughline (think fresh-cut fir).

Name: Guatemala El Socorro Natural
Review: A friendly, easygoing Guatemala Pacamara natural with berry notes front and center and a crisp chocolate throughline.

Name: Costa Rica Rivense Finca El Mango Honey Process
Origin: Chirripo, Brunca growing region, Costa Rica
Review: A complex, multi-layered Costa Rica honey, berry-driven, chocolaty and harmoniously balanced — and an amazing value.

Name: Ethiopia Ardi Yeast Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A pretty Ethiopia natural fermented with a yeast mixture that amplifies gentle, sweet-tart fruit notes alongside sweet herbs.

Name: Costa Rica Los Santos Hacienda La Minita
Review: A harmonious, inviting Costa Rica cup, chocolaty and rich, with sweet fruit and floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Buku Sayisa Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A nuanced, exceptionally sweet natural-processed Ethiopia grounded by cocoa nib and almond tones.

Name: Ethiopia Guji First Passion Natural G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A rich, juicy, full-bodied natural-processed Guji with tart fruit and sweet herb notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Blossom Peak Washed G1
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia profile — brightly sweet, delicately tart, juicy and balanced.

Name: Tanzania AB Nsoga Iweyza
Review: At $14.00 for 12 ounces, this might be the bargain of the year. This classic washed Tanzania is sweet, savory, multi-layered and rich.

Name: Uganda Sironko Station Natural
Review: An interestingly composed Uganda natural with rich sweetness, distinct tartness, and a throughline of crisp chocolate, and a bittersweet, caraway-like note.

Name: Bolivia San Lorenzo
Origin: San Lorenzo, Caranavi Province, La Paz Department, Bolivia
Review: A sweetly savory, crisply chocolaty Bolivia natural complicated by spice-toned florals and sweet herb notes.

Name: Rwanda Nyamasheke “Ireme” Anaerobic
Review: An anaerobic Rwanda with tart, tangy fruit up front, supported by notes of dark chocolate and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Biloya Anaerobic
Review: A crisply berry-forward, chocolaty anaerobic natural Ethiopia with intriguing savory-tangy undertones.

Name: Colombia Water Process Decaf
Review: A bargain of a daily-drinking decaf (you wouldn’t really know it’s a decaf — crisply chocolaty, richly nutty with nice citrus notes.

Name: 1994 Blend
Review: A nice daily drinker with deep chocolate and sweetly tart berry notes throughout the profile — and a relative bargain at $22.50 for a full pound.

Name: El Salvador Unicorn
Review: A lush, floral-toned, richly fruit-forward, complex and intriguing El Salvador natural.

Name: Kenya Kiamwangi Factory AA TOP
Review: A rich-toned, sweetly savory Kenya with enticing floral notes throughout the profile and classic black currant up front in the nose and on the mid-palate.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bensa Hamasho Washed TOH#2
Review: A meandering sensory journey: floral, crisply fruity, sweetly herbaceous and cocoa-toned.

Name: X’mas Blend
Review: A thoughtful Ethiopia/El Salvador blend that’s, at turns, chocolaty and rich and tartly fruit-toned.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona Bochesa Natural
Review: A vibrantly sweet, gently tart Ethiopia natural with leading notes of hibiscus and dried cranberry, supported by cocoa nib and rich aromatic wood tones.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona Natural ASD TOH#2
Review: A fruit-toned experimentally processed Ethiopia with a floral, nutty throughline.

Name: Costa Rica Red Java Honey Finca Los Pinitos
Review: A Costa Rica Java red honey that delivers on all fronts with deep fruit, rich chocolate, citrus, honey, and spice-toned florals — confident, balanced, satisfying.

Name: Costa Rica Finca El Cañal Double Diamond
Review: A lovely anaerobic Costa Rica Sarchimor, meticulously processed to foreground sweet berry and deep chocolate notes.

Name: Honduras Roger Dominguez
Origin: La Paz, Marcala growing region, Honduras
Review: An elegant, complex natural-processed single-variety Honduras that’s berry-driven with a sweet herb and cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Dembi
Review: Rich florals and complex citrus notes define this engaging Ethiopia natural that’s rich-toned and deep.

Name: Guatemala Finca Los Dos Socios
Origin: El Chalum, La Libertad, Huehuetenango Department, Guatemala
Review: A deep-toned, sweetly nutty, crisply chocolaty washed Guatemala with undertones of tropical fruit.

Name: Guatemala Buenos Aires
Review: A high-toned, crisply chocolaty Guatemala natural — bright, citrusy and floral-toned.

Name: Honduras Pacayal Regenerative Organic-Certified
Origin: La Paz, Marcala growing region, Honduras
Review: A Regenerative Organic Certified® (ROC™), natural-processed Honduras that’s quietly confident, richly chocolaty, and delicately fruity.

Name: Decaf Mexico Esmeralda
Review: A solid Mexico decaf — natural-processed, which highlights the cup’s inherent fruit tones.

Name: Thai Law Wu
Review: A sweetly herbaceous, crisply cocoa-toned, black honey-processed Thai cup.

Name: Ngurueri Kenya
Review: An umami throughline distinguishes this classic Kenya, which is bright, juicy, deep and complex.

Name: Cruz Loma Ecuador
Origin: San José de Minas, Pichincha Province, Ecuador
Review: Pretty notes of sweet herbs, cocoa nib, and spice-toned florals carry this washed Ecuador Sidra with especially nice, high-toned acidity.

Name: El Faldon Colombia
Review: A cocoa-toned washed Colombia cup with a floral throughline, complicated by rich aromatic wood and amber notes.

Name: Colombia Monteblanco Nectar Citrullus Secret Stash
Review: This uniquely composed co-fermented Colombia displays a melony sweetness supported by baking chocolate and tropical fruit.

Name: Costa Rica La Laguna Lot Secret Stash
Review: This natural-processed Costa Rica Caturra has heady and fruit-laden aromatics, whose promise is fulfilled in the cup.

Name: Costa Rica La Casilla Secret Stash
Review: A delicately sweet, crisply cocoa-toned honey-processed Costa Rica cup with an especially nice, viscous body.

Name: Colombia El Mirador Natural Secret Stash
Review: A deeply chocolaty, berry-driven Colombia, processed by the thermal shock method, that delivers layers of fruit, nut and citrus tones.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Lion 88
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An invitingly complex Ethiopia natural driven by notes of sweet berries, deep chocolate, and gentle, aromatic herbs.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Baby Geisha
Origin: Djimma Limu, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia Geisha — bright and juicy with citrus and stonefruit notes throughout and a cocoa nib base.

Name: Ethiopia Anaerobic Washed Wild Rose
Review: An Ethiopia anaerobic with tart fruit notes and crisply sweet floral undertones.

Name: PNG New Heaven
Review: A balanced PNG cup with notes of stonefruit and citrus front and center, supported by crisp cocoa nib and rich aromatic wood underneath.

Name: Panama Lamastus Family Elida Estate Loma Geisha Washed
Review: This classic washed Panama Geisha delivers on all counts with rich aromatics, complex citrus, floral stone fruit and cocoa nib notes, bright, balanced acidity and a long, satisfying finish.

Name: Colombia Santa Monica Pink Bourbon Honey Co-Ferment Strawberry
Review: A Colombia Pink Bourbon co-fermented with strawberries for an intensely fruit-forward, cocoa-toned cup.

Name: Bolivia Finca Alasitas Geisha Natural
Review: A pretty Bolivia natural with sweet floral, complex citrus and tropical fruit impulses.

Name: Colombia Finca Juan Martin Sidra Natural
Review: Spice-toned florals and sweetly tart fruit notes are front and center in this confident natural Colombia Sidra.

Name: Sumatra Suku Batak
Review: A classic Sumatra profile with its sweet earthiness and rich, viscous body — sweet, savory, deep-toned.

Name: Colombia El Paraiso Geisha Anti-Maceration
Review: A Colombia Geisha on steroids, processed by a proprietary and meticulous method that concentrates the fruit, spice and floral tones inherent in this coffee.

Name: Ethiopia Alo Chilaka Natural
Review: A richly aromatic, stone fruit-driven single-variety Ethiopia natural — clean, juicy, bright and richly sweet-tart.

Name: Panama Bambito Gesha
Review: A washed Panama Gesha with candy-like sweetness complicated by cocoa nib and sweet herb undertones.

Name: Kona Monarch Gesha Champagne
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, Hawai’i Island
Review: This fruit-centered anaerobic washed Kona Gesha gets ballast from rich nut and sweet floral tones throughout the profile.

Name: Panama Geisha Vuelta DRD Natural
Review: A resonant, lyrically sweet, impossibly complex, yet immanently inviting Panama Geisha.

Name: Kona S12 Kaffa Washed
Review: A fascinating coffee — a variety that originated in Ethiopia grown in Hawai’i from seed and cultivated over many years to produce just four pounds. Well worth the splurge for its citrusy, spice-toned, sweetly herbaceous cup.

Name: Kona Geisha Rosé Washed
Review: A double-fermented Kona Geisha processed with wine yeasts, resulting in an extraordinary, uniquely composed coffee — a journey through the sensory aromas and flavors of the tropics.

Name: Colombia Cafe La Granja Pink Bourbon
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle del Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A lovely anaerobic Colombia Pink Bourbon with a distinct strawberry throughline, whose nuances range from wild-forest berry to just toasted PopTart. A fun one!

Name: Colombia Cafe La Granja Sudan Rume Natural
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle del Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: An enigmatic, very complex natural-processed Colombia Sudan Rume, rich and very sweet, complicated by spicy florals, deep chocolate, and sweet herbs.

Name: Panama Tierra Blanca C-5 Geisha Washed BOP-GW-05
Review: A delicate, resonant, classic washed Geisha profile with spice-toned floral, distinct stone fruit, sweet herb, complex citrus and rich cocoa notes throughout the integrated profile.

Name: Taiwan Zou Zhou Yuan Estate Geisha Natural
Review: A floral-driven, spice-laden Taiwan cup roasted in London — vanilla-like sweetness meets piquant herbiness.

Name: Kenya AA Kangiri New Irati
Origin: Kigumo growing region, Muranga County, Kenya
Review: An exciting Kenya: very bright, vibrant, fruit-centered and floral with a dark chocolate throughline.

Name: Costa Rica Central Valley Honey Geisha
Review: An enticing honey-processed Costa Rica Geisha with distinct cocoa nib, sweet spice, and complex nut tones.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bombe G1 Washed
Review: A sweet-tart, washed Ethiopia characterized by deep stone fruit and cocoa nib notes, alongside spicy florals.

Name: Costa Rica Lilo Microlot
Review: A floral-toned, washed Costa Rica complicated by melon and citrus notes grounded by rich, creamy nut tones.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Buku Sayisa G1 Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A berry-forward natural Ethiopia with cocoa underpinnings and rich aromatic wood notes throughout the profile.

Name: Guatemala Finca Santa Isabel SL28 COE #13
Origin: San Cristobal Verapaz, Alta Verapaz, Antigua Department, Guatemala
Review: An inviting, well-rounded washed Guatemala SL28 driven by rich chocolate and creamy-sweet nut tones, complicated by bittersweet citrus and nice aromatic wood notes.

Name: Kahiko Orange
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A remarkably complex, satiating, enigmatic Kona Typica co-fermented with Kona oranges grown on the same farm. Hard to imagine someone who wouldn’t love this coffee.

Name: Kenya Washed Kiambu Yara Estate PB TOP
Review: Classic Kenya on steroids — this peaberry cup packs a currant, dark chocolate, green tomato and sweet herb punch for an exquisite and unmistakable experience of this revered and unique coffee-growing region.

Name: Kona Orange
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A lovely Kona-grown SL34 co-fermented with oranges grown on the same farm — nuanced, rich, compelling throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Sudan Rume
Review: An enigmatic, rewarding, expressive rare variety of Arabica processed in such a way that its complexity is amplified and extended.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Gute 74110 Lot JH
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: bright, balanced, juicy and vibrant — especially harmonious and coherent throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Bura Karamo 74158
Review: An elegantly structured, rich and multi-layered natural-processed Ethiopia cup — bright, juicy, fruity, floral, chocolaty.

Name: Taiwan Honey Alishan Ming Yang Yuan Gesha
Review: A richly aromatic, deep-toned, confident natural-processed Taiwan driven by notes of wild berries, complex florals, and nuanced aromatic wood notes.

Name: Kenya Washed Kiambu AB TOP Lot Yerihar
Review: An intriguing Kenya cup with layers of tart fruit, deep florals and cocoa notes throughout — tropical leaning and rich.

Name: Kenya Ibonia Estate
Review: A stone fruit-driven, crisply cocoa-toned, classic Kenya cup with undertones of sweet citrus and gently fruity spice notes.

Name: Ethiopia Worka Sakaro
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A flavor-laden anaerobic natural Ethiopia: lactic-tangy, chocolaty-sweet, citrusy and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Uraga Tebe Burka
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia profile at its best: richly chocolaty, deeply floral, balanced and juicy-bright.

Name: Colombia Decaf Granja Paraiso 92
Review: We couldn’t tell this was decaf in a blind cupping — it’s chocolaty, syrupy, deep-toned and rich.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama ALO Village SKY Project FL
Review: A harmonious, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia deeply fruit-toned, complex, inviting.

Name: Taiwan Natural Alishan Chi Tsai Liu Li Ecological Farm
Review: A vibrantly citrusy, cocoa-toned natural-processed Taiwan cup with an especially plush, syrupy mouthfeel and sweetly spicy floral undertones.

Name: Wilton Benitez SL28
Review: This uniquely composed, proprietarily processed Colombia SL28 leads with a candylike nose — think Jolly Rancher — and morphs into a floral, berry-toned powerhouse.

Name: Kolla Bolcha #6 Ethiopia
Review: This lovely washed Ethiopia is all about stone fruit, both in the nose and in the cup. There’s bing cherry at the tart end and lychee at the sugary end, with crisp cocoa nib and a sweet herbaceousness as ballast.

Name: Bener Meriah Sumatra
Review: A spice-toned cup — floral and sweet — with complex fruit and baking spices at the center. Powerful, deep, rich.

Name: Yemen Haraaz
Review: A beautiful expression of Yemen’s meticulous sun-drying process that reveals layers of complex spice, fruit, earth and floral tones — a fruity tobacco note further complicates and elevates this cup.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Hama Honey
Review: An impressive Ethiopia honey that’s paradoxically delicate and intense, driven by sweet-tart berry, rich chocolate and spice-toned floral notes.

Name: Colombia Finca Santuario Red Bourbon Natural
Review: A high-toned, harmonious, integrated Colombia Red Bourbon natural that’s a chocolaty, fruity extravaganza.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Gutiti Gargari Natural
Review: A fruit-forward, Ethiopia with deep nut and cocoa undertones and especially vibrant, engaging body.

Name: 130 Blend
Review: A pretty blend of washed Guatemala and natural-processed Ethiopia coffees that offers berry top notes, amber underneath, and a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Gori Gesha ORO Yeast Natural G1
Review: A richly perfumed natural Ethiopia Gesha with big florals up front and complex bittersweet-tart fruit notes as ballast.

Name: Fruits Melody
Review: An invitingly complex blend of Ethiopia coffees that foregrounds citrus and stone fruit notes, supported by gentle spice and cocoa tones.

Name: Kenya Melwa AA Washed
Review: For those who prefer a savory, herbaceous Kenya, this one fits the bill with notes of juicy green tomato and tamarind, supported by lush dark chocolate notes.

Name: Matriarch
Review: A nice omni-blend designed for either filter or espresso applications — quite sweet, gently tart, rich-toned.

Name: Murphinator
Review: A deftly darker roasted blend that brings depth without sacrificing fruit and floral notes — a well-rounded, comfortingly familiar cup.

Name: Taiwan Symphony
Review: A blend of coffees from undisclosed sources in Taiwan — crisp, chocolaty, with vanilla-like floral and sweet nut tones throughout.

Name: Blue Notes
Review: An interesting blend of coffees from four origins with leading notes of nuts, raisins and cocoa powder.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Thermal Shock Red Bourbon
Review: An inviting double-anaerobic, thermal shock-processed Red Bourbon produced by Colombia’s Wilton Benitez: delicately fruit-forward, crisply cocoa-toned, very sweet.

Name: Colombia Sebastian Ramirez Washed Pink Bourbon
Review: Bright, sweetly tart stone fruit is the throughline of this washed Colombia Pink Bourbon, supported by crisp cocoa nib and delicate herb notes.

Name: Ethiopia Dale
Origin: Wensho Woreda, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Review: A lovely, classic washed Ethiopia cup with leading notes of cocoa, complex citrus, and spice-toned florals.

Name: Panama Elida Estate Geisha Natural ASD T3D Auction Lot EG6
Review: An elegant, multilayered, enticing Panama Geisha whose flavor-saturated cup fulfills its aromatic promise in spades.

Name: El Salvador La Providencia Maria Pacas Bernadina Honey
Origin: Los Naranjos, Juayua, Sonsonate, El Salvador
Review: A flavor-laden, cocoa- and floral-toned El Salvador honey with rich sweetness and inviting depth.

Name: Colombia El Vergel Martha Montenegro Rubi Marti Anaerobic
Review: An elegant, confident, multilayered anaerobic Colombia that leads with tropical fruit and baking spice notes — exceptionally sweet.

Name: Ethiopia West Arsi Washed G1
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: think cocoa nib, stone fruit, confident florals and sweet citrus — balanced, juicy, sweet and bright.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Chelbesa SNNPR Gedeo G1
Review: A deep, spice-toned, richly aromatic washed Ethiopia, vibrant and balanced.

Name: Chantilly Blend
Review: A sweet, balanced blend characterized by bright stone fruit and cocoa nib throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia Lulo Wonka Wonka & Sebastian Gomez
Review: What do you get when you cross a honey co-ferment with a natural Gesha? An extraordinary international collab between roaster and producers — this Colombia blend is exciting, dramatic, rich, complex, and above all, harmonious and integrated, and a darn good value, to boot.

Name: Colombia Finca La Reserva
Review: A fun roller coaster of a sensory ride: floral, fruity, citrusy and cocoa-toned, this complex anaerobic Colombia Geisha delights at every surprising turn.

Name: Ethiopia Agaro Gera Duromina #14
Origin: Agaro Gera, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: This washed Ethiopia profile hits all the classic notes: bright stone fruit, crisp cocoa nib, sweet florals.

Name: Ethiopia Asikana Natural
Review: A friendly natural-processed Ethiopia with leading notes of dark chocolate, red fruit, nut butter and citrus zest.

Name: Mexico Montecristo Reserve
Review: A satisfying Mexico cup with notes of dried fruit, spice-toned florals and crisp chocolate — balanced and sweet-toned.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Ayla Bombe
Review: An appealing washed Ethiopia that’s quietly confident, wide-ranging and delicately precise — those who love cleanly communicated stone fruit and citrus notes will have a winner in this cup.

Name: Anniversary Blend
Review: A blend of two African coffees to fruity-chocolaty effect — think tart cherry and crisply sweet baking chocolate.

Name: Costa Rica Anaerobic Natural
Review: A uniquely composed anaerobic Costa Rica characterized by notes of baking spices, dried stone fruit and complex bittersweet florals.

Name: Rwanda Muhororo Anaerobic
Review: A paradoxically tart and chocolaty anaerobic Rwanda with an especially full body and an intriguing amber-like nose that carries throughout the cup.

Name: Ethiopia Mr. Ocholo Bedecho
Origin: Haro Wachu, Uraga, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Ethiopia
Review: A natural-processed Ethiopia with dessert-like sweetness across a range of fruit notes, including passionfruit, fresh blueberry and coconut.

Name: Osmanthus Oolong Blend
Review: A distinct osmanthus note is the throughline of this unusual blend of Ethiopia and co-fermented anaerobic Colombia coffees — the aromas and flavors of the co-fermented coffee are more prominent than the Ethiopia.

Name: Colombia Nestor Lasso El Diviso Chiroso
Review: A fruity-tart anaerobic natural Colombia that gets ballast from notes of baking chocolate and rich aromatic cedar.

Name: Colombia Pink Champagne El Mirador Blend
Review: A deeply aromatic, integrated, berry- and floral-toned Colombia carbonic maceration with high-toned acidity and a very long, satisfying finish.

Name: Colombia Geisha
Origin: Valle de Cauca, Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A punchy, sweetly tart Colombia Geisha with especially lively, balanced acidity and a stone fruit and floral throughline.

Name: Guatemala El Injerto Malawi Geisha Washed
Review: Classic flowers and citrus. Thrillingly complex; manages to be bright and light yet resonantly deep.

Name: Guatemala El Injerto Legendary Geisha Natural Lot E1-06
Review: Both bright yet resonantly deep. Meets the challenge of the tricky natural processing method with clean, striking success.

Name: Guatemala Washed Finca La Hermosa Gesha Peaberry
Review: Juicy and alive. Classic in outline, complex in detail.

Name: Guatemala Antigua Bella Carmona Geisha
Review: Here the Geisha flowers arrive with an herby twist and lime-toned brightness.

Name: Guatemala Finca La Linea Gesha
Review: A dessert-in-the-cup style coffee; opulent, fruit-toned, chocolaty.

Name: Guatemala Bella Carmona
Review: An impressive example of the Guatemala of tradition: balanced, round, chocolate-toned.

Name: Chich’upao Guatemala
Origin: Rabinal Municipality, Baja Verapaz Department, Guatemala
Review: Perhaps the rounding and sweetening impact of the fruit flesh left on the beans during this coffee’s red honey processing contributes to its impressive fusion of sweetness and a finely calibrated, raspberry-toned acidity.

Name: Organic Guatemala Tojquia
Review: A basket of temperate fruit drives this classically balanced coffee. Lift a cup to its hard-working small-holding producer as you enjoy it.

Name: Guatemala El Socorro Laurina
Review: A naturally low-caffeine coffee with a sweet-savory structure and pleasing floral and chocolate notes.

Name: Vista Hermosa Marago-Pache
Review: Classic aroma and svelte, balanced structure distinguish this coffee, from a roaster focused both on distinctive coffees and equity for the producers of those coffees.

Name: Qunqana Ethiopia
Review: A plush, juicy, very sweet Ethiopia honey, integrated, vibrant and harmonious.

Name: Finca La Reserva Colombia Gesha Honey
Review: With its intense, candy-like sweetness and rich floral tones, this honey-processed anaerobic Colombia Gesha could easily be mistaken for a full natural — flavor-saturated and focused, both aromatically and on the palate.

Name: Ethiopia Ayla Bombe
Review: A lushly aromatic, flavor-saturated, elegant powerhouse — tantalizing on the nose and delivers in the cup.

Name: Ethiopia Arbegona Yaye Washed
Review: A deep, layered, enigmatic cup that rewards in every category, from its vibrant, balanced acidity to its viscous, delicate body — an all-around great washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Sumatra Putra Gayo Natural
Review: This rare natural-processed Sumatra offers complexity and depth with its perfumy nose and fruit-driven, cocoa-toned cup, complicated by earthy-sweet florals throughout the profile.

Name: El Salvador Finca Plan del Hoyo Microlot
Origin: Llamatepec, Apaneca growing region, El Salvador
Review: A rich-toned, multi-layered El Salvador comprised of unusual varieties of Arabica for the region — juicy, high-toned, chocolaty and harmonious.

Name: Kenya Kichwa Tembo
Review: A powerhouse Kenya: sweetly herbaceous, brightly tart, deeply sweet, floral-toned.

Name: Milano Coffee Blend
Review: A darker-roasted, cocoa-toned blend with a smoky throughline supported by nut and floral tones.

Name: Costa Rica
Review: A sweetly roasty Costa Rica with spice-toned florals and sweet dried fruit notes that has gently smoky aromatic wood undertones

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Alice Orchard Natural G1
Review: An unabashedly fruit-driven cup with notes of red berries, tropical fruit and complex citrus notes — especially vibrant, juicy-bright acidity.

Name: Kenya Gachatha
Review: A recognizably Kenyan cup with characteristic currant notes, crisp cocoa nib, and a savory resonance throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia Fruit Loops Gesha Washed
Review: A multi-layered, uniquely composed Colombia Geisha that’s equal parts fruity and floral — very rich, deep-toned.

Name: Kenya Gachatha AA Top
Review: A deep, rich, satisfyingly savory-edged Kenya that has all the classic notes: black currant, cocoa nib, spice-toned florals and sweet tomato.

Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Station Geisha Washed
Review: A lovely washed Ethiopia Geisha: bright, balanced, juicy and confident.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Lalisa Black Honey TOH#2
Review: A satisfying Ethiopia black honey with savory undertones supporting richly sweet fruit and herb notes.

Name: Colombia Tolima Villa Karina Bourbon Naranja Honey
Review: A pretty honey-processed Colombia Bourbon with notes of stone fruit, floral-toned spices and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Gimbo Geisha
Review: A high-toned Ethiopia Geisha natural with especially inviting acidity and a distinct Concord grape throughline.

Name: Sakicha
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A cleanly fruit-centered natural-processed Ethiopia with pretty citrus and spice impulses.

Name: Ethiopia Daye Bensa
Review: This natural-processed Ethiopia is cocoa-toned and crisply fruity — balanced and transparent.

Name: Ethiopia Koke Natural
Review: A richly sweet, balanced Ethiopia natural, dessert-like in the cup and supported by sweet herb and citrus notes.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Nano GIGANTE 4FC-N Geisha Washed
Review: This lushly floral and stone fruit-laden Panama Geisha dazzles with its finesse and balance — especially its juicy, high-pitched acidity and complex, nuanced aromatics. A carefully grown and roasted coffee that deserves your best brewing method.

Name: Kenya Washed Kiambu Maganjo AA TOP
Review: A recognizably Kenyan coffee with its red currant nose and floral-savory acidity — wide-ranging and deeply attractive.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Botabaa Lot
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: floral-toned, stone fruit-driven with a cocoa nib throughline, sweet citrus and resiny myrrh-like underpinnings.

Name: Bella Carmona Honey Guatemala
Review: This richly nutty, bright Guatemala has a balanced apple-like acidity and leading notes of almond nougat and red plum.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama G1 Bona Zuria Ayele Tulu Honey
Origin: Bona Zuria Woreda, Sidamo growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A very sweet, tropical fruit-driven Ethiopia natural with undertones of herbs and aromatic wood.

Name: Ecuador Galo Morales
Origin: San Jose de Minas, Pichincha, Ecuador
Review: A richly floral, sweetly herbaceous, complex, deep-toned Ecuador Sidra, vibrant and engaging.

Name: Orange Bourbon Natural
Origin: Ka‘ū growing district, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A lyrically composed Bourbon (Red + Yellow = Orange) that’s driven by rich floral notes, tropical fruit and sweet nut and citrus — compellingly deep and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Huke Premium Washed G1
Review: A great example of an affordable, meticulously processed and roasted washed Ethiopia with telltale notes of bergamot and cocoa nib — familiar yet elevated.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Huke Premium Natural G1
Review: A berry-driven, enticingly chocolaty Ethiopia natural — crisp, complex, deep-toned and supported by sweet nut and herb notes.

Name: Colombia El Vergel #1
Review: A tart-leaning washed Colombia Caturra that gets ballast from rich chocolate notes throughout the profile, and sweet-spicy citrus zest notes complicate and invite.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bensa
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia profile: elegant, stone fruit-driven, invitingly floral, cocoa-driven.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Rosechee Washed G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An exceptionally floral-toned, washed Guji with tropical fruit and myrrh-like impulses — evocative, lush, resonant.

Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Geisha
Review: A complex, rich-toned washed Ethiopia Geisha centered around rich floral and chocolate notes complicated by sweet herbs and nuts.

Name: Kenya Ibonia Estate AA
Review: A Kenya characterized by warm spice notes, vanilla-like florals, citrus zest and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Kenya Kamwangi
Origin: Gichugu Division, Kirinyaga County, central Kenya
Review: Classic currant and cocoa notes are front and center in this even-keeled, inviting Kenya cup, complicated by rich nut and complex citrus notes.

Name: Attaboy Blend
Review: A Colombia/Ethiopia blend with a chocolate throughline and stone fruit and aromatic wood undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Oromi Guji Hamela Wamena Tirtira Goyo Natural G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A sweetly citrusy, chocolaty, herbaceous natural Ethiopia that’s complex, multi-layered and deeply aromatic.

Name: Billie Blend
Review: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia and Costa Rica — a washed, a natural and a honey — with a pretty floral throughline.

Name: Acacia Hills Geisha
Review: A uniquely composed washed Tanzania Geisha that ranges from delicate florals to savory/umami impulses to sweet-tart berry notes, covering the full sensory spectrum with grace and intensity.

Name: Nsoga Iweyza Tanzania
Review: Akin to a classic Kenya in its power and finesse, this Tanzania brings it with complex berry, floral, chocolate and spice notes — flavor-laden and aromatically alive.

Name: Red
Review: A bright, vibrant natural-processed coffee that’s all berries up front with a base of cocoa nib and hazelnut throughout the profile.

Name: El Salvador El Naranjito
Review: A citrus-driven El Salvador single-estate Pacas, honey-processed — bright, balanced, juicy-sweet.

Name: Guatemala Acodihue
Review: A spice-toned, sweetly nutty washed Guatemala supported by crisp chocolate and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Rwanda Isimbi
Review: An inviting washed Rwanda — poised, richly sweet, balanced in composition.

Name: Wilton Benitez Java
Review: This Wilton Benitez thermal-shock Java is, at turns, lush and lithe, bright and bountiful — a uniquely composed, very delicious coffee that’s somewhat of a bargain in the high-end space, as well.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Narcissus Washed G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup — high-toned, balanced, with leading notes of sweet florals, stone fruit and cocoa nib.

Name: Costa Rica Brunca Don Senel
Origin: Perez Zeldon, San Jose, Costa Rica
Review: Baking chocolate and orange zest are the throughlines that carry this Costa Rica Red Honey with an especially viscous, mouth-filling body.

Name: El Salvador Ojo de Agua Carlos Poa
Review: This anaerobic El Salvador displays fruit and florals at the top, with undertones of cocoa and sweet herbs.

Name: Honduras Honey Decaf Mountain Water
Review: A very respectable water-processed decaf grown in Honduras, caramelly and crisply floral.

Name: Asobombo Colombia
Review: A richly sweet-tart, high-toned Colombia Pink Bourbon that’s confident, and right so, as it hits all the notes, from tropical fruit and the top to dark chocolate at the bottom, with a complex mid-palate of spicy florals.

Name: Alto Lagunillas by Wilson Sucaticona
Review: A washed Peru cup that offers chocolaty sweetness, fruit finesse, and vanilla-like florals throughout the nuanced profile.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Special Nano Geisha Gigante Washed Euphora Lot
Review: A vivid exemplar of Panama’s ongoing Geisha prowess — this washed coffee is classically bright, intensely sweet, complexly floral, and quite nuanced in its multi-layered appeal.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Black Diamond Bourbon
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A juicy, fruit-forward, floral-toned Costa Rica natural that evokes the tropics with its sweet-tart profile — think kiwi, lychee, pikake flower — and satiating chocolaty-sweet cup.

Name: Biru Bekele Ethiopia
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A savory throughline complicates this otherwise stone fruit- and cocoa-driven cup: a classic washed Ethiopia.

Name: Finca La Secreta Colombia Lychee Co-Ferment
Review: A uniquely composed, rich-toned, fruity Colombia processed by the anaerobic method with fresh lychee fruit added to the fermentation.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Berry Mousse Natural G1
Review: A cleanly fruit-forward, berry-driven Sidama natural supported by nut and spicy floral tones.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Citrus Glow Washed G1
Review: Citrus and sweet herbs complicate this washed Ethiopia cup, harmonizing well with stone fruit and cocoa nib.

Name: Rwanda Kinini Village
Review: This natural-processed Rwanda offers a berry and chocolate throughline, supported by rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain Natural
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: An easygoing Ethiopia natural with notes of dried stone fruit and baking chocolate throughout the cup.

Name: Natural Brazil Peaberry from Black Coffee Producers
Review:
A quietly confident, nut-toned Brazil with undertones of citrus and 
fresh-cut oak.

Name: Wonderblend
Review: A fruit extravaganza from three natural-processed coffees grown in different world regions/terroir (Java, Burundi, Ethiopia) — juicy, creamy, deeply sweet.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona Bursa Natural
Origin: Arbegona Woreda, Bursa Kebele, Sidamo Region, Ethiopia
Review: A crisp, clean Ethiopia natural centered around notes of cocoa-toned stone fruit, bittersweet nuts and sweet florals.

Name: Hundred Mango Summer Blend
Review: What do you get when you cross a classic Kenya with an anaerobic Colombia? A sweet-savory fruit bomb!

Name: Double Happiness by Brandon Jew
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: Designed in collaboration with Brandon Jew, chef of Mr. Jiu’s, this S.O. washed Ethiopia is — dare we say? — tea-like in nature with its delicate stone fruit and sweet herb throughlines.

Name: Burundi Heza Station
Review: This nuanced washed Burundi is part of NBA player Jimmy Butler’s Covid startup. A classic Burundi cup, it has a crisply chocolaty, sweet nutty profile with some backbone from tannic red grape notes.

Name: Sense of Urgency Blend
Review: A deftly darker-roasted blend designed to celebrate the 30th anniversary of Chef Thomas Keller’s The French Laundry — deeply chocolaty, gently spice-toned, sweetly earthy.

Name: Colombia Medium Roast
Review: Actress Sophia Vergara’s line of Colombia coffees celebrates her homeland and its chief export — all farmed by women. The medium roast is balanced, chocolaty and richly sweet.

Name: Brown Bear Melange AKA Kyle’s Blend
Review: You can almost smell it, smoky and rich, on the set of Twin Peaks (served in a classic diner mug, black, of course). Despite its roast prominence, this blend avoids bitterness and hits all the deep, sweet notes.

Name: Ralph’s Roast
Review: Designed in “classic coffee shop” style, this blend of coffees from Central and South America is roasted by La Colombe for iconic American fashion designer Ralph Lauren’s coffee line.

Name: Magnificent Medium Roast
Review: A sweet-toned blend of Brazil and Colombia coffees, gently drying and mellow.

Name: Social Dog
Review: A blend of coffees from Peru and Nicaragua, sweet but with a somewhat overbearing peanut throughline.

Name: How Ya Doin’?
Review: A rather flat, underwhelming blend of coffees from Colombia and Brazil, a bit stale and perhaps roasted too hot.

Name: First Class Joe (ground)
Review: A low-toned, barely sweet, quite burnt/bitter cup with a slight medicinal edge.

Name: Fighting for Justice Bold Coffee
Review: This 100% Honduras coffee was dark-roasted by Burke Brands for Rudy Giuliani’s coffee brand, Rudy. This 100% Honduras coffee was dark-roasted by Burke Brands for Rudy Giuliani’s coffee brand, Rudy. It’s a burnt, vegetal, compost cup with nothing to recommend it unless you are a fan of the cause.

Name: Harfusa Kurume Natural
Review: This natural-processed Yirgacheffe offers distinct blueberry notes throughout the cup, grounded by crisp cocoa nib and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Yirgacheffe Blend
Review: A blend of coffees from Africa and South America centered around sweet nut and crisp cocoa tones.

Name: Guatemala Ayarza
Review: This natural-processed Guatemala cup displays notes of two types of berries — brightly sweet-tart raspberry and deep, savory dried goji — and has undertones of sweet herbs and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Red Bourbon
Review: A lush, clearly expressed, fruit-forward yet balanced, high-toned Colombia Red Bourbon produced by Wilton Benitez, who’s known for his controlled processing experiments.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Yellow Bourbon
Review: An exciting, vibrant, tropical-leaning Colombia Yellow Bourbon anaerobic that’s equal parts floral and fruit-toned — especially deep, focused finish.

Name: El Salvador Monte Verde
Origin: Monte Verde, Santa Ana Department, central El Salvador
Review: A lovely El Salvador, balanced and bright, that leads with notes of dark chocolate, complex nuts, and sweet, citrusy herbs.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Gesha Thermal Shock Wine Yeast
Review: A heady, intoxicating, lushly aromatic anaerobic Colombia Gesha that’s tropical, rich and elegantly composed.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Striped Bourbon Thermal Shock
Review: This is a coffee that balances bright citrus, sweet florals and rich herbs with aplomb — it’s got a compelling intrigue very much worth pursuing.

Name: Ethiopia Mulish
Review: A multi-layered, flavor-laden washed Ethiopia with leading notes of cocoa nib, sweet herbs, and complex citrus.

Name: Organic Ethiopia Chelbessa Danche
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia — bright sweet, delicately tart, richly savory.

Name: Colombia Henry Gonzalez
Review: A satiating washed Colombia cup characterized by rich notes of stone fruit and citrus carried by butterscotch and pistachio.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Natural Decaf
Review: One of the nicest decafs in recent memory — citrusy and sweetly herbaceous with a depth few decafs achieve.

Name: Organic Driftless
Review: A friendly, familiar Peru that’s chocolate-forward with a citrus lift — and a good-value organic coffee.

Name: Ethiopia Gesha Village Oma Gesha 1931 Natural
Review: A complex, decadently sweet, flavor-saturated Ethiopia Geisha — bright, deep, satiating, lyrical.

Name: Ethiopia Djimma Limu Gummay Baby Geisha Washed
Origin: Djimma Limu, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: Deep-toned, very rich, and quite elegant, lithely powerful and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochere Halo Hartume Washed G1
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup with its characteristic notes of stone fruit, cocoa nib and sweet florals, all of which harmonize throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Bule Hambela TOH#1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A pretty floral-toned washed Ethiopia supported by a dark chocolate throughline — balanced, juicy, richly sweet.

Name: China Zuoyuan Biodynamic Washed Geisha
Review: A lovely Geisha grown in China’s Yunnan Province, with leading notes of stone fruit and chocolate — worth a detour to get your hands on this rare coffee from an emerging region.

Name: Ethiopia Gedeo Yirgacheffe Gerbota Washed G1
Review: A bright, juicy washed Ethiopia, multi-layered and rich, with stone fruit and chocolate notes throughout the profile.

Name: Mist + Wood Blend
Review: A solid daily drinker, this Central/South American blend hits all the comfort notes: chocolate, fruit and florals.

Name: Misty 23.5N
Review: A friendly, accessible, Taiwan-produced SL34 natural that’s berry- and cocoa-toned.

Name: Colombia La Serrania Decaf Washed
Review: A very respectable, chocolaty and sweetly nutty Colombia decaf, crisp and balanced.

Name: St. Helena Bamboo Hedge Estate
Review: A coffee as interesting for its rare origin (the island of St. Helena) as its friendly, chocolaty and nut-toned cup.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas SL28 Double-Diamond Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: An enticing double-anaerobic Costa Rica with subtle lactic notes supporting baking chocolate, rich nut butter and stone fruit.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Bensa Blue Donkey 24/1
Review: A very inviting natural-processed Ethiopia — exquisitely clean, complex, balanced and flavor-saturated, lyrically bright and paradoxically deep.

Name: Peru Washed Los Santos Farm Gesha
Review: A pristinely classic washed Peru cup, richly chocolaty with undertones of spicy florals — especially complex finish.

Name: Peru Black Honey Los Santos Farm Gesha
Review: An evocative, deep natural Peru cup that highlights notes of stone fruit and complex herb notes with a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Nyeri Hill Kenya
Review: A berry-sweet, gently herbaceous, tart/savory Kenya cup, complex and rich.

Name: Colombia Tabi La Roca
Review: Equal parts fruity and chocolatey, this uncommon variety is anaerobically processed to highlight intense sweet-tartness, while dessert-like chocolate notes provide the grounding undercurrent.

Name: Nemba Burundi
Review: A flavor-saturated, nuanced Burundi — bright, juicy, rich-toned, deep.

Name: Malaysia Liberica Anaerobic Natural N26
Review: A uniquely composed cup — complex sweet-savory impulses harmonize in this Malaysian-grown Liberica with an especially plush body that’s worth getting your hands on.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama West Arsi Nansebo Natural G1
Review: A multi-layered, natural-processed Ethiopia centered around notes of dried tropical fruit and richly sweet florals — the bright, juicy acidity provides nice ballast for all the lush sweetness.

Name: Ethiopia Moonlight Delight Wine Process Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A decadently fruit-forward Ethiopia natural with notes of tropical fruit as a throughline and ballast from crisp cocoa nib and rich narcissus.

Name: Colombia Caldas Twilight Geisha Natural
Review: A berry-driven natural Colombia with undertones of amber and cocoa nib supported by spice-toned florals.

Name: Zambia Kateshi
Review: A chocolaty-tart anaerobic natural Zambia with a sweet nut throughline.

Name: Colombia Narino Sugarcane Decaf
Review: Rich aromatic wood notes carry this crisply caramelly decaf cup with notes of sweet florals and dried fruit.

Name: Colombia La Victoria Ethiopia Landrace
Review: An inviting Colombia washed anaerobic with leading notes of sweet-tart fruits and crisp cocoa powder with amber-like resiny aromas.

Name: Wilton Benitez Orange Bourbon
Review: Another creative and beautifully composed double-anaerobic/thermal shock-processed coffee by Colombia’s Wilton Benitez, this one from the rare Orange Bourbon varietal.

Name: Dukunde Kawa Rwanda
Review: A confident, accessible, balanced Rwanda farmed by members of the Dukunde Kawa Cooperative — sweet-toned and comfortingly familiar.

Name: Costa Rica Tarrazú Tirra
Origin: San Marcos, Tarrazú growing region, Costa Rica
Review: A uniquely composed Costa Rica natural that ranges from tropical-tart kefir-like notes at the top and rich nut tones as a supportive throughline.

Name: Kona Maragogype
Review: A lovely, rich-toned, chocolaty and floral Kona Maragogype complicated by sweet herb notes.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Bensa Bombe
Review: A richly floral-toned, chocolaty, flavor-laden and precise natural Ethiopia — complex, multi-layered, enticing.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Bench Maji Baby Lucy Gesha
Review: A lovely washed Ethiopia Gesha that displays rich florals, deep chocolate and complex citrus throughout the profile — elegant and harmonious.

Name: Taiwan Natural Meishan Ching-Ye Farm Lot 0116
Review: A cleanly natural-processed, juicy-crisp Taiwan cup centered around notes of stone fruit, cocoa and floral-toned spices.

Name: Gesha Spirits
Review: Equal parts elegant and bold, vibrant and subtle, this Colombia anaerobic Gesha is wide-ranging and yet aromatically focused — floral, tropical, chocolaty.

Name: Colombia El Jardin Anaerobic Natural
Review: A wide-ranging, flavor-saturated anaerobic-natural Colombia — delicately bright and nicely balanced.

Name: Colombia Carmen Montoya Chiroso
Review: A pretty, stone fruit-driven cup with sweet nut and complex citrus tones throughout.

Name: Colombia Black Condor
Review: A deeply aromatic, floral-toned washed Colombia cup with a throughline of baking spice notes, most prominently nutmeg.

Name: Colombia La Victoria Spicy Bourbon
Review: A fruity washed-anaerobic Colombia complicated by bittersweet floral notes (think hop flowers) throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia El Silencio Castillo Natural
Review: A quietly confident Colombia natural with an especially full, syrupy body and notes of dried stone fruit throughout.

Name: Oshiro Dark Roast
Review: A deftly darker-roasted blend that preserves the rich sweetness and chocolaty depth of these coffees without harshness.

Name: Mexico Decaf
Review: A very sweet, distinctly smoky Mexico decaf whose gentle bitterness is balanced by notes of cocoa butter and raisin.

Name: Ethiopia Chelba Natural
Origin: Chelba Station , Yirgacheffe, Gedeo Zone, SNNPR,Ethiopia
Review: This single-variety natural Ethiopia leads with tropical fruit and toffee notes, complicated by a delicate floral throughline.

Name: When Strawberry Meets Lemon
Review: A tangy-bright, chocolaty, fruit-forward blend, enigmatic and uniquely composed.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A stone fruit-driven, classic washed Ethiopia supported by notes of rich florals, sweet nuts, and complex citrus.

Name: Las Margaritas Geisha Honey
Review: This honey-processed Colombia Geisha hits all the right notes, leading with deep berry and sweet chocolate, supported by rich floral and resiny amber-like tones.

Name: Colombia Papayo
Review: An elegant, nuanced Colombia cup carried by bright stone fruit and spicy-sweet floral notes, with especially vibrant, silky mouthfeel.

Name: Las Margaritas Sudan Rume Natural
Review: A nuanced, fruit-forward but intricately balanced Sudan Rume (a rare variety of Arabica) — flavor-saturated, deep-toned, resonant.

Name: India Pearl Mountain Estate
Review: A lovely carbonic macerated India that highlights tropical fruit, sweet spice notes and a hint of wine-like ferment.

Name: Colombia Green Apple Castillo
Review: A Colombia Castillo co-fermented with green apple to sweet-tart, juicy-bright effect; this high-toned cup gets ballast from a throughline of raw cacao.

Name: Lite Bite
Review: A developed, sweetly roast-toned blend, very sweet and deep with leading notes of baking chocolate and caramel.

Name: Colombia La Palma Y Tucán Heroes Series Geisha
Review: Dessert-like in its sweetness, this experimentally processed Colombia offers versions of fruit notes in their candylike incarnations (think watermelon and pineapple).

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Bensa Anaerobic Washed
Review: A lactic-leaning anaerobic washed Ethiopia with apricot and pineapple notes front and center — tangy-sweet, perky, complex.

Name: Java Riunggunung Estate
Review: An inviting, deeply rich, flavor-saturated Java cup with notes of red stone fruit, complex citrus and cedar.

Name: Colombia Jairo Arcila
Review: A comfortingly familiar, classic Colombia cup, crisply cocoa-toned and balanced with pretty citrus notes throughout the profile.

Name: Rwanda Kiyonza Hill
Origin: Ngoma Sector, Nyaruguru District, Southern Province, Rwanda
Review: An especially deep-bodied, balanced Rwanda cup with citrusy acidity and sweet herb undertones.

Name: Colombia El Jordan Washed
Review: A classically chocolaty washed Colombia complicated by stone fruit and spice-toned herbs.

Name: Colombia Luis Calderon
Review: Tropical fruit notes carry this brightly sweet-tart Colombia, supported by crisp chocolate and lemongrass tones.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Anaerobic Washed
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A deep-toned anaerobic washed Ethiopia driven by berry notes supported by crisp cocoa nib — lushly sweet, gently tart.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Orange Blossom Washed G1
Review: A deep, delicate, confident washed Ethiopia, resonantly and elegant citrusy.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Sidama Bensa Single Variety 74158
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A vibrant, flavor-saturated, richly aromatic washed single-variety Ethiopia, headily inviting and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Berry Gummies 74158 Natural G1
Review: This natural-processed, single-variety Ethiopia has a candy-like profile with both sweet and tart impulses.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Floral Blueberry Natural G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A berry-toned, crisply chocolaty Ethiopia natural complicated by spice-toned florals.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Uraga Tome Variety 74110
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, sweet-toned washed Ethiopia characterized by bright apricot and cocoa nib notes, alongside spicy-sweet florals.

Name: Guatemala Bella Carmona
Review: A rich, deeply sweet washed Guatemala whose profile centers around citrus, almond and spice-toned florals, supported by sweet heb notes.

Name: Burundi Kayanza Cima Yeast Natural
Review: A richly sweet yeast-inoculated Burundi natural with distinct cantaloupe notes supported by amber-like resin and spice-toned florals.

Name: Wilton Benitez Sidra
Review: A candy-like, viscous, brightly juicy Colombia Sidra, confident and flavor-saturated.

Name: Putra Gayo Sumatra
Review: Tart fruit, rich chocolate, and sweet herb notes characterize this washed Sumatra.

Name: Nsoga Iweyza Tanzania Peaberry
Review: A sweetly savory, richly floral- and spice-toned Tanzania.

Name: Yusra Sumatra
Review: A washed Sumatra centered around notes of baking spices and berries with a pretty floral throughline.

Name: Citrus Notes Ethiopia Blend
Review: A complex, citrusy blend of Ethiopia coffees that exhibits both sweet and tart citrus profiles, alongside a throughline of crisp cocoa nib.

Name: Colombia José Julián Giraldo Pink Bourbon Panela Sticky
Review: The panela sticky method is aptly named — this coffee is nectar-like and plushly syrupy, with a citrus lift throughout the profile.

Name: Kenya Gatirima AA
Review: This single-variety (SL34) Kenya is balanced, juicy, and bright, with classic notes of currant and cocoa nib and exceptionally balanced acidity.

Name: Kenya Washed Kirinyaga Getuya AA Top
Review: An exceptionally vibrant, juicy, flavor-laden, and richly aromatic Kenya with notes of classic currant, deep chocolate, and tropical florals.

Name: Guatemala Honey Finca El General Gesha
Review: Lush floral notes reminiscent of wisteria carry this pretty honey-processed Gesha from Guatemala, which has especially bright, vibrant acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Bacha 74110
Review: An impeccably processed single-variety Ethiopia (74110) that leads with juicy tropical fruit notes, languid florals, and balancing sweet herbs.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Adame G1 Washed 95
Review: Deeply aromatic, complex and rich, this G1-washed Yirgacheffe delivers in all categories with its balanced brightness, viscosity and interesting smoky spice note (unrelated to roast).

Name: Colombia Linarco Rodriguez Ospina Pink Bourbon Washed 94
Review: An unassuming initial break opens up on the table with big florals, stone fruit and complex citrus notes throughout the cup and into the very long finish.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Haro Adama Washed G1
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia profile: richly aromatic, vibrant, enticingly complex.

Name: Ecuador Mejorado Washed
Review: A lively, chocolate- and herb-driven washed Ecuador with a throughline of red apple notes supported by crisp maple syrup.

Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña / Black Honey Watermelon & Lulo Co-Ferment
Review: Candy-sweet in its profile, this co-fermented Colombia Castillo evokes the tropics with a side of spicy florals.

Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña / Black Honey Pink Bourbon Mosto & Passionfruit Co-Ferment
Review: A floral and fruit extravaganza, with passionfruit and star jasmine notes leading the way, complicated by myrrh-like underpinnings.

Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña Juice Box Processing Set / Natural Carbonic Maceration
Review: A richly floral, incredibly sweet carbonic macerated Colombia with tea rose notes at center, supported by orange marmalade.

Name: Colombia Edwin Enrique Noreña Pink Bourbon
Review: This balanced, fruit-forward cup, processed by carbonic maceration and co-fermented with berries and passionfruit, does precisely what it is trying to do — it amplifies the inherent elegance of Pink Bourbon with high-acid fruits for a uniquely composed profile.

Name: Thailand Quiet Endless Searching Natural
Review: A lovely natural processed coffee from Thailand that’s deep-toned and laden with spice and floral notes.

Name: Rwanda Humure Abishyizehamwe Low-Oxygen Natural
Origin: Remera Sector, Gatsibo District, Eastern Province, Rwanda
Review: A delicate, enticing, richly sweet Rwanda processed by a natural method that is a kind of “soft anaerobic,” as some oxygen is allowed during the whole-cherry fermentation process.

Name: Candy Crush
Review: A complex, exceptionally sweet blend of washed and natural-processed Ethiopias grounded by cocoa nib and nut tones.

Name: Doho Classic Blend
Review: A richly sweet blend centered around crisp chocolate, rich almond, and sweet floral notes.

Name: Heat Blend
Review: An easygoing blend that highlights sweet nut and caramel tones with hints of floral and aromatic wood throughout the profile.

Name: Panama Clara Finca Auromar
Review: A playful, expressive natural-processed Panama characterized by bright fruit, deep chocolate, and spicy floral notes throughout the profile.

Name: Panama Carmen
Review: A nimble washed Panama Caturra with wide-ranging aromatics and flavors, elevated but accessible.

Name: Kona Geisha Peaberry Yeast Fermentation Washed
Review: An aromatically focused, richly floral Kona Geisha with undertones of dried stone fruit and complex citrus — compelling, coherent, harmonious, integrated.

Name: Puttin’ On the Ritz Guatemala
Origin: El Sapito, San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, Guatemala
Review: A bright, juicy, richly full-bodied natural-processed Guatemala, guest-roasted in a competition held by Big Shoulders.

Name: Colombia Finca La Secreta Lychee Caturra Anaerobic
Review: Colombia Caturra co-fermented with Lychee for dramatic and delicious effect — think floral bomb carried by distinct lychee notes (and cocoa nib).

Name: Colombia Lychee Co-Ferment
Review: A flavor-bomb of a co-fermented anaerobic — Finca La Secreta’s Caturra processed with lychee is for the coffee lover who hasn’t quite yet tried everything.

Name: Reserve Costa Rica Don Noel SL28
Review: This uniquely composed SL28 (traditionally a Kenyan variety) grown in Costa Rica and honey-processed offers an inviting savory throughline juxtaposed with dark fruit and complex herb impulses.

Name: Costa Rica Sumava Anaerobic
Review: Rife with layers of fruit and florals, this anaerobic natural Costa Rica is also balanced, deep-toned, and plushly syrupy on the palate.

Name: Colombia Betulia Natural Caturron
Review: An exceptionally sweet, gently tart Colombia natural with leading notes of hibiscus and candy apple, complicated by cocoa nib and rich aromatic wood tones.

Name: Costa Rica Sin Limites Gesha
Review: A delicate honey-processed Costa Rica Gesha that evokes the tropics with its fruity profile, and magnolia-like florals deepen the sweetness.

Name: Ethiopia Rumadamo Anaerobic Washed
Origin: Bensa, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A meticulously processed anaerobic washed Ethiopia with distinct, lilting notes of wild raspberry and tangerine supported by crisp cocoa nib — plushly sweet, delicately tart, invitingly complex.

Name: Ethiopia Djimma Limu Gummay Baby Geisha G1 Washed
Origin: Jimma Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A washed Ethiopia poster child: bright, balanced, juicy, complex, and very, very sweet.

Name: La Papaya Pacamara Natural Ecuador
Review: A deeply aromatic, fruity, richly floral Ecuador natural with especially bright, vibrant acidity.

Name: Palo de Rosa Pink Bourbon Colombia
Review: A fun, lively, juicy-bright, richly aromatic, impeccably processed Colombia Pink Bourbon.

Name: Ruvumu Natural #13 Burundi
Review: An intensely sweet, invitingly tart, berry-toned Burundi yeast natural that gets ballast from spice-toned florals.

Name: Blue
Review: A straight-ahead, balanced, crisply chocolaty cup supported by nice citrus and stone fruit notes throughout the profile.

Name: Rwanda Rambagirakawa
Review: A classic Rwanda cup characterized by high-toned notes of stonefruit, delicately sweet florals, and tart citrus — vibrant and rich.

Name: Colombia Rigoberto Herrera Granja La Esperanza Hybrid Washed Gesha
Review: Sweet and spice-toned florals are front and center in this experimentally processed Colombia Geisha with gently bright stone fruit, sweet herb, and pretty citrus notes throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia El Diviso
Review: A multi-layered Colombia Sidra processed by the anaerobic thermal shock method — a sensory roller coaster that covers all the sweet, savory and floral bases.

Name: Colombia Limited Release 2024
Review: A lactic-anaerobic Colombia with a sweet pineapple tanginess throughout and undertones of cocoa nib, complex citrus, and spice-toned florals.

Name: Rationed Passion
Review: A friendly medium-roasted blend centered around sweet, creamy cashew notes, with crisp chocolate and caramel undertones.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Orange Bourbon
Review: A uniquely composed, jammy, chocolaty double-anaerobic Orange Bourbon with resiny aromatics and sweet herb undertones.

Name: Rwanda Crown Jewel Akanduga
Review: A complex, citrusy, floral-driven washed anaerobic Rwanda — juicy, bright, inviting.

Name: Rwanda Kinini Village
Review: A natural-processed Rwanda that’s citrusy and bright; it gets ballast from cocoa nib and thyme notes throughout the profile.

Name: Masha #5 Burundi
Review: A deeply sweet, subtly fruit-forward natural-processed Burundi characterized by notes of toffee, spice-toned florals and sassafras-like undercurrent.

Name: Dimtu Ethiopia
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: This washed Ethiopia is a sweetly tart, high-toned, citrusy coffee complicated by sweet herb and stone fruit notes.

Name: Buesaco Colombia
Review: A solid washed Colombia cup, classic in its bright acidity and crisp chocolate throughline.

Name: Colombia El Vergel #1
Review: A flavor-saturated, chocolaty, sweetly nut- and floral-toned washed Colombia with especially vibrant acidity — balanced, bright, and an exceptional value.

Name: Colombia Luna Azul
Review: A confidently fruity, richly chocolaty Colombia black honey complicated by sweet citrus and florals and pungent aromatic wood.

Name: Colombia Cauca Castillo K-01
Review: An herbal tea-like aromatic profile with notes of baking spices and sweet florals characterizes this inviting, double-anaerobic Colombia.

Name: Colombia El Paraiso Lychee Rose
Review: A lush, flavor-saturated anaerobic Colombia with leading notes of tropical fruit and dusky rose; exceptionally bright, balanced acidity.

Name: Colombia Cauca Castillo YN-05
Review: A very sweet, very clean anaerobic cup fermented with yellow-fruit yeast for a subtle yet distinctive brightness.

Name: Colombia Cauca Finca EI Paraiso 92 Pink Bourbon
Review: A nuanced, complex, invitingly rich Colombia anaerobic Pink Bourbon with grace, depth and balance.

Name: Costa Rica Hacienda Copey Black Honey
Review: A delicately perfumed, very sweet black honey-processed Costa Rica with an especially plush body.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Kercha Sakicha Red Honey 74112
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A savory-leaning, floral-toned Ethiopia red honey with rich nut and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Dragon Year Blend
Review: A sweetly herbaceous, crisply chocolaty blend with a spicy floral throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Shantawene Single-Origin
Review: A berry-driven natural-processed Ethiopia with crisp chocolate undertones and sweet nut notes throughout.

Name: Guatemala Huehuetenango Asodiett Cooperative
Review: A cocoa-toned, nut-driven Guatemala cup complicated by hints of spicy florals throughout.

Name: Talitha Sunrise Signature Blend
Review: A friendly, accessible medium-roast blend that emphasizes crisp chocolate and sweet nut tones.

Name: Rwanda Muhororo
Review: A friendly, accessible washed Rwanda with appealing sweet nut and delicate spice notes.

Name: Colombia Mokka Anaerobic Natural Finca Hawaii
Review: A unique — and uniquely compelling  Colombia-grown Mokka from Hawaiian seeds, experimentally fermented to dramatic (fruity, spicy, savory) effect. Complex, elusive, evocative.

Name: Kona Geisha Washed
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona District, “Big Island” of Hawaiʻi
Review: A Hawaiian-grown Geisha that evokes the finest Geishas of Panama in much the way certain coastal Sonoma Chardonnays approach world-class Chablis. It’s elegant, confident, multi-layered and lyrically coherent.

Name: Colombia Huila Double-Fermentation Single-Origin Coffee
Review: This deeply aromatic, tart-leaning double-fermented Colombia is vibrant and rich, with an especially full, viscous body.

Name: Rwanda Buhuro COOPAC
Review: An engagingly citrusy, cocoa-toned natural-processed Rwanda cup with an especially plush, viscous body and sweetly spicy floral undertones.

Name: Karen J Kona Red Bourbon Anaerobic
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A harmonious, vibrant anaerobically processed Kona Red Bourbon with floral-toned cocoa and honey notes throughout, complicated by crisp pear and resiny amber.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A richly fruit-forward, floral-toned natural Ethiopia supported by citrus and honey notes — complex, multi-faceted, intriguing.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Chelchele Washed G1
Review: Rich floral tones support a throughline of stone fruit and sweet citrus notes in this classic washed Ethiopia profile.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Hill
Review: A classic Kenya profile with notes of stone fruit and citrus front and center, as well as bright, balanced acidity — very sweet, elegantly tart.

Name: El Salvador El Mirador
Review: Sweet and savory floral notes play with sweet citrus and cocoa nib in this natural-processed El Salvador Pacamara.

Name: Colombia Las Brisas Anaerobic Washed
Review: A uniquely composed Colombia Bourbon that’s co-fermented with chili peppers to interesting effect: Tropical fruit notes support the umami impulse.

Name: Spring Blend
Review: A quietly confident blend of washed Guatemala and natural-processed Ethiopia, the former contributing complex nut tones, and the latter, structured fruit.

Name: Kenya Gaturiri
Review: A recognizably Kenyan cup with its distinct currant notes — gets ballast from deep, sweet toffee and complicated by bittersweet hop flowers.

Name: Colombia Wilder Lasso Geisha Lot 2 Anaerobic Washed
Review: This complex, nuanced Colombia Geisha, a washed anaerobic, evokes the tropics with its sweet-tart fruit and spice-toned floral notes, integrated with a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bombe Tadisa
Origin: Bombe mountains, Sidamo Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A natural-processed Ethiopia with dried stone fruit notes at the center, supported by distinct honey, sweet nut, and spice-toned florals.

Name: Peru Cafe de Mujer
Review: A rich, very chocolaty washed Peru with nuanced citrus, nut and floral tones throughout.

Name: The Mid-Range Half-Caff Blend
Review: A hearty, spice-toned blend of Ethiopia coffees, one decaffeinated — a good choice for when you don’t want to be too amped — chocolaty and richly

Name: Riripa Ethiopia
Origin: Riripa Village, West Arsi, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Review: Richly floral (think magnolia tree in full bloom) and berry-toned (black raspberry) with a musky-resinous, amber-like throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Uraga Haro Adama
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An elegant, deeply aromatic, nuanced Ethiopia cup — a washed classic.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Kaffa Lot Taco
Review: This confident and restrained washed Ethiopia is a special Kakalove lot named after a teammate, Taco, and it’s uniquely composed: delicately sweet-savory, enigmatic, exciting.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Karamo Niguse Gemeda 74158
Review: For those who like clean natural Ethiopias that are delicately tea like and fruit-forward but balanced, this coffee fits the bill.

Name: Murundo People’s Farm Rwanda
Review: A decidedly savory-forward Rwanda with distinct citrus and spice tones throughout the profile.

Name: Guatemala Natural Finca El General Bourbon/Catuai
Review: An invitingly familiar, sweetly tart natural-processed Guatemala that offers rich nut and deep fruit notes throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambella Strawberry Truffles Kurume G1 Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A uniquely composed, richly savory, sweetly herbaceous washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Pear Gummies G1 Washed
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An intentionally fermenty, sweet-toned washed Ethiopia with citrus and cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Kianjogu AA TOP Washed
Review: A nuanced Kenya with characteristic currant notes alongside umami impulses and sweet citrus.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Kiawamururu AA
Origin: Kiawamururu, Nyeri growing region, south-central Kenya
Review: A juicy, bright, chocolaty Kenya with an especially inviting, plush body.

Name: Guatemala La Flor Limited Edition
Review: An accessible, nutty-sweet Guatemala cup with notes of bittersweet citrus zest and crisp chocolate throughout.

Name: Colombia La Esperanza Red Bourbon
Review: A lovely rendition of the Red Bourbon variety from Colombia — complex, deep, rich and lush.

Name: Guatemala Alto Refugio
Review: An invitingly sweet, floral-toned washed Guatemala complicated by a citrusy herbaceousness.

Name: Guatemala Finca Al Bosque
Review: A classic Guatemala profile at its best: richly chocolaty; sweetly nutty, gently floral.

Name: Kenya Super C
Review: A sweetly savory, gently wood-framed Kenya cup with sweet and tart fruit notes throughout the profile.

Name: Oiran Blend
Review: A blend of African and South American coffees with particularly bright acidity and a throughline of citrus zest and crisp chocolate.

Name: Waxing All-Purpose Coffee Blend
Review: A solid omni-blend that’s also a terrific value — deep-toned, richly sweet, quite chocolaty with lift from citrus zest.

Name: Colombia Red Honey Geisha Campo Hermoso
Review: A high-toned, pretty, complexly aromatic red honey Colombia that leads with berry and cocoa notes with undertones of spicy florals.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Karamo Anaerobic Natural
Review: A multi-layered, tartly fruit-centered, tangy, cocoa-laden anaerobic natural Ethiopia with enigmatic layers of sweet and savory impulses.

Name: El Salvador Finca San Antonio Pacas Natural
Origin: Apaneca Illamatepec growing region, Juayúa, El Salvador
Review: Deep, bright, juicy and richly bittersweet, this El Salvador Pacas natural covers all the sweet-tart-savory bases.

Name: Colombia Chiroso Caturra Washed
Review: A decadently sweet, richly perfumed Colombia from a lesser-known variety — confident, high-toned, floral and deep.

Name: Kona SL 34 Anaerobic Washed Kona Rainforest
Origin: South Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A Kenyan variety of Arabica grown on the Big Island of Hawai’i, this coffee is a Kenya twin but more fruit-forward with notes of stone fruit and citrus.

Name: Colombia Yellow Geisha Granja Paraiso 92
Review: A decadently sweet, complex experimentally processed Colombia Yellow Geisha; the roaster describes this coffee as giving the impression of rainbow shave ice, and he’s not wrong!

Name: Colombia Chachagüí Mild Roast
Review: An enigmatic, complex, natural-processed Colombia driven by notes of warming spices with floral and cocoa tones throughout the profile.

Name: Ka‘ū Classic Medium Roast
Origin: Ka‘ū growing district, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A pleasing, chocolaty, floral-toned washed Ka‘ū cup with pretty notes of citrus, stone fruit and sweet herbs.

Name: Colombia Thermal Shock Double Anaerobic Granja Paraiso Orange Gesha
Review: A complex, richly sweet, deeply savory double-anaerobic Colombia with riveting berry and stone fruit notes alongside umami impulses.

Name: Colombia Granja Paraiso 92 Anaerobic Gesha
Review: A balanced, fruit-driven anaerobic Colombia with undertones of rich aromatic wood and sweet herbs.

Name: Kenya Gaturiri
Review: A classic Kenya cup that leads with notes of red currant and has undertones of sweet herbs, rich aromatic wood, and distinct dark chocolate.

Name: Colombia Sunrise
Review: A classic washed Colombia Pink Bourbon that’s a trifecta of fruit, florals and spice tones, all supported by a cocoa throughline.

Name: Manhattan Beach Blend
Review: A solid, familiar, welcoming blend of washed coffees from Colombia, Ethiopia and Honduras, resulting in a chocolaty, floral-toned cup.

Name: Colombia Paraiso 92 Geisha Double Anaerobic
Review: Resonant, deep-toned, multi-layered, this experimentally processed Colombia Geisha delivers pungent aromatics and complexity throughout the cup.

Name: Kenya Blackberry Honey
Review: A berry-driven, cocoa-toned Kenya cup with sweet herb undertones and an especially viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Ethiopia Honey Peach of Floral Language
Review: A pretty, inviting delicately sweet-tart Ethiopia centered around notes of stone fruit, cocoa nib and sweet florals.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Natural Tsigered G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A gently berry-toned, natural-processed Ethiopia with a throughline of cocoa nib complicated by tart-leaning tamarind.

Name: Putra Gayo Sumatra
Review: A fully washed Sumatra (unusual in the region of wet hulling), richly chocolaty and redolent of baking spices, especially clove.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Heidenröslein Anaerobic Washed G1
Origin: Bensa District, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Review: Richly floral, deeply sweet, spice-toned — this washed anaerobic Ethiopia hits a range of spot-on notes and has an exceptionally nuanced acidity.

Name: Kenya Gachika
Review: This nuanced, harmonious Kenya leads with notes of cocoa nib and stone fruit, with ballast from sweet herb and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Kurume Natural
Review: A cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia driven by sweet fruit and rich floral tones, with a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Yu He Pao Litchi
Review: Tropical fruit notes carry this anaerobically processed Colombia with deep floral and crisp cocoa tones throughout.

Name: Bali Kintamani
Review: A natural-processed Bali with delicate berry notes and crisp chocolate front and center.

Name: Ethiopia Agaro Duromina
Origin: Agaro Gera, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: A gentle spice throughline (think pink peppercorn, freesia) characterizes this otherwise citrusy, cocoa-toned washed Ethiopia.

Name: Claremont Blend
Review: A comfortingly familiar cup profile, deeply chocolaty, sweetly nutty, and complicated by rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Black Honey Guji Wate Lot Tabby
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An elegant, richly floral, fruit-toned Ethiopia black honey, high-toned and complex.

Name: Finca Vista Hermosa Edwin’s Reserve Guatemala
Review: A pretty, deep-toned Guatemala cup with leading notes of stone fruit and dark chocolate — balanced, juicy, richly sweet.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Perla Negra
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Review: A deep-toned, richly aromatic, confident natural-processed Costa Rica redolent of wild berries, sweet florals, and nuanced aromatic wood notes.

Name: Kagunyu Kenya
Review: A classic Kenya cup with its bright currant, cocoa nib and citrus impulses, and its sparkling acidity — and recognizably so, both aromatically and in the flavor profile.

Name: Wilton Benitez Colombia Chiroso
Review: Like the tropics in a cup with its lilting pineapple and lychee notes, fruit-forward and grounded by crisp chocolate and aromatic wood tones.

Name: Costa Rica Rivense La Guaca
Review: Intensely sweet and fruit-focused, with ballast from crisp cocoa nib and lift from bittersweet citrus notes.

Name: Kariaini Kenya
Review: A berry-forward, floral-toned Kenya with pretty undercurrents of cocoa nib, sweet herbs, and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Yaye Chericho Ethiopia
Review: A flavor-saturated Ethiopia, bright with citrus and spice-toned florals throughout and especially vibrant, high-toned acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Sasaba Guji
Review: A classic natural-processed Ethiopia centered around harmonious fruit notes supported by cocoa nib — balanced and inviting.

Name: Kenya AA Top Gicherori
Review: A deftly roasted darker profile with rich chocolate and invitingly smoky cedar notes — it would not be a sacrilege to add a bit of half-and-half, which intensifies the chocolate and floral notes.

Name: Colombia Finca Milan Washed Nitro Caturra
Review: A layered, enigmatic, experimentally processed Colombia, rich with complex fruit, floral and herb notes throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia JemJem
Origin: Wenago district, Gedeo Zone, SNNPR, Ethiopia
Review: This delicately fruit-forward, natural-processed Ethiopia leads with tropical aromas — both fruit and florals — and delivers in the cup; especially full, viscous body.

Name: Peru Wiliam Shakespeare Roman Washed
Review: A quietly confident, nuanced washed Peru with a range of aroma and flavor notes from stone fruit to citrus blossoms.

Name: El Salvador Trifinio Blend Medium Roast
Review: A friendly, easygoing El Salvador, roasted to medium, that foregrounds cocoa, almond and delicate floral tones.

Name: Kenya Estate 28-Day Natural Microlot
Review: An unusual Kenya profile — natural-processed, rather than the traditional washed — with clean fruit and sweet nut tones throughout.

Name: Guatemala La Esperanza Anaerobic
Review: An intriguingly complex, richly fruit-forward Guatemala anaerobic centered around citrus and candy notes, with ballast from distinct herb impulses.

Name: Sumatra Pantan Musara
Origin: Pegasing, Takengon, Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: A fully washed Sumatra with a cocoa nib throughline punctuated by citrus and sweet herb notes.

Name: DRC Katana Natural
Origin: Kabare, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: This natural-processed DRC leads with bright berry notes and has undertones of sweet herbs and crisp chocolate.

Name: PNG Korgua Estate Natural
Origin: Nebilyer Valley, Western Highlands, Papua New Guinea
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered natural-process PNG with leading notes of sweet citrus and elegant florals.

Name: Costa Rica Candelilla Gesha
Review: A juicy-sweet, high-toned natural-processed Costa Rica Gesha that offers stone fruit and citrus notes up front, with undertones of cocoa nib, delicate florals and sweet herbs.

Name: Kona Red Bourbon Anaerobic Washed Kona Rainforest
Origin: South Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A uniquely composed yeast-fermented organic Kona with spice-toned floral notes and sweet citrus throughout.

Name: Colombia Geisha Claudia Samboni
Review: A complex, lush, flavor-saturated Colombia Geisha cup: bright, deep, reichly sweet and very nuanced.

Name: Ethiopia Ethiopia Limu Baby Geisha Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A harmonious, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia Geisha,  deeply fruit-toned and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Violet Love Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A natural-processed Ethiopia with especially high-toned acidity, anchored by blueberry and chocolate notes.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Ethiopian Accessions
Review: An exciting and unusual cup profile: spice-toned citrus and umami florals center this Panama-grown version of Ethiopian Arabica varieties.

Name: Hawai’i Kona Peaberry Darnall Estate
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A very sweet, harmonious traditionally washed Kona with pretty floral notes throughout the profile.

Name: Yellow
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: bright, balanced, juicy and confident.

Name: Ethiopia Israel Degefa Wush Wush
Origin: Sama, Ana Sora District, Oromia Region, Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, sophisticated natural-processed Ethiopia Wush Wush with clean tropical fruit and berry notes, supported by a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Kona Noir
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A uniquely composed Kona-grown SL-34 processed with Champagne yeasts for a complex, nuanced, flavor-saturated cup.

Name: Kenya Ndaroini AA
Review: A juicy, high-toned Kenya with richly sweet, cookie-like undertones.

Name: Costa Rica Palomas
Review: A quietly confident, complex Costa Rica with wide-ranging aromatics and flavors.

Name: Sumatra Takengon
Review: A rare fully washed Sumatra, deep-toned and paradoxically bright with an especially full body.

Name: Flagship Blend
Review: A blend balanced between chocolate and nut impulses, supported by rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Honduras Marcala
Review: A friendly, engaging, natural-processed Honduras characterized by warm spice and sweet berry notes throughout.

Name: Sierra Verde Blend
