Review: A deftly darker-roasted blend with organic, fair trade, and Rain Forest Alliance credentials.

Name: My Old Friend Dark Roast
Review: A nuanced dark roast blend with rich cocoa and spicy-sweet floral impulses.

Name: Laura’s Reserve SL34
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An aromatically intoxicating Kona version of a traditionally Kenyan coffee variety with exuberant, complex sweetness and structure, not to mention a vibrant mouthfeel and impossibly long finish.

Name: Panama Mokkita Natural Mama Cata Estate
Review: Spice-toned floral and complex fruit notes harmonize effortlessly in this rare, natural-processed Panama Mokkita that’s as deep-toned as it is elegant.

Name: Ka‘ū Cloud Maragogipe
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A resonant, richly sweet, stone fruit-driven Maragogipe grown in Ka‘ū and processed experimentally with the addition of wine yeasts to the fermentation — juicy, multi-layered, uniquely composed.

Name: Geisha Champagne
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A Kona-grown Geisha, cleanly natural processed to show off pretty fruit notes; especially vibrant acidity.

Name: JN Farms Double Anaerobic Red Bourbon
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A wide-ranging anaerobic natural Ka‘ū Red Bourbon with gravitas: spice-toned florals and sweetly tart fruits commingle throughout the profile, held together by crisp cocoa nib.

Name: Ka‘ū Classic Peaberry
Origin: Ka‘ū growing district, "Big Island" of Hawai’i
Review: A lush, decadently sweet, richly nutty Ka‘ū peaberry, deep-toned and sensuous.

Name: 100% Kona Typica
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A lively, balanced washed Kona cup with a dark chocolate throughline supported by tart fruit and spice-toned floral notes.

Name: Hapa
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A pleasingly familiar Kona profile that’s a post-roast melange with top notes of citrus zest and depth from rich chocolate notes.

Name: SL28 Honey
Origin: North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A cohesive, confident SL28 grown in Kona and honey-processed for a nimble, engaging cup.

Name: 100% Ka‘ū Navarro
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: Fruit and floral notes occupy center stage in this Ka‘ū-grown Pacamara/Catuai blend complicated by sweet herb impulses.

Name: Ecuador Finca Cruz Loma Washed Anaerobic
Origin: San José de Minas, Pichincha Province, Ecuador
Review: Equal parts, sweet, tart and savory, this washed anaerobic Ecuador leads with notes of warming spices, tart fruit, and complex florals.

Name: 100% Kona Extra Fancy
Origin: Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A nut-driven, chocolaty Kona Typica with inviting notes of citrus zest and caramel supported by rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Sunrise Blend
Review: A friendly, easygoing Honduras-Maui blend that leads with creamy nut tones and bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: Three Island Blend
Review: A quietly inviting three-island blend of Hawaiian-grown coffees, cocoa-toned and richly nutty.

Name: Colombia 510 Elegante Natural Geisha
Review: A high-toned natural-processed Colombia Geisha that is, as its name implies, quite elegant, with complex aromatics that are borne out in the cup.

Name: Colombia Turron
Review: An intriguingly spice-toned natural Colombia with an umami throughline.

Name: Nitrogen Narcosis
Review: For fans of barrel-aged coffees who prefer subtlety over stronger aromatic associations — also chocolaty and delicately fruit-toned.

Name: Mukwinja DR Congo
Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu growing region, Democratic Republic of Congo
Review: A quietly confident DR Congo that leads with warming spice notes and cocoa nib throughout the profile and floral tones underneath.

Name: Buesaco Colombia
Review: A solid, familiar washed Colombia, crisply chocolaty with a tart fruit throughline.

Name: Colombia Pacamara Natural
Review: A quietly confident natural-processed Pacamara cup with leading notes of citrus and crisp chocolate.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
Review: A good bargain for a solid Yirgacheffe that’s also organic and fair trade-certified.

Name: Ethiopia Layo Teraga
Review: Akin to a restrained yet buttery California Chardonnay, this washed Ethiopia is deep-toned, very rich, and quite elegant.

Name: Ethiopia Reko Yirgacheffe
Review: A richly sweet, floral and citrusy washed Ethiopia cup with especially vibrant acidity.

Name: Guatemala Hunapu
Review: A classic Guatemala cup profile characterized by richly sweet nut tones and an especially viscous, lively body.

Name: Honduras Delmy Regalado Octopeque
Review: A spice-toned Honduras with a through like of warming spices — think American bakery aromas.

Name: Colombia El Puente
Review: A solid natural-processed Colombia with leading notes of chocolate and berries, complicated by spice-toned florals and citrus.

Name: Colombia Huila El Diviso Nestor Lasso Geisha Washed
Review: A classic, high-toned washed Geisha cup driven by cocoa and complex floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Bensa Bombe
Origin: Bombe Village, Bensa District, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Review: Aromatically complex and deep throughout the cup with notes of dark chocolate, tart berries and spice-toned florals.

Name: Colombia  Nariño Villa Maria La Chorrera Geisha Washed
Review: A deep, spice-toned, richly aromatic washed Colombia, vibrant and balanced.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga County Gikirima Factory TOP PB
Review: A classic Kenya profile: juicy, bright, deeply rich, with notes of currant and dark chocolate, supported by dusky herbs.

Name: Colombia Huila Finca Buena Vista Geisha Washed
Origin: El Jardin, Pitalito, Huila Department, Colombia
Review: An inviting washed Colombia Geisha with multi-layered citrus and floral aromatics and an especially vibrant body.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Special Winey
Review: A cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia centered around notes of cocoa-toned fruit and spicy florals.

Name: Colombia La Zulia Castillo Sweet Rose Honey
Review: A confident and appealing honey-processed Colombia, tea-like in its aromatics.

Name: Wilton Benitez Geisha
Review: An invitingly complex anaerobic Geisha produced by master processor Wilton Benitez — crisp stone fruit, spice-toned florals and an umami throughline carry this uniquely composed Colombia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Arbegona Bochessa
Review: A flavorful natural-processed Ethiopia that’s bright, vibrant, juicy and high-toned.

Name: Costa Rica TIM Washed Don Eli Catuai
Review: A uniquely composed Costa Rica coffee co-fermented with coffee mosto (skins and pulp), richly fruit-toned and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Twakok Pearl Selection
Review: A citrusy, stone fruit-driven natural-processed Ethiopia that’s invigoratingly tart, with ballast from rich nut tones.

Name: Kenya Washed Uklili AA
Review: A juicy, bright, balanced and deep Kenya with especially inviting, high-toned acidity.

Name: Costa Rica Natural Sin Limites SL28
Review: A cleanly natural-processed Costa Rica cup driven by tropical fruit and floral tones, with crisp baking chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Lemon and Citrus Symphony Super C
Review: A juicy-bright Kenya, multi-layered and deep, with cocoa nib and berry notes throughout the profile.

Name: Mexico Alba Flores
Review: A pleasing washed Mexico cup that exhibits classic notes of stone fruit, citrus and a crisp chocolate throughline.

Name: Panama Baru Geisha Moonlight Black Solar ASD
Review: A fruit-toned experimentally processed Panama with a cocoa throughline.

Name: Peru Ricardo Palma
Review: A friendly, crisp, chocolate- and nut-driven washed Peru cup.

Name: Costa Rica Brunca Rivense La Guaca Passion Honey
Review: A friendly, accessible cocoa- and nut-toned honey-processed Costa Rica cup.

Name: Costa Rica Aris Red Honey Lot
Review: This honey-processed Costa Rica is characterized by richly sweet nut and crisp aromatic wood notes.

Name: Nkanda #7 Burundi
Review: An understated Burundi with cocoa-toned stone fruit and delicate floral notes throughout.

Name: Pearl
Review: A high-toned washed/natural blend that foregrounds citrus and sweet herb notes.

Name: Peach-C Blend
Review: An original, deep-toned, perfumy blend that accentuates floral and citrus notes.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Lucy Station Geisha Washed
Review: A brightly sweet, gently tart washed Ethiopia Geisha with rich nut and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Colombia Huila Finca Rodrigo Sanchez Purple Caturra Natural
Review: A friendly, accessible cocoa- and nut-toned Colombia natural.

Name: Kenya Gicherori AA
Review: A deep-toned Kenya with leading notes of cocoa nib, sweetly herbaceous and caramelly.

Name: Ethiopia Wolde Hirbe Jemjemo Natural
Origin: Wenago district, Gedeo Zone, SNNPR, Ethiopia
Review: A quietly confident natural-processed Ethiopia with crisp berry and sweet nut tones.

Name: Colombia Jaime Lopez
Review: A fruity, floral-toned natural-processed Colombia natural with an especially satisfying, very long finish.

Name: Cordillera de Fuego Costa Rica
Review: A thoroughly spice-toned anaerobic Costa Rica, richly aromatic, with support from dark chocolate and stone fruit notes throughout the profile.

Name: El Salvador Los Cipreses
Origin: Monte Verde, Santa Ana Department, central El Salvador
Review: A harmonious, floral and chocolaty washed El Salvador with especially inviting acidity, juicy and bright.

Name: Nyeri Hill Kenya
Review: A complex, multi-layered, classic Kenya cup, berry-forward, and cocoa-toned, with sparkling acidity.

Name: Santuario Peru
Review: A rich, deeply chocolaty, floral- and nut-toned Peru with subtle hints of spicy florals.

Name: Papua New Guinea Jiwaka Arufa Natural
Review: A tartly sweet, crisply chocolaty Papua New Guinea natural, a fruity twist by way of an unusual processing method for this origin.

Name: Ethiopia Koke Honey
Review: A nuanced, berry-driven honey-processed Ethiopia with a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Colombia Inza
Review: Crisp chocolate and nut tones predominate in this inviting washed Colombia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Guji 74110 Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: Stone fruit and dark chocolate anchor this natural-processed Ethiopia cup with undertones of rich nut butter and complex citrus.

Name: Costa Rica Finca Tono Natural
Origin: Los Robles de Naranjo, West Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A delicate, nuanced natural-processed Costa Rica with a rich hazelnut throughline.

Name: Seven Sages Blend
Review: A friendly, inviting, chocolaty and citrus-driven blend, crisply sweet and balanced.

Name: Costa Rica Flor Lichi Meet Patch
Review: A fruity, balanced Costa Rica natural with crisp chocolate notes throughout and especially lively acidity.

Name: Love in Winter
Review: A crisply aromatic, berry-toned blend with a throughline of rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Good Tidings Sweet Holiday Blend
Review: A multi-layered, richly fruity blend with notes of candied citrus, salted plum and sweet herbs with a grounding throughline of cocoa nib.

Name: Kona Mokka Champagne Natural
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: This aromatically tropical Kona Mokka natural leads with lush florals and tart fruits and has undertones of crisp cocoa nib — bright, juicy, balanced and rich.

Name: Kenya Getuya AA
Review: A pretty Kenya with classic notes of cocoa nib and red currant, complicated by a sweet lemongrass-like herbaceousness.

Name: Peru Olga Calle Organic
Review: A friendly, balanced washed Peru cup, rich-toned and quite chocolaty.

Name: Windsor Blend
Review: Bright stone fruit and crisp cocoa nib characterize this balanced, sweet-toned Ethiopia-Rwanda blend.

Name: Carrick Blend
Review: A friendly, accessible, crisply chocolaty blend with undertones of sweet herbs.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga Njawato Estate
Review: A fruit-forward, cocoa-toned Kenya with especially vibrant acidity.

Name: Costa Rica Hacienda Sonora Natural
Review: A bright natural-processed Costa Rica cup, fruit-centered and richly chocolaty with sweet floral undertones.

Name: Costa Rica Central Valley
Review: A lively, cocoa- and citrus-driven washed Costa Rica with a throughline of sweet grapefruit notes supported by gentle herbs.

Name: Guatemala Antigua
Review: A comfortingly familiar, sweetly nutty Guatemala cup with undertones of caramel and spice-toned florals.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A delicately perfumed, balanced washed Ethiopia cup with notes of bergamot and sweet, citrusy herb notes throughout the profile, with crisp cocoa nib undertones.

Name: Blossom Spring Blend
Review: A complex, nuanced blend of coffees from three origins, processed by three different methods, resulting in a lively cup with bright acidity and savory undertones.

Name: O-Li-A Geisha Blend
Review: A perfumy, sweet, complex blend of intricately processed coffees — multi-layered and deep.

Name: Colombia Quindio Campo Hermoso Wush Wush
Review: A fruity, chocolaty Colombia Wush Wush natural with an especially viscous, satiating mouthfeel.

Name: Kenya Mukarimu Estate AA Barrel-Aged
Review: If you like barrel-aged coffees, this bourbon-tinted Kenya is a subtle version, with sweet vanilla and crisp chocolate undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Benti Nenka Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: Cocoa nib, tropical fruit and sweet florals characterize this natural-processed Ethiopia.

Name: Costa Rica Hacienda Sonora San Isidro 48
Review: A quietly confident natural-processed Costa Rica with distinct strawberry notes and cocoa and citrus undertones.

Name: Colombia Huila El Triunfo Pink Bourbon Anaerobic Washed
Review: A Colombia washed anaerobic with leading notes of dried fruit, sweet florals, cocoa nib and bittersweet citrus notes, multi-layered and deeply rich.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Assefa 74112 SLD Black Honey
Review: A friendly, accessible black honey-processed Ethiopia characterized by richly sweet nut and crisp aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Bensa Hamasho Slow Dry Natural
Review: A crisply nutty, richly wood-framed Ethiopia natural.

Name: Burundi Murambi Hill
Review: A solid washed Burundi cup that offers notes of stone fruit, sweet herbs and a crisp chocolate throughline.

Name: El Salvador Finca Montevideo
Review: A chocolate-driven washed El Salvador with supporting notes of sweet hazelnut, crisp pear and rich cedar.

Name: Papua New Guinea Korgua Estate A
Origin: Waghi Valley, Western Highlands, Papua New Guinea
Review: A friendly, familiar PNG cup with notes of sweet fruit, caramel and spice-toned florals complicated by bittersweet citrus zest — and an exceptional value.

Name: Costa Rica Volcán Azul Gesha Anaerobic Natural
Review: This decadently sweet, candy-like anaerobic Costa Rica Gesha gets ballast from a resinous amber-like note — an ideal choice for a dessert coffee.

Name: Colombia Monteblanco Coconut Lemonade
Review: Vibrant and juicy-bright, this Colombia Purple Caturra was co-fermented with coconut and citrus fruits to wonderfully tropical effect.

Name: Colombia Huila Chiroso Anaerobic Natural
Review: A savory-sweet anaerobic natural Colombia with leading notes of florals and umami-toned mushrooms.

Name: GW03 Princesa Carmen Geisha
Review: Beautifully integrated, immensely sweet, and distinctly aromatic, this washed Panama Geisha is a standout for its wide-ranging, lyrically harmonious profile.

Name: El Salvador Finca Loma La Gloria Yellow Honey
Origin: El Bálsamo Quetzaltepec growing region, El Salvador
Review: A juicy-sweet, balanced El Salvador natural characterized by bright stone fruit and dark chocolate throughout the profile.

Name: Costa Rica La Laguna Lot — Reserve Series
Review: A sweetly tart, cleanly natural-processed Costa Rica cup, delicately fruit-driven, with an especially rich, syrupy mouthfeel.

Name: Ethiopia Hamasho Farm
Review: A crisp, fruit- and chocolate-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with an especially long, inviting finish.

Name: Colombia El Paraiso Geisha Luna Washed
Review: A focused, intensely perfumed, experimentally processed Colombia Geisha that’s, at turns, chocolaty, musky, tropical and sweetly herbaceous.

Name: Costa Rica Volcán Azul Gesha Anaerobic Natural
Review: A uniquely composed Costa Rica Gesha cup: berry-driven, densely sweet, lyrically bright, and sweetly fermenty.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Shantawene Abore Natural
Review: Balanced and juicy, this classic natural Ethiopia has distinct berry and chocolate tones throughout the profile, and especially juicy acidity.

Name: Costa Rica Diego Abarca Gesha Natural
Review: A quietly confident natural Costa Rica Gesha with bright fruit and salted caramel notes as throughlines.

Name: Kona Pointu®
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A vibrantly aromatic, enigmatically complex Kona Pointu Laurina, a rare coffee presented with farming, processing and roasting precision, resulting in fireworks in the cup.

Name: Colombia Calderon Honey
Review: An ethereally sweet, immersively rich-toned anaerobic Colombia with complex spice notes that enliven the cup.

Name: Karen J Kona Red Bourbon
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: Balanced, deep-toned and nuanced throughout, this washed Kona Red Bourbon is lively and enticing with crisp cocoa, tart fruit and sweet floral notes as anchor.

Name: Wilton Benitez Colombia Sidra
Review: An intensely aromatic, richly floral, complexly fruit-driven Colombia Sidra processed by a proprietary double-anaerobic thermal shock method.

Name: Peru Gilmer Cordova #13
Review: This washed Peru has a dessert-like sweetness coupled with a spice-toned floral nose and a chocolate fudge throughline — decadently rich and harmoniously composed.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A gorgeously structured, rich and complex natural-processed Ethiopia cup — elegantly juicy, fruity, floral, chocolaty.

Name: Kenya Gichathaini
Review: A classic juicy-bright Kenya, exuberant, confident and intricately balanced.

Name: Ka‘ū Cloud Typica
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A quietly confident, harmonious Ka‘ū coffee with a throughline of rich honey, complex bittersweet citrus and grounding cocoa nib.

Name: Guatemala Rosendo Domingo
Review: A balanced, sweet-toned Guatemala characterized by crisp pear and cocoa nib notes, alongside sweet-spicy florals.

Name: Kenya Kamavindi
Review: A rich, balanced Kenya with cocoa-toned tropical fruit and sweet herb notes throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia Honey Sweet Rose
Review: Elegant and complex, this floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia is richly sweet, deeply floral and citrusy.

Name: Guatemala Fredy Orantes Natural
Review: A savory throughline of sweet herbs complicates this otherwise sweetly fruit- and nut-toned cup, lending nuance and depth.

Name: Mexico El Triunfo
Review: Sweet-tart fruit and rich nut tones characterize this solid Mexico cup.

Name: Colombia Fruity
Review: A friendly, laid-back natural-processed Colombia with a tart-leaning profile and ballast from cocoa nib and spicy florals.

Name: Colombia Santa Monica Castillo Honey Lulo
Review: This Colombia Castillo fermented with lulo fruit is complex and quite original: delicately fruity, tartly floral, richly musky and enigmatically savory.

Name: Colombia Hermosa Co-Fermented Honey
Review: An intense, lavish Colombia infused with strawberry fruit, distinct in its aromatics, with a complex tart-earthy undercurrent.

Name: El Vergel Rojo Fruit Infused
Review: Equal parts sweet and umami impulses drive this anaerobic honey Colombia. Co-ferment with red fruits promotes a floral, berry-toned, salty caramelly profile.

Name: Colombia Castillo Special Fermentation Washed Fruit of Taiwan
Review: A tangy, stonefruit-driven anaerobic Colombia supported by pretty floral and rich almond notes.

Name: Colombia Las Flores Mint-Macerated
Review: A uniquely composed mint-macerated Colombia that’s balanced, sweetly herbal and floral and quite subtle in its complex sweetness

Name: Guatemala Jocote
Review: A complex, multi-layered, unabashedly lactic anaerobic natural Guatemala with bold floral and stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Costa Rica Tarrazu Double-Anaerobic Washed
Review: A high-toned, yogurty anaerobic Costa Rica with support from sweet nut and cocoa.

Name: Colombia Finca Monteblanco Purple Caturra Passionfruit Washed
Review: Tart fruit and delicately sweet florals characterize this conventionally fermented, passionfruit-infused Colombia Purple Caturra.

Name: Ivan Solis Candy Natural
Origin: Santa Maria de Dota, Tarrazu, Costa Rica
Review: A confidently anaerobic Costa Rica cup that leads with notes of dark chocolate, dried berries, tangy citrus and sweet herbs.

Name: Colombia Las Flores Red Bourbon Natural
Review: A zesty, invigorating natural-processed Colombia with tart fruit notes grounded by cocoa nib and sweet herbs.

Name: Ethiopia Werka Nensebo Natural
Origin: Werka, Refisa Kebele, Nensebo District, West Arsi, Oromia, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia cup with a chocolate and berry throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Oromia Djimma Limu Gummay Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A lively, inviting natural-processed Ethiopia with emphasis on bright fruit and rich nut tones.

Name: Kenya AA Kiri
Review: A deeply sweet, vibrantly umami Kenya with a complex sweet-savory structure and nuanced florals.

Name: El Salvador Finca San Antonio Gesha Natural
Review: A lovely natural-processed El Salvador Gesha with complex fruit and delicate floral aromatics and flavors.

Name: Costa Rica Finca El Desafio
Review: A sweetly spice-toned honey-processed Costa Rica coffee with lovely floral and stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Nicaragua Don Francisco & Blanca Nieve
Review: A flavor-saturated, complex washed Nicaragua cup, chocolaty and rich-toned.

Name: Nicaragua Don Roger Fruit Symphony Natural & Maceration
Review: A complex sweet-tart-savory cup processed by carbonic maceration — chocolaty and fruit-forward.

Name: El Salvador Finca Los Positos
Review: This blueberry-centric natural-processed El Salvador gets ballast from sweet herb notes and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Casetta
Review: A friendly, accessible, balanced blend with delicate fruit, creamy nut, and spice-toned floral notes.

Name: Guatemala Monte de Oro
Review: Savory herb notes complicate the crisp sweetness of this natural-processed Guatemala cup.

Name: India Ratnagiri Estate
Review: An India microlot with sweet nut and citrus tones, delicate and balanced.

Name: Guatemala Gesha
Review: A lovely washed Guatemala Gesha cup: juicy, bright, citrusy and floral — vibrant and nuanced.

Name: Gesha Village Ethiopia Gori Gesha
Origin: Gori Gesha Forest, Bench Maji Zone, SNNPR Region, Ethiopia
Review: A juicy, bright natural-processed Ethiopia cup — invigoratingly tart, balanced by rich floral and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Wild Rose
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A crisply sweet Ethiopia Guji cup with stone fruit and caramel aromas and flavors throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia Finca El Roble Chiroso
Review: A friendly, balanced Colombia Chiroso with sweet nut tones and a crisp, citrusy herbaceousness.

Name: Ethiopia Maria Gesha
Origin: Bench Maji Zone, SNNPR Region, Ethiopia
Review: A friendly, accessible Ethiopia with crisp chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Machakos AA Top Washed
Review: A punchy, high-toned, richly umami Kenya cup that hits all the right notes: juicy, deep, floral and sweetly herbaceous.

Name: Taiwan Hualien WanMa Coffee Washed Arabica
Review: A flavor-saturated, complex Taiwan-grown coffee, chocolaty and rich-toned.

Name: Taiwan Hualien 917 Farm Washed Arabica
Review: A balanced, chocolaty washed Taiwan supported by stone fruit and sweet herb notes.

Name: Zhi Zu Coffee Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural
Review: A richly sweet natural-processed Ethiopia with fruit underpinnings supported by sweet florals.

Name: Zhi Zu Coffee Berry Romance Blend
Review: A balanced, richly sweet blend of both washed and natural-processed coffees.

Name: Strawberry Chloris Coffee Blend
Review: A distinctly strawberry-toned blend with supporting notes of sweet nut, dark chocolate and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Perfect Peach Blend
Review: A peachy blend centered around notes of canned peaches, a familiar childhood flavor, supported by dark chocolate and sassafras tones.

Name: Honduras La Salsa Gesha
Review: An elegant washed Honduras Gesha with sweet floral and tart fruit notes that’s balanced and inviting.

Name: Sphere Coffee Club Guatemala
Review: A rich-toned Guatemala Pacamara, complex and deep, with notes of persimmon and sweet almond front and center.

Name: Guatemala Reserve Las Moritas Red Pacamara
Review: Pretty florals are the throughline of this cocoa-toned Red Pacamara Guatemala cup, which has an especially appealing, syrupy mouthfeel.

Name: Guatemala Reserve Las Moritas Yellow Pacamara
Review: An interestingly sweet-savory Guatemala Pacamara with leading notes of spice-toned florals and sweet citrus zest.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Bishala 23/02
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Guji: bright, balanced, yet juicy and deep — complex and multi-layered.

Name: Ethiopia Red Honey Guji Uraga Tabe Haro Wachu
Review: A deeply rich, red honey-processed Ethiopia with spicy floral, sweet stone fruit, and rich cocoa nib notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Bare Tamiru
Review: This natural-processed Ethiopia has sweet-tart top notes and a deeply chocolaty base, complicated by bittersweet citrus zest and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Elatenecha Natural G1
Review: A friendly, accessible natural-processed Guji with appealing citrus and gentle chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Sidamo Morea
Review: Rich-toned, cocoa- and citrus-driven, this washed Ethiopia also has especially high-toned acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Wild Rose Anaerobic Washed
Review: A juicy, citrus-driven Ethiopia washed anaerobic with undertones of rich sandalwood and spicy florals.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Thermal Shock Geisha
Review: Tropical aromatherapy! This experimentally processed Geisha is characterized by tropical fruit and herb notes, rich-toned and uniquely composed, with a complex, lyrically sweet cup.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Thermal Shock Red Bourbon
Review: An enigmatic, multi-layered, tart-leaning Colombia Red Bourbon with impressively complex aromatics.

Name: Colombia Tolima Genius
Review: This carbonic-macerated Colombia is tart-leaning and also very sweet; notes of milk chocolate provide richness as ballast.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Thermal Shock Caturra
Review: A medley of both tropical and candy-like fruit impulses characterizes this juicy Colombia Caturra processed by an innovative “thermal shock” method.

Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Yirgacheffe Chelbesa Premium Red Honey G1
Origin: Chelchele, Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia
Review: A crisply fruity honey-processed Ethiopia cup with leading notes of blackberry and spice-toned florals.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Bensa Hamasho Washed G1
Review: A balanced, comfortable, sweet-toned Ethiopia cup with a Nutella-like sweetness throughout.

Name: Ecuador Clara Luz Washed
Review: A crisply chocolaty Ecuador complicated by bittersweet hop-like florals.

Name: Kenya Rumukia FCS Maganjo
Review: A vibrant, plush Kenya cup with classic black currant notes front and center, with undertones of sweet herb notes.

Name: Ethiopia Halo Hartume
Review: A high-toned, sweetly-tart washed Ethiopia with spicy floral and bright stone fruit notes.

Name: Ethiopia Boyefi Natural
Origin: Konga, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A gently tart, crisply fruit-floward Ethiopia natural anchored by notes of dark chocolate and bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: Hong Kong Blend
Review: An unabashedly anaerobic-forward blend — a lactic fruit bomb — grounded by creamy nut and rich cocoa tones.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Koke Shalaye Abraham Mengiste
Review: A vibrant, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia with distinct blueberry and dark chocolate notes, complicated by resiny aromatic amber.

Name: Kenya AA TOP Gicherori
Review: An exquisitely composed classic Kenya cup: juicy, bright, deep and rich, with especially complex and lyrical acidity.

Name: Panama Carmen Geisha Washed Light Roast
Review: An elegant washed Panama Geisha with complex bittersweet citrus, stone fruit, and spice-toned floral notes throughout.

Name: Colombia Luna Azul
Review: A deeply sweet black honey Colombia with a throughline of black cherry and tangerine grounded by distinct chocolate fudge notes.

Name: Mexico Los Aguacates
Review: A bright, juicy, tropical Mexico cup with delicate florals and crisp chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Arbegona Natural 74158
Review: A lively and integrated, deeply fruit- and floral-toned natural Ethiopia cup.

Name: Guatemala Nueva Granda Washed Laurina
Review: An energetic washed Guatemala cup characterized by spicy floral and creamy nut tones, further elevated by a dark chocolate throughline.

Name: Guatemala Atitlan
Review: A balanced, deeply chocolaty, richly nutty washed process Guatemala coffee.

Name: Peru Paltachayoc
Origin: Paltachayoc, Santa Teresa, La Convención, Cusco, Peru
Review: A classic Peru cup driven by chocolate and nut tones, richly sweet and deep, with an especially full, syrupy body.

Name: Mexico San Cristobal Decaf
Review: An invitingly sweet, very smooth Mexico decaf, chocolaty and rich.

Name: Ethiopia Shantawene Washed
Review: The epitome of a classic washed Ethiopia cup: juicy, bright, balanced, deep, centered around pretty stone fruit notes and bittersweet citrus with a cocoa nib backbone.

Name: Kona Mocca®
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: This rare Big Island Kona Mocca®, with its small, jewel-like beans, is worth the splurge for its uniquely compelling profile — an excellent coffee for holiday gifting.

Name: Colombia Finca Chambaku
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered, experimentally processed Colombia that surfaces tropical fruit notes and sweet herbs with a throughline of decadent cane sugar.

Name: Colombia La Siria Gesha
Review: An aromatically mesmerizing washed Colombia Gesha whose complex and rich aromatics play out fully in the cup.

Name: Ka‘ū Yellow Caturra Peaberry
Review: A citrus-driven, sweetly nut-toned Ka‘ū coffee with especially robust acidity in juxtaposition to its delicate aromatics.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Tirtira Goyo Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A fruit-forward, natural-processed Ethiopia with pervasive cocoa nib notes — multi-layered, juicy-bright, deep-toned.

Name: El Salvador Unicorn
Review: An elegant, flavor-saturated, richly aromatic El Salvador natural — a very small-production “unicorn.”

Name: Colombia Pink Bourbon Natural
Review: Aromatically driven by notes of warming spices and richly sweet-tart in the cup, this Colombia Pink Bourbon is multi-layered and bright.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Koke
Review: A richly sweet Ethiopia honey with inviting fruit and floral notes and undertones of citrus and rich nut butter.

Name: Brazil Admilson Jose Galerani Microlot
Origin: Mogiana growing region, Sao Paulo State, Brazil
Review: Dried stonefruit and rich almond nougat characterize this natural-processed Brazil with wine-like acidity.

Name: Gesha Village Estate Fruity Geisha Green Label Batch Bangi Lot 55
Origin: Gori Gesha Forest, Bench Maji Zone, SNNPR Region, Ethiopia
Review: A multi-layered washed Ethiopia Gesha Village, sweetly savory and richly herbaceous with undertones of cocoa nib and vanilla bean.

Name: Gesha Village Estate Yilu Forest Dimma
Origin: Gori Gesha Forest, Bench Maji Zone, SNNPR Region, Ethiopia
Review: A crisp, balanced honey-processed Ethiopia with candy-like sweetness and rich aromatic wood notes throughout.

Name: Guatemala La Minita Antigua La Flor del Cafe
Review: A friendly, accessible Guatemala cup, crisply chocolaty and richly floral.

Name: Colombia Cauca Finca El Paraiso Double Anaerobic Flor Lichi
Review: A tropically fruity anaerobic Colombia with undertones of dark chocolate throughout.

Name: Costa Rica La Guaca Microlot Natural
Origin: Rivas District, Chirripo Region, Costa Rica
Review: A delicate, balanced natural-processed Costa Rica, fruit-forward and nutty with floral undertones.

Name: Anniversary Blend
Review: A nuanced Kenya/Costa Rica blend designed to celebrate Temple Coffee’s anniversary — balanced and inviting, with especially juicy acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Euphora Special Honey Lot
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A boldly aromatic yet balanced honey-processed Guji with notes of cocoa, bright citrus, and sweet herbs throughout.

Name: Guatemala Las Colinas
Review: A flavor-laden Guatemala cup with high-toned fruit and richly sweet caramel notes.

Name: Colombia Geisha Charlotte
Review: This washed Colombia Geisha leads with notes of bright stone fruit and gets ballast and depth from almond and cedar.

Name: Canet Chopard Raisin Honey
Review: A friendly, accessible honey-processed Costa Rica cup: crisp, citrusy and sweetly nutty.

Name: Ichamama Kenya
Review: An impressively floral Kenya cup complicated by notes of chocolate, sandalwood and dark berries, bright and juicy.

Name: La Candelilla Geisha Natural Costa Rica
Review: An elegantly fruity natural-processed Costa Rica Geisha with gravitas from its particularly viscous, velvety-smooth mouthfeel.

Name: El Lechero Peru
Origin: El Carmen Cautivo, Tabaconas, Cajamarca, Peru
Review: Hazelnut is the throughline of this washed Peru with notes of butterscotch, citrus and delicate florals.

Name: Colombia El Roble Natural Carbonic Java
Review: A naturally and deeply sweet cup with gentle, rather Geisha-like floral and chocolaty complication.

Name: Colombia Nestor Lasso Sidra
Review: A very sweet, flower-driven cup, smoothly bright and intricate with nuance.

Name: Colombia Yeast Anaerobic Washed Las Flores Bourbon Sidra
Review: A smooth, subtle cup both lively in its floral- and chocolate-toned detail yet soothing and coherent overall.

Name: Ecuador Cruz Loma Sidra Anaerobic Euphora Special Lot
Origin: San José de Minas, Pichincha Province, Ecuador
Review: This big, generously comprehensive cup combines resonance and depth with soaring floral brightness. A complete and thrilling cup.

Name: Colombia El Roble Chiroso Washed
Review: Delicate aromatic intrigue in a subtle, gardeny cup.

Name: Guatemala El Injerto SL28
Review: A juicy mango of a cup, sweet, lightly savory-resiny, with candied walnut and chocolate complication.

Name: Colombia Wush Wush Dynamic Natural
Review: A spice-toned, tart-leaning, richly aromatic expression of the Ethiopian Wush Wush variety as grown in Colombia.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Milenio
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A briskly tart, citrusy cup rounded by sweet nut and cocoa-ish aromatic wood. Or taste it for its historical importance as one of the first efforts to create a coffee variety that can stand up to the stress of climate change while tasting distinctive and pleasing.

Name: Colombia Finca El Ventilador Pink Bourbon Anaerobic Natural
Review: Anaerobic processing overlays a balanced cup with a pleasing, flavor-complicating yogurty tang.

Name: Colombia El Diviso Sidra Natural
Review: A pleasantly eccentric cup, with tropical fruit (especially lychee), candyish watermelon, and crisp, dry chocolate jostling for attention.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural Anaerobic
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A rich-toned, deeply sweet anaerobic natural Ethiopia with juicy-bright acidity.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Gichathaini AA Top
Review: A deep-toned, sweetly savory Kenya cup with inviting floral notes and a complex bittersweet structure.

Name: Wilton Benitez Java
Review: An impossibly complex, delightfully floral carbonic-macerated Java with more aroma and flavor descriptors than we can begin to count on both hands.

Name: El Salvador Monte Verde
Origin: Monte Verde, Santa Ana Department, central El Salvador
Review: A solid El Salvador cup with a crisp chocolate throughline and especially vibrant acidity.

Name: Uganda Sipi Falls Station Anaerobic Natural
Review: An inviting anaerobic natural Uganda with throughlines of citrus zest and cocoa, complicated by a lactic tang.

Name: Robusta Rosso
Review: A lovely Thailand Robusta, processed experimentally with the addition of wine yeasts in the fermentation, to tart-fruity effect.

Name: Yirgacheffe Chelbesa Danche
Origin: Chelchele, Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, nuanced washed Ethiopia cup with pretty citrus and sweet herb notes throughout, supported by cocoa tones.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Buku
Origin: Kebele, Buku Sayisa, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A berry-driven natural-processed Ethiopia — think blueberry, boysenberry, blackberry, raspberry all in one — supported by crisp chocolate and spicy florals.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Chinga
Review: The bottom line: A balanced, juicy, spice-toned Kenya with classic lead notes of currant and bittersweet citrus undertones.

Name: 1994 Blend
Review: Pleasing aromatic cedar notes frame this fruit-driven blend of coffees from Ethiopia: berry-forward and gently spice-toned.

Name: Costa Rica Danilo Salazar San Cristobal Natural
Origin: Llano Bonita de Naranjo, Costa Rica
Review: A gently fruit-forward natural-processed Costa Rica with undertones of savory herbs and bittersweet citrus notes.

Name: Panama Bambito Estate Geisha Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Volcan Baru, Boquete growing region, Panama
Review: A decadently juicy, lyrically sweet Panama Geisha processed by the anaerobic natural method — tropical, richly floral, intensely aromatic.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama 74158
Review: A lyrically complex, delightful natural-processed, single-variety Ethiopia that exudes the care and attention it was farmed and processed with. Classically high-toned, deeply sweet-tart, with cocoa nib as a grounding throughline.

Name: Flor del Sol Signature Blend
Review: This Colombia/Ethiopia blend is centered around crisp chocolate and lime-like citrus notes, complicated by sweet florals.

Name: Colombia Double Anaerobic Washed Los Nogales Yellow Bourbon
Review: A uniquely composed anaerobic washed cup with rich chocolate and salted caramel notes juxtaposed with a sweet-tart lactic tang that is remarkably integrated.

Name: Guatemala Honey Acatenango Finca El General Bourbon
Review: A solid Guatemala cup processed by the honey method: gently bright, balanced, delicately sweet, richly nut-toned.

Name: Papua New Guinea
Review: A citrusy, crisply nut-toned cup with a caramel-like sweetness and persimmon undertones.

Name: Colombia El Chaferote Pink Bourbon
Review: A compelling rendition of Pink Bourbon with distinct citrus, cocoa nib, and spicy floral tones — especially lively, juicy acidity.

Name: Guatemala El Injerto Ethiopia Landrace Natural
Review: An Ethiopian landrace coffee variety grown in Guatemala and natural processed to emphasize fruit notes — sweetly tart, juicy-bright, deep-toned.

Name: Thai Single-Origin Hybrid Honey Anaerobic Process
Origin: Doi Chang, Chiang Rai Province, Thailand
Review: An anaerobic honey-processed coffee grown in Thailand driven by berry and chocolate notes, crisply sweet and engaging.

Name: Thai Single-Origin A Washed Process
Origin: Doi Chang, Chiang Rai Province, Thailand
Review: A nicely balanced, richly sweet Thailand-grown coffee with crisp chocolate notes supported by citrus zest and aromatic wood.

Name: Holiday Coffee
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A fruit-forward, sweetly tart natural-processed Kona cup with undertones of sweet florals and richly bittersweet citrus zest, bound together by deep chocolate notes.

Name: Kenya Muthua-Ini AB
Review: This lush Kenya displays dark berry and deep chocolate notes elegantly juxtaposed with spicy florals and bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: Kenya Gichuka AA
Review: A juicy, deep, complex Kenya cup with characteristic currant and cola notes, complicated by sweet herb and rich chocolate throughout the profile.

Name: Colombia Chili Bourbon
Review: A wild ride of a coffee with distinct notes of peppercorn (the coffee was co-fermented with aji chili) that’s also a fruity and fun carbonic-macerated cup.

Name: Mexico Finca Muxbal
Review: A pretty natural-processed Mexico, berry-driven with a throughline of baking chocolate and citrus zest.

Name: Chelbessa Ethiopia
Review: A classic Yirgacheffe cup, balanced and bright, with notes of stone fruit, cocoa nib, and citrus throughout — harmonious, integrated, and lyrically juicy.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Gedeb Chelbesa Natural
Origin: Chelchele, Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia
Review: A multi-layered, very fruity natural Ethiopia cup with notes of dried mango, sweet herbs and rich aromatic wood throughout.

Name: Tirra Natural Costa Rica
Review: A decadently fruit-forward natural-processed Costa Rica with notes of both tropical fruit and fruit candy, with ballast from crisp cocoa nib and citrus zest.

Name: Colombia Huila Espiritu Blanc Geisha Semi-Washed Anaerobic
Review: A complex, confident anaerobic honey-processed Colombia, richly floral with a dark chocolate throughline.

Name: Campazi #9 Natural Burundi
Review: A berry-driven natural-processed Burundi with undertones of dark chocolate and spicy florals.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Boa Bedegelo
Review: A smooth, balanced cup with a sweetly herbaceous and floral profile.

Name: Kenya Endebess
Review: An unusual Kenya in that it’s natural-processed (dried in the whole fruit), a departure from the country’s typical washed processing: richly aromatic and fruit-driven.

Name: Ethiopia Gerbicho Lela
Origin: Aleta Wendo, Sidamo growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A delicate, multi-layered washed Ethiopia with leading notes of sweet citrus and spice-toned florals.

Name: Peru Natural Gesha
Review: A natural-processed Peru Gesha with berry-like sweetness, jammy and floral.

Name: Rwanda Reverb
Origin: Northern Province, Gakenke District, Ruli, Rwanda
Review: A sweetly spice-toned Rwanda cup with penetrating, yet balanced, acidity.

Name: Organic Guatemala Tojquia
Review: A familiar, pleasing cup: caramelly and nut-toned, complicated by star anise tones.

Name: Organic/Fair Trade Ethiopia Sidamo
Review: A pretty, nimble natural-processed Ethiopia with hints of dessert wine as a subtle throughline.

Name: Sumatra Highlands
Origin: Aceh Province, Gayo Highlands, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: This Sumatra displays the origin’s characteristically earthy notes — sweetly savory, low-toned and deep.

Name: Colombia El Premio de Timana
Review: A sweet but thin washed Colombia cup with muted notes of baking chocolate and cashew with savory undertones.

Name: Organic Fair Trade Shade Grown Ethiopia
Review: A smoky-sweet, unintegrated darker-roasted Ethiopia with notes of carob and scorched wood.

Name: Hometown Blend City Roast
Review: An uninspired, savory-leaning Colombia with offputting vegetal notes and muted sweetness.

Name: Honduras La Lesquiñada
Review: Distinct hazelnut notes are front and center in this Honduras Parainema cup supported by citrus zest and sweet herbs.

Name: Costa Rica San Ramon Yeast Washed
Review: A confident, multi-layered Costa Rica cup driven by spice-toned floral notes, stone fruit and bittersweet citrus.

Name: Brazil Vila Boa Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Carmo de Mata, Campo das Vertentes, Minas Gerais, Brazil
Review: A subtle anaerobic natural Brazil with complex fruit, richly sweet nut tones and delicate herb notes throughout.

Name: African Romance Blend
Review: A richly aromatic, flavor-laden blend with notes of tart fruit and sweet florals, balanced by rich nut and aromatic wood tones.

Name: Geisha & Yirgacheffe Blend
Review: A balanced, sweetly-tart Colombia-Ethiopia blend with sweet floral and bright stone fruit notes.

Name: Ecuador Robusta Lactic Natural
Review: An anaerobic natural Ecuador characterized by tart fruit, sweet floral and rich bittersweet citrus notes — intentional sweet ferment adds depth and complexity.

Name: Tailwind Medium-Dark Blend
Review: A darker-roasted blend for those who like full-bodied, slightly roasty profiles, and a good choice if you add milk to your cup.

Name: Big Mouth Frog Blend
Review: A chocolaty, richly nut-toned, accessible blend with hints of appealing roast-rounded smokiness.

Name: Kenya Washed Kiambu Windrush AA
Review: An exhilarating, umami-driven Kenya cup with classic notes of ripe tomato, cocoa nib and sweet citrus, complicated by complex sweet herb notes.

Name: Guatemala El Amate Maragogype
Origin: El Aguacatal, Hoja Blanca, Cuilco, Huehuetenango, Guatemala
Review: It’s unusual to find a natural-processed Maragoype, and this Guatemala is a fruit bomb restrained only by cocoa nib; especially creamy, rich mouthfeel.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Blue Donkey 23
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A uniquely composed cup — think mulberry and pink peppercorn — with a crisp cocoa throughline.

Name: Ecuador Maputo Honey
Review: An inviting honey-processed Ecuador that leads with tropical fruit and spicy floral notes with spice undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Worka Nenke Abraham Mengiste
Review: Powerfully elegant, this floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia is rich-toned and multi-layered, supported by berry and myrrh.

Name: Ethiopia Koke
Review: A high-toned, deep, complex washed Ethiopia with pretty stone fruit and rich chocolate notes and an especially saturated finish.

Name: Panama Florsa 100 Geisha FW 1600+
Review: A classic Panama Geisha cup with notes of complex citrus (bergamot), spice-toned florals, and a cocoa nib throughline — deep-toned and multi-layered.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Gesha Winey Natural G1
Review: A gently and intentionally fermenty Ethiopia Gesha with floral and berry notes at its heart, supported by crisp cocoa nib tones.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Finca Mirella
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A tropically fruity, richly chocolaty and sweet herbaceous Costa Rica natural.

Name: Guatemala Injerto
Review: A balanced, chocolaty washed Guatemala supported by stone fruit and sweet herb notes.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Washed G1 Twakok Lot
Review: A balanced, sweetly-tart washed Ethiopia cup with spicy-sweet floral and bright stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Bombe G1
Origin: Bombe mountains, Sidamo Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A delicately fruity, sweetly herbaceous natural-processed Ethiopia cup that foregrounds citrus and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Finca Huixoc Pacamara
Review: A flavor-saturated, complex Guatemala Pacamara cup, chocolaty and rich-toned.

Name: Finca Huixoc Geisha
Review: An understated Guatemala Geisha with cocoa-toned stone fruit and bittersweet florals throughout.

Name: Finca Santa Elisa Geisha
Review: A confident, pretty washed-process Guatemala Geisha enlivened by crisp chocolate and sweet herb notes throughout the profile.

Name: Finca Rosario de Fátima
Review: A citrusy, crisply nut-toned cup with a maple syrup-like sweetness and pear undertones.

Name: Finca Retana Maracaturra
Review: A brightly sweet, delicately tart Guatemala Maracaturra complicated by spicy floral notes.

Name: Finca San José Ocaña
Review: A straightforward, pleasingly familiar Guatemala cup: sweet-toned, chocolaty and nutty, with undertones of gentle aromatic wood notes.

Name: Belt Line Blend
Review: An easygoing blend of natural and washed-process coffees, crisply chocolaty with a lift from sweet berry notes.

Name: El Potrero
Review: A juicy-sweet, balanced Guatemala characterized by bright stone fruit and cocoa nib, along with sweet-spicy florals.

Name: Proyecto Aurora
Review: A wide-ranging, flavor-laden Guatemala cup with notes of high-toned fruit and sweet florals, balanced by deep nut and aromatic wood tones.

Name: Finca Santa Isabel
Origin: San Cristobal Verapaz, Alta Verapaz, Guatemala
Review: A multi-layered, brightly sweet washed Guatemala cup with deep floral and high-toned berry notes.

Name: Finca Patzibir
Origin: San Lucas Tolimán, Lake Atitlán, Guatemala
Review: A velvety, sweetly nutty Guatemala with undertones of spicy florals and caramel.

Name: Finca La Esperanza Villa Sarchi
Review: A sweet, chocolaty Guatemala Villa Sarchi with undertones of nuts, florals, and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Finca Las Moritas Pacamara
Review: A solid Guatemala Pacamara with a range of aromatic and flavor pleasures, from deep butterscotch to crisp apple to earthy-rich cedar.

Name: 5a Sur
Review: A subtly nuanced Guatemala cup with crisp apple and sweet herb notes and undertones of richly sweet almond throughout.

Name: 5a Poniente
Review: A brisk, bittersweet Guatemala cup, sweetly raisiny and crisply nut-toned.

Name: Finca San Carlos
Review: A friendly, accessible Guatemala cup with pleasing nut and cocoa tones throughout.

Name: Finca Las Moritas Caturra Amarillo
Review: An accessible, very crisp cup with delicate nut tones as anchor.

Name: Wilton Benitez Sidra
Review: A complex, deep-toned, very fruit-forward anaerobic natural Colombia Sidra redolent of Froot Loops cereal with a side of hot cocoa.

Name: Piura Peru
Review: A confident, deep-toned Peru with a chocolate-nut throughline and especially creamy body.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Natural
Review: Fruit, chocolate and floral notes converge in this lyrically fruit-forward, harmoniously balanced natural Panama Geisha.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Washed
Review: Elegantly spice-toned, richly floral, complex — a classic washed Panama Geisha cup.

Name: Grand Champion Red Bourbon Natural
Origin: Ka'u growing district, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: This decadently sweet, elegantly tart, complex natural-processed Hawai’i Ka’u is an exercise in balance and a nuanced flavor journey.

Name: Sumatra Lintong Kardon
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Review: A classic Sumatra cup that highlights the origin’s potential for depth and complexity, with a distinct throughline that evokes fresh earth just after a rain.

Name: Panama Finca Don Julian Geisha Washed
Review: A multi-layered Panama Geisha that leads with spicy-sweet floral notes atop stone fruit, rich nut, citrus and sweet herb.

Name: Guatemala Diamante Perez
Review: This chocolate-forward Guatemala cup has a tart fruit backbone with complications from enticing sweet-savory herb notes.

Name: Taiwan Nantou Yuchi Kanon Estate SL34 Natural
Review: An umami undercurrent complicates this otherwise juicy-sweet SL34 produced in Taiwan.

Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Yirgacheffe Burtukan Wako Natural G1
Review: A richly sweet natural-processed Ethiopia coffee with floral underpinnings supported by stone fruit and myrrh.

Name: Burundi Women of Turihamwe
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered Burundi alive with sweet spice and deep berry notes.

Name: Glory Days
Review: A darker-roasted Mexico cup with a dark-chocolate throughline and suggestions of spice-toned flowers, dried stone fruit, and sweet nut.

Name: Ethiopia Idido Tiluse Honey Process
Review: An understated, sweetly composed, citrus-toned Ethiopia honey-processed cup with cocoa notes throughout the profile.

Name: Queen’s Crown Rwanda
Review: A subtly confident, quietly complex Rwanda with cocoa nib, date and bittersweet nut at its center.

Name: Colombia Finca La Roca
Review: A Colombia honey anaerobic with a profile driven by tropical fruit, sweet floral, cocoa and bittersweet citrus notes, impressively complex, nuanced and engaging.

Name: Colombia La Esperanza
Review: A complex washed anaerobic Colombia with tangy fruit and gentle lactic notes throughout the profile, supported by rich aromatic wood and sweet caramel.

Name: Tanama Domenico Celli Borrero Anaerobic Natural
Review: An experimentally processed Puerto Rico coffee with tart fruit, lactic tang and intentionally promoted sweet ferment notes.

Name: Ethiopia YirgZ
Review: A classic Ethiopia washed cup with notes of stone fruit and cocoa, supported by spice-toned citrus and rich florals.

Name: Colombia Patio Bonita
Review: A complex, multi-layered washed Colombia driven by chocolate and citrus notes in harmonious balance.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Farmgate
Review: Berries and floral notes drive this natural-processed Ethiopia that remains light on its feet — delicate, balanced nicely between sweet and tart.

Name: Ethiopia Ardi Yeast Natural
Review: An exceptionally sweet, melony and cocoa-toned Ethiopia, a natural-processed coffee with yeast added during a 4-day ferment phase before final drying.

Name: Sumatra Ketiara
Review: An earthy, chocolate, deeply sweet, richly savory Sumatra cup, women-produced.

Name: Promise of Spring
Review: This Costa Rica/Ethiopia blend is driven by tart fruit, sweet nut and cocoa, with spicy floral notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Gesha Rebecca Natural
Review: A fruity, floral natural-processed Ethiopia Gesha with especially vibrant acidity and a throughline of lychee and wisteria.

Name: Mocha Java Blend
Review: An engaging variation on the classic theme of Mocha Java — crisp, fruity, chocolaty, and complicated by warming spice notes.

Name: Colombia Huila El Vergel Yellow Fruit Anaerobic
Review: A lactic-fruity, crisply chocolaty anaerobic natural with balance and finesse.

Name: Biodynamic Washed Geisha
Review: A friendly, accessible washed Geisha grown in China’s Yunnan Province — crisply chocolaty and floral with aromatic wood undertones.

Name: Colombia Finca El Paraíso Geisha Sake
Review: A decadent, expressive, voluptuous double-anaerobic Colombia Geisha with a wide range of aromas and flavors, from spice-toned bergamot to super-sweet lychee.

Name: Tanzania Nyasi Furaha
Review: A richly sweet-tart, energetic Tanzania with spicy floral and crisp cocoa nib notes — lively and enticing.

Name: Kenya Gachatha AA Top
Review: A particularly enticing rendition of the classic Kenya cup with deep, dark berry fruit and distinct undertones of dark chocolate and toffee.

Name: Costa Rica Finca Mirella
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A high-toned, fruity and floral-toned natural-processed Costa Rica.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Gatuya Factory AA Top
Review: A juicy, deep-toned Kenya cup with especially vibrant acidity and complex aromatics.

Name: Costa Rica Tarrazu Double Anaerobic Washed
Review: A multi-layered, deep-toned anaerobic natural Costa Rica with especially lively acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Bench Maji Lucy Station Gesha
Review: A confident, fruit-driven, cocoa-toned natural Ethiopia Gesha cup with especially bright acidity.

Name: Sumatra Pantan Musara
Origin: Pegasing, Takengon, Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: A natural-processed Sumatra animated by tart fruit and crisp chocolate suggestions.

Name: Honduras Finca El Colibri
Review: Sweet-toned and inviting throughout the profile, with leading notes of cocoa powder and caramel and berry and citrus undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Arbegona 74158 Natural
Review: A crisply sweet-savory, gently cocoa-toned Ethiopia natural with a pleasant hint of sweet ferment.

Name: Ethiopian Yirgacheffe 74110 Solar
Review: A balanced washed-process Ethiopia cup with pleasing notes of stone fruit and baking chocolate throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bursa Kebele Washed
Origin: Arbegona Woreda, Bursa Kebele, Sidama Region, Ethiopia
Review: A delicate, balanced washed Ethiopia cup, wood-framed with sweet floral undertones.

Name: Brasil Ipanema Premier Cru BLUE A50 Red Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Serra da Mantiqueira-Fazenda Rio Verde, Sul De Minas, Brazil
Review: A tart-leaning anaerobic natural Brazil cup with notes of sweet fruit, a lactic tang, and savory underpinnings.

Name: Wilton Benitez Pink Bourbon Colombia
Review: An elegant, decadent, pied piper of a coffee with its mesmerizing aromatics and addictively complex cup with notes like blackberry jam and frankincense — you’ll find more descriptors than you can count on both hands.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas SL28 Natural
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A juicy, vibrantly balanced, deeply fruit- and floral-toned natural Costa Rica, powerfully aromatic.

Name: Nano Genji #12 Ethiopia
Origin: Agaro Gera, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: A lovely expression of the classic washed Ethiopia profile: juicy, bright, multi-layered, tropical.

Name: Rose Fruit Dew B40
Review: A richly sweet experimentally processed Colombia cup with floral and umami undercurrents throughout (think lilac and teriyaki in strange harmony).

Name: Costa Rica Aquiares Estate Dark-Roast
Review: A fruit-toned, darker-roasted Costa Rica natural with berry notes alongside dark chocolate and smoky aromatic wood.

Name: Costa Rica White Honey
Review: Very sweet, delicately composed, with pretty fruit and cocoa notes as throughlines.

Name: Sumatra Pantan Musara
Origin: Pegasing, Takengon, Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: A friendly, sweetly earthy Sumatra cup with crisp chocolate and sweet spice notes.

Name: Gesha Spirits
Review: A lovely washed anaerobic Colombia Gesha with spicy floral and tropical fruit notes and undercurrents of wild honey throughout the profile.

Name: Panama HWC Coffee Estate Washed
Review: A multi-layered washed Panama Geisha that leads with exhilaratingly high-toned fruit and spicy-sweet floral notes.

Name: Philippine Rosemarie Rupecio
Origin: Sitio Pluto, Balutakay, Managa, Davao del Sur, Philippines
Review: A honey-processed Philippine coffee, deeply sweet-savory and nut-driven with undertones of sweet herbs.

Name: Panama HWC Coffee Estate Natural
Review: An intentionally fermenty, cocoa-toned Panama natural with interesting piney notes and sweet herb undertones.

Name: Colombia Fruit Maceration Series Lulo Bear
Review: This anaerobic and fruit-fermented Colombia displays big fruit throughout the profile with undertones of chocolate syrup and sweet herbs.

Name: Colombia Huila Charlotte Geisha Washed
Review: A perfumy but delicate Colombia Geisha with a floral throughline and bright stone fruit notes.

Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Double Anaerobic Thermal Shock Yellow Gesha
Review: This intense fruit and floral bomb, tempered only by aromatic wood notes, is interesting for its experimental processing, and offers clear appeal for devotees of fruity, floral coffees.

Name: More Floral
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A multi-layered, floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with complicating umami undertones throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Lucy Geisha
Review: A delicately tart, subtly aromatic natural Ethiopia Geisha cup, juicy and inviting.

Name: Costa Rica Finca Sabana Redonda SL28
Origin: Poas Volcano, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica
Review: A balanced, tartly fruity, cocoa-toned Costa Rica cup with rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Diamond Mountain Catuai Washed
Review: A Catuai from famed Panama Geisha producer Hacienda La Esmeralda — complex, cocoa and citrus driven.

Name: Guatemala El Injerto
Review: Lively and richly sweet, this Guatemala leads with notes of stone fruit and hazelnut.

Name: Yemen Al Kawlah Special Reserve Natural
Review: A flavor-saturated Yemen with focused fruit on both the nose and palate; juicy, wine-like acidity and nectar-like mouthfeel.

Name: Kona K7
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A fine, classic washed Kona cup: deep-toned, balanced, richly sweet, floral.

Name: Ecuador La Josefina Estate
Origin: El Chaco Canton, Parroquia Santa Rosa, Napo Province, Ecuador
Review: An impressive example of the rare Sidra variety, nuanced and deep, with impulses ranging from sweet to spice-toned, floral to fruity.

Name: Ethiopia Kafa Natural
Origin: Bonga Forest, Keficho-Shekicho Zone, southwest Ethiopia
Review: A vibrant, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia cup, delicately fruit-driven, with an especially rich, creamy mouthfeel.

Name: El Salvador Bourbon Semi-Washed
Review: A spice-toned, semi-washed (honey) El Salvador with deep floral and rich spice notes and an especially syrupy body.

Name: Peru Lucmabamba
Review: A chocolaty, nut-driven Peru, richly sweet and deep, with an especially syrupy, viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Sumatra Gayo Lues Natural
Review: A natural-processed coffee from Sumatra, where washed and wet-hulled is the most common processing method — fruit-driven and deeply aromatic.

Name: Burundi Turihamwe
Review: A delicately perfumed, floral-toned Burundi with appealing sweet fruit and citrus notes.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Rukira
Review: A balanced, berry-driven Kenya complicated by appealing umami-rich salted caramel notes.

Name: Ethiopia Worka Sakaro Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A flavor-saturated anaerobic natural Ethiopia: harmonious, integrated, inviting and juicy.

Name: Bale Mountain Natural Ethiopia
Origin: Werka, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An elegant, sweetly fermenty Ethiopia natural with leading notes of dried berries and dark chocolate. A throughline of red-wine barrel contributes complexity and depth.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona 74158 Washed
Review: A richly spice-toned, deeply aromatic washed Ethiopia, lively yet balanced.

Name: Cumba #3 Burundi
Review: A multi-layered Burundi complicated by a compelling sweet herbaceousness and savory depth.

Name: Leles Garut Java
Origin: Cijapati, Garut Regency, West Java, Indonesia
Review: An unusually composed washed Java with crisply tart fruit, rich chocolate and delicate spice notes throughout.

Name: Queen Blend
Review: A medium-dark-roasted blend, deeply chocolaty and richly nut-toned, with pleasing spice-toned floral nuance.

Name: Mexico Chiapas Kulatik
Review: A deep-toned Chiapas cup with a throughline of crisp chocolate and almond, roast-rounded and sweet.

Name: La Papaya Ecuador Geisha Natural
Review: A fine example of what a Geisha natural from Ecuador can achieve: stunning aromatics, lush complexity throughout the profile, and fruit-forward with finesse.

Name: Colombia Tolima Finca El Vergel Rebel Geisha
Review: An enticingly rich Colombia Geisha aromatic fireworks whose promise is fulfilled in the cup with deep oolong-like impulses and sweet citrus zest.

Name: Colombia Buenos Aires Honey Process-Yellow Velvet Peach
Review: A powerfully aromatic, flavor-saturated, experimentally processed Colombia cup that has been co-fermented with peaches.

Name: Encounter of Summer
Review: An unabashedly fruit-forward Costa Rica/Ethiopia blend that achieves balance and depth from sweet herb and citrus zest.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona Duwancho Cooperative G1
Review: An inviting black honey-processed Ethiopia — rich, round, deeply aromatic.

Name: Gourmet x Geisha
Review: A friendly, nut-driven Guatemala cup with undertones of bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A juicy-sweet, balanced Ethiopia natural characterized by bright stone fruit and cocoa nib throughout the profile.

Name: Organic Driftless
Review: A satisfying organic Peru with sweet chocolate and lime notes complicated by subtle spice tones.

Name: Kenya
Review: A big, resonant dark-roast Kenya that preserves origin character and offers up sweetly tart fruit, delicate floral and rich aromatic wood notes with a not-too-roasty edge.

Name: SL34 Dark Roast
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A mesmerizing darker-roasted Kona SL34 with brightly sweet fruit and delicate florals against a backdrop of richly aromatic scorched clove.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Lucy Station Dark Roast
Review: A surprisingly bright dark-roasted Ethiopia Gesha with a throughline of pretty florals and rich chocolate notes.

Name: Kenya AB Athena Plus
Review: A deeply satisfying, rich-toned, dark-roasted Kenya with smoky herb notes, dried stone fruit, and spicy florals.

Name: Kenya Muranga
Review: A complex, rich-toned, moderately dark-roasted Kenya driven by dark berry fruit, deep chocolate, and sweet floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural Dark
Review: A multi-layered Ethiopia natural, vibrantly spice-toned and sweetly floral.

Name: Black Peach Q Blend
Review: An exceptionally bright dark-roast coffee complicated by crisp nut and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Map 40 Mokha Java
Review: A complex variation on the classic Mokha Java theme, in this case Ethiopia-heavy, with depth from a Papua New Guinea. Redolent with blackberry and cardamom.

Name: Sumatra Karo Mandheling – ‘lil darker
Origin: Paranginan, Humbahas Province, Karo Highlands, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: A complex, nutty, floral, sweetly earthy cup: classic Sumatra right down to the distinct pipe tobacco notes.

Name: Sumatra Dark
Review: For fans of overtly earthy coffees, this Sumatra, with its sweet pipe tobacco and floral vanilla tones, fits the bill.

Name: Arabian Mocha-Java Dark Roast
Review: A dark-roasted twist on the Mocha Java blend from a national chain that is a widely accessible go-to in the U.S. when you’re in the mood for deep, dark familiarity.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Yeast Process
Origin: Wenago Woreda, Gedeo Zone, SNNP, southern Ethiopia
Review: A bright yeast-processed Ethiopia with a throughline of cocoa nib and citrus notes — rich, juicy, high-toned.

Name: Peru Maria Nieves
Origin: La Coipa, San Ignacio, Cajamarca, Peru
Review: A quietly complete Peru cup with deep berry, rich chocolate, and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Kenya Kagumo AB
Review: A classic Kenya cup with particularly inviting, juicy-bright acidity grounded by engaging black currant notes, the hallmark of the origin.

Name: West Papua Wamena
Origin: Wamena growing region, West Papua, New Guinea
Review: This conventionally washed-process coffee from West Papua, New Guinea, an Indonesian province better known for its rustic wet-hulled coffees, is sweet, complex, chocolaty and nutty.

Name: Costa Rica Turrialba Volcano Honey Process
Review: A richly fruit-toned honey-processed Ethiopia cup centered around notes of berries and spice-toned florals.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Adame Washed Process
Review: An inviting washed Ethiopia cup with depth from cocoa notes and a rich bittersweetness from citrus zest.

Name: Colombia Finca Monteverde
Review: A balanced, easygoing natural-processed Colombia Geisha with engaging fruit, floral and herb notes.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Gedeb Worka Chelchele
Review: A juicy, citrus- and floral-toned washed Ethiopia as deep as it is bright.

Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Station Geisha
Review: A washed Ethiopia redolent of stone fruit and salted caramel; juicy-sweet and rich.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Aricha Woreda Yirgacheffe
Review: A hearty washed Ethiopia characterized by sweet-tart grapefruit and richly aromatic cedar, softened by dark chocolate tones.

Name: Colombia Huila Finca El Triunfo Martha Zuñiga Pink Bourbon
Review: A delightfully deep yet playful anaerobic natural Colombia Pink Bourbon that demonstrates varietal character throughout the cup — juicy, fruity, balanced.

Name: Costa Rica SL28 Natural
Review: Produced from trees of the admired SL28 variety, originating in Kenya but grown in Costa Rica, here processed by the natural method: juicy, chocolaty, citrusy and deep.

Name: Sunrise Blend
Review: A friendly, accessible blend with warm earth and crisp cocoa tones supported by rich aromatic wood.

Name: Guatemala La Colina
Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala
Review: A straight-ahead, comfortable Guatemala cup with a throughline of sweet nut and crisp apple notes and an especially rich mouthfeel.

Name: Burundi Bukeye
Review: An attractively complex, deeply layered, floral- and spice-toned Burundi.

Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Station Washed Geisha
Review: A floral, sweetly citrusy washed Ethiopia, richly aromatic and bright.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Faysel Abdosh Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Ethiopia Sidamo Faysel Abdosh Anaerobic Natural
Review: An intentionally fermenty Ethiopia anaerobic cup with juicy berry notes, lactic tang, and sweet herbs throughout.

Name: Kenya Kanwangi AA
Review: This classic Kenya displays dark berry and rich chocolate notes vibrantlly juxtaposed with spicy florals and salted caramel.

Name: Guatemala El Socorro Maracaturra
Review: A harmonious, integrated Guatemala Maracaturra with elegant depth and perky acidity.

Name: Bella Carmona Guatemala
Review: The deep floral character of this Guatemala is supported by crisp chocolate and sweet herb. Particularly plush, viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Huye Mountain Rwanda
Review: A confident, familiar, satisfying Rwanda with notes of red berry up front, complicated by pleasing bittersweet citrus and crisp cocoa nib throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Lucy Station
Review: A very pretty washed Ethiopia Geisha with complex citrus and spice-toned florals, and a compelling umami undercurrent.

Name: Ecuador Peñaherrera AAA
Review: A vibrant, harmonious Ecuador cup that leads with floral depth and richly sweet-tart fruit notes — lively and invigorating.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Jade Lotus
Review: A lively, cocoa- and stone fruit-driven washed Ethiopia with a throughline of sweet citrus notes supported by rich aromatic wood.

Name: Panama Boquete Casa Ruiz Finca Cafelandia Pacamara
Review: A multi-layered washed Panama Pacamara, sweetly savory and richly herbaceous with undertones of cocoa nib and tamarind.

Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Yirgacheffe Gedeb Banko Gotiti G1 Natural
Review: A quietly balanced, crisply chocolaty natural Ethiopia cup with rich aromatic wood notes throughout.

Name: Blue Sunda Estate Java
Review: A striking yet reassuring cup, original in structure and aromatics yet gracefully complete, without overstatement.

Name: Bali Kintamani
Review: A fine, cleanly expressed natural in the old-fashioned sweet, brandy-toned style. Lovely, quietly lush floral notes as well.

Name: West Java Frinsa Estate Natural
Review: Here the natural processing method encourages a brisk, bright cup rounded by grape, pistachio and musky flowers.

Name: Java Argopuro Mountain Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Tlogosari Village, Argopuro, East Java, Indonesia
Review: Anaerobic natural processing nicely sweetens and brightens the profile, and encourages a particularly wide range of aroma and flavor notes. A quietly complete coffee that should satisfy those looking for both familiarity and excitement.

Name: Kintamani Bali
Review: Sumatra lite; nods with quiet delicacy toward the cedary, tobacco-toned depth we associate with wet-hulled Sumatras.

Name: Indonesia Java Sunda Supreme SC18
Review: Fans of deep, earthy wet-hulled Sumatras may enjoy this subtle variation on the style: nutty and oaky with fragrant hints of moist tobacco and sweet lily.

Name: Bali Kintamani
Review: Expresses the sweet-savory nut and cocoa side of natural processing, enlivened by a shimmer of tart fruit.

Name: Bali Yeast Honey Edi Kadek Lot
Review: Walks a delicate, engaging line between caramelly sweetness and shiitake-like savory, with a hint of flowers at the top.

Name: Veracruz
Review: A friendly, accessible Mexico cup: richly chocolaty and supported by sweet nut, fruit and floral tones.

Name: La Papaya Natural Ecuador
Review: A uniquely composed experimentally processed Ecuador cup that’s a roller-coaster of aroma and flavor — an exhilarating ride.

Name: Wilton Benitez Tabi VIP Colombia
Review: An invigoratingly bright anaerobic Colombia grounded by rich savory impulses with compelling complications.

Name: El Mango Peru
Review: A bright, deep-toned, richly sweet and very satisfying women-farmed washed Ecuador cup.

Name: Banko Gotiti Ethiopia
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: juicy, bright, citrusy and floral.

Name: El Morito Guatemala
Review: A citrusy and stone fruit-driven, impressively complex washed Guatemala cup.

Name: Gera DR Congo
Origin: South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A deeply aromatic washed DR Congo cup with a profile is focused around floral and melon notes, with pleasing umami undertones.

Name: Pantan Musara Sumatra
Origin: Pegasing, Takengon, Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: An enticingly savory, richly sweet washed Sumatra cup that offers spice suggestions and crisp chocolate with mineral undertones.

Name: Giakanja Kenya
Review: This Kenya hits all the notes: tart fruit, spicy florals, rich chocolate, pleasing aromatic wood and complex citrus.

Name: Asobombo Colombia
Review: A sweet, chocolaty washed Colombia cup, inviting in its familiarity and depth, with intriguing savory nut underpinnings (think pistachio).

Name: Honduras Marcala Anaerobic Natural
Review: A crisply berry-driven anaerobic natural Honduras, with pleasing almond and chocolate complications.

Name: Ethiopia Basha Bekele
Review: At the center of this pretty natural-processed Ethiopia is a melange of bright stone fruit and rich spice-toned florals grounded by deep chocolate, a winning aromatic and flavor profile.

Name: Colombia Luz Helena Salazar Wine Yeast Grape Honey
Review: A Colombia Castillo experimentally fermented with wine yeasts— spice-toned and lively with an especially viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Ka‘ū Malolactic Natural
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A juicy, fruity, floral-toned Ka‘ū  cup processed by malolactic fermentation, a technique commonly used in wine that results in a coffee with concentrated berry and spicy floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Diima Natural Process Benti Nenka, Hambela Wamena
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia cup driven by tropical fruit and floral tones, with cocoa nib as ballast throughout.

Name: Colombia Finca Las Nubes
Review: A savory-leaning Colombia cup with undertones of spicy florals and tangy tropical fruit.

Name: Rwanda
Review: A friendly, crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned Rwanda complicated by pleasingly bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: Colombia Finca Paraiso Gesha Wilton Benitez
Review: Balanced, deep, elegant and inviting, this experimentally processed Geisha is characterized by tropical fruit, bittersweet citrus, and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Colombia Finca La España Gesha
Review: A lovely floral-driven washed Geisha cup, with the flowers supported by richly sweet stone fruit and sweet herb.

Name: Colombia Huila La Esperanza Pink Bourbon Honey
Review: A deep, rich-toned Colombia Pink Bourbon, chocolaty and balanced.

Name: Colombia Antioquia El Roble Long Fermentation Washed Chiroso
Review: A richly aromatic, invitingly sweet-tart Colombia cup with a throughline of rich dark chocolate.

Name: Passion Paradise

Name: Autumn Forest

Name: Colombia Geisha Spirits Brew Bag

Name: Ethiopia Worka Sakaro Brew Bag

Name: Motherland Burundi Brew Bag

Name: Steep ‘N Deep Brew Bag

Name: Memory Lane Brew Bag

Name: Ethiopia Washed Brew Bag
Review: A balanced, delicately floral-toned washed Ethiopia brew bag, crisp and bright.

Name: Bull Demon King Brew Bag

Name: Rise Blend Brew Bag

Name: Big Truck Organic Brew Bag
Review: A friendly, accessible brew bag blend that leads with chocolate suggestions supported by crisp pear and sweet hazelnut.

Name: Road Less Traveled Brew Bag
Review: An easygoing, balanced brew bag blend with leading notes of almond and baking chocolate.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Brew Bag
Review: A delicate, gently fruit-forward, berry-driven Ethiopia natural-processed brew bag with sweet herb and citrus underpinnings.

Name: Limited Edition Light Roast Fair Trade Brew Bag

Name: Ethiopia Gora Kone
Review: A multi-layered, classic washed Ethiopia cup with spicy floral, sweet stone fruit, and rich cocoa notes.

Name: Easter Sunrise Blend
Review: A rich-toned, richly chocolaty blend, balanced and deep.

Name: Ecuador Pichincha Imbabura Chirmoya

Name: Wonderblend

Name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Botabaa G1

Name: Organic Peru San Fernando Tres Fincas Gesha

Name: Kenya Washed Kiambu Gititu AB Top

Name: Kona Classic
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i

Name: Hawai’i Ka‘ū Champagne Natural

Name: Yemen Natural Hamoud Abdullah AL-Khisheni

Name: Guatemala Acatenango Gesha

Name: Kenya Gatomboya
Review: A complex, juicy-deep Kenya cup with an especially satisfying, exceptionally long finish.

Name: Ethiopia Guji

Name: Burundi Nemba Washed Process

Name: Ethiopia Idido

Name: Panama Catuai

Name: Costa Rica Tarrazu Minor Jimenez
Review: An easygoing, cocoa- and nut-driven Costa Rica cup.

Name: Worka Sakaro Ethiopia

Name: Teremuka Kenya

Name: La Joya Ecuador

Name: Norte Peru

Name: Ethiopia Keramo Natural

Name: Peru Cajamarca

Name: El Salvador La Muela Pacamara

Name: Rwanda “Ireme” Anaerobic

Name: Colombia Finca Juan Martin Aced Sidra

Name: Guatemala Natural Santa Felisa Gesha SF-04 95

Name: Ethiopia 2022 COE #3 Washed Temam 74110

Name: Ethiopia Guji Shakiso Mulish Washed

Name: Taiwan Alishan Honey

Name: Galaxy Gesha Quindio Colombia Edwin Noreña

Name: Ka‘ū JN Farms Malolactic Honey

Name: Colombia Cauca Granja Paraiso 92 – Pink Bourbon

Name: Ethiopia Gatta Anaerobic

Name: Colombia Granja Paraíso-92- Papayo Kōji

Review: A complex, multi-layered experimentally processed Geisha cup with focused fruit supported by crisp cocoa notes.

Name: Panama Geisha Finca Debra Vivid
Review: A balanced, richly sweet Panama Geisha cup, processed by a variation on the carbonic maceration method and leading with notes of stone fruit and sweet almond.

Name: Ethiopia Hamasho Washed
Review: An invitingly elegant washed Ethiopia cup, deftly balancing fruit, floral and cocoa tones — buoyantly juicy and complete.

Name: Ethiopia Idido Anaerobic Natural
Review: A lyrically composed Ethiopia anaerobic cup with judicious fruit, spice-toned florals and richly vibrant cocoa and honey impulses.

Name: Mexico Cup of Excellence #7
Review: A particularly fine Mexico Geisha: elegantly spice-toned, richly floral, deeply sweet and complex.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Red Honey
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica
Review: This honey-processed Costa Rica shows a berry throughline with undertones of rich florals and a resiny, amber-like note that contributes depth and complexity.

Name: Garden of Eden
Review: An experimentally processed fruit-macerated Colombia cup with a vivid citrus throughline — also chocolaty and nut-toned with hints of spicy florals.

Name: Colombia Finca Santa Maria Honey Tabi
Review: A satisfying, richly chocolaty Colombia honey with notes of stone fruit, citrus zest, and sweet nut.

Name: Mexico La Peña
Review: A friendly, accessible, brightly sweet Mexico cup with pleasing citrus and nut tones throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Reko Yirgacheffe
Review: A classic washed Yirgacheffe cup driven by notes of stone fruit, cocoa, and bittersweet citrus.

Name: Double-Anaerobic Fermentation Tamiru Tadesse
