Review: A floral-driven anaerobic Ethiopia cup free of the sensory distractions often associated with the anaerobic processing method. This anaerobic is clean, crisp, richly sweet with tart undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Chelbesa Danche Yirgacheffe
Origin: Chelchele, Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia
Review: A brightly sweet, fragrantly floral-driven washed Ethiopia cup complicated by notes of almond and pink peppercorn.

Name: Ethiopia Honey Process Tamiru Tadesse
Review: A delicate, elegant, honey-processed Sidamo cup with leading notes of dried berry and herby citrus notes.

Name: Colombia Planadas Tolima
Review: A lovely Colombia Geisha cup, finely tea-like in its aromatic delicacy.

Name: Kenya Kiambu
Review: A savory-sweet Kenya cup with classic notes of black currant and tomato leaf — and especially complex, appealing acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Chelechele Yirgacheffe
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A blueberry bomb of a natural Yirgacheffe, with the berry notes supported by crisp chocolate and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Tropical Summer Colombia La Sierra
Review: An experimentally processed Colombia, sweetly fruit-forward with ballast from crisp chocolate notes.

Name: Festivity Blend
Review: A sweetly nut-toned holiday blend with pleasing citrus and cocoa impulses.

Name: Ethiopia Halo Beriti
Review: A lyrical, vividly harmonious washed Ethiopia, complete with high-toned fruit, lush floral, and grounding savory notes.

Name: Narsha Gesha
Review: A decadent fruit-centered medley of stone fruit, tropical fruit, citrus and crisp cocoa nib with exceptionally vibrant acidity and mouthfeel.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
Review: A delicately aromatic washed Yirgacheffe cup with a citrus and cocoa throughline.

Name: Nicaragua Los Pedernales
Review: A pleasing natural-processed Nicaragua cup animated by delicate fruit and crisp chocolate notes.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Uraga Welichu
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An exciting washed Ethiopia cup that evokes tropical fruits and flowers, invigorating in its rich aromatics and structural intrigue.

Name: Don Roger & Isabel’s Natural Fruit Symphony
Review: A balanced, sweetly bright natural-processed Nicaragua cup with tart fruit and citrus at the top and a resonant base of cocoa nib and fragrant aromatic wood.

Name: Kenya Gitare AA TOP
Review: A superb version of the beloved Kenya cup with deep berry and bittersweet citrus supported by an umami, salted-caramel throughline.

Name: Costa Rica Naranjo Danilo Salazar Arias
Review: This natural-processed Costa Rica leads with tart fruit, balanced by rich nut and sweet floral tones.

Name: Yemen Natural Sana’a Manakhah Ja’adi
Review: A deeply aromatic, richly fruit- and chocolate-driven, spice-framed Yemen cup, nuanced and complex.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Gesha Special Natural Lot 03
Review: An impeccably composed natural-processed Ethiopia Geisha that leads with decadently sweet tropical fruit supported by rich chocolate and spicy-sweet florals.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochere Debo Premium Lot Washed Process
Review: An inviting classic expression of the washed Yirgacheffe type, citrusy and floral with rich aromatics throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Burtukaana Danche
Review: A nuanced, richly aromatic natural-processed Ethiopia with juicy acidity and deep chocolate suggestions.

Name: Finca Buenavista Edwin Zambrano Colombia
Review: An inviting, cleanly fruit-toned, natural-processed Colombia cup with a crisp chocolate throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Wolichu Wachu Anaerobic Natural Process
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An interesting spice-toned anaerobic Ethiopia cup — nuanced and rich with an especially buoyant, lively mouthfeel.

Name: Honduras Copan Finca Liquidambar Natural Process
Origin: Las Flores, Marcala, La Paz, Honduras
Review: A quietly confident Honduras natural, harmonious and integrated.

Name: Colombia Tolima La Gallera Honey Process
Review: A cleanly fruit-driven honey-processed Colombia with pleasingly spicy floral undertones.

Name: The Glistening Orchard Blend
Review: A uniquely composed blend of two Colombia fruit-fermented washed coffees combined with a traditionally washed Ethiopia — chocolaty and tart-leaning.

Name: Ethiopia Hateso Guji Washed
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia Guji cup with deeply expressed notes of stone fruit, spicy florals, and rich dark chocolate.

Name: El Salvador Unicorn
Origin: El Bálsamo Quetzaltepec growing region, El Salvador
Review: A fruity, crisply cocoa-toned natural-processed El Salvador cup produced exclusively for Drink Coffee Do Stuff.

Name: Alishan Washed
Review: A balanced, attractive washed Alishan cup, sweet and chocolaty, enlivened by spicy floral tones throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Wush Wush Black Honey Lot 2
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A crisply juicy, rich-toned, fruit- and floral-laden honey-processed Wush Wush, offered at a great value

Name: Alishan Natural
Review: A friendly, accessible Taiwan-grown coffee characterized by richly sweet nut and crisp aromatic wood suggestions.

Name: Guatemala El Injerto Pacamara
Review: A fine umami-tending cup with equal impulses toward savory and sweet, contributing impressive depth and complexity to the profile.

Name: Honduras Roberto Figueroa
Review: A richly nuanced Pacas cup from Honduras, paradoxically both savory yet bright, with undertones of spicy florals.

Name: Guatemala Tojquia
Review: A deeply satisfying, classic washed Guatemala cup that is both unassuming and confident, with notes of sweet citrus, cocoa, tart florals and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Guatemala Don Angel
Review: A bright, juicy Guatemala cup with tart fruit, sweet nut, and spicy flowers.

Name: El Salvador La Lagunita
Review: A nuanced, rich El Salvador cup centered around dark chocolate and melon, complicated by notes of fresh, sweet tobacco.

Name: El Salvador Finca Santa Elena El Corozo Pacamara
Review: A balanced, crisply sweet, chocolate- and citrus-driven El Salvador Pacamara cup.

Name: Panama Mama Cata Typica
Review: A sweetly nutty, intriguingly savory Panama Typica animated by notes of dried stone fruit and salty-sweet candy.

Name: Guatemala Valentón
Review: A friendly, accessible Guatemala cup, sweetly chocolaty and richly floral.

Name: Nicaragua Jinotega Fincas Mierisch La Escondida Red Pacamara
Review: An unusually structured Nicaragua Red Pacamara cup with umami-like notes as a throughline and bright citrus underneath, both supported by a caramelly sweetness.

Name: Costa Rica Finca San Luis
Origin: Santa Maria de Dota, Tarrazu growing region, Costa Rica
Review: A classic washed Costa Rica cup: deeply sweet, richly nutty, with especially invigorating acidity, both balanced and lively.

Name: Colombia Finca Samboni Gesha Anaerobic Natural
Review: A Colombia Geisha processed by the anaerobic natural method, cleanly fruit-driven with lush aromatics and juicy-bright acidity.

Name: Colombia Tres Dragones
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle de Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A delicately fermenty, richly chocolaty fruit bomb from a Colombia producer now well-known for creative processing experiments.

Name: Rwanda Cyesha Natural
Review: This natural-processed Rwanda has sweet-tart top notes and a rich dark chocolate base, complicated by bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Wate Natural G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A delicately fruit-toned natural-process Ethiopia with crisp chocolate and rich aromatic wood notes throughout the profile.

Name: Tinamit Tolimán
Origin: San Lucas Tolimán, Lake Atitlán growing region, Guatemala
Review: A richly chocolaty Guatemala cup with a compelling floral throughline supported by sweet herb notes.

Name: Finca Patzibir
Review: A quietly confident, sweetly nut-toned Guatemala cup with a particularly appealing, viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Proyecto Aurora
Review: A deeply floral, richly chocolaty Guatemala cup complicated by sweet nut and resonant aromatic wood notes.

Name: Finca El Potrero
Review: A bright, balanced, juicy Guatemala cup driven by dark stone fruit, spicy floral and sweet nut notes.

Name: Chacayá Santiago Atitlán
Review: Balanced, bright, invigoratingly crisp, with throughlines of stone fruit, sweet nut tones and baking chocolate.

Name: Finca Santa Isabel
Origin: Cobán growing region, Alta Verapaz Department, Guatemala
Review: An expansive Guatemala Caturra cup, richly bittersweet and floral-toned, juicy and bright.

Name: Esperanza Villa Sarchi
Review: A balanced, comfortable, sweet-toned Guatemala cup with sweet chocolate and nut tones throughout.

Name: 5a Sur
Review: A solid Guatemala cup with pleasing savory undertones, deftly roasted to the dark end of medium to develop sweet chocolate notes and intensify body.

Name: 5a Poniente
Review: A crisp, sweetly herbaceousrr Guatemala cup with warming spice tones throughout.

Name: Colombia Castillo Fruit Maceration Series (Passionfruit)
Review: High-toned, explicitly and cleanly fruit-forward, leading with notes of passionfruit and lychee — tropics in a cup.

Name: Colombia Castillo Fruit Maceration Series (Grape)
Review: A very sweet experimental Colombia cup that suggests the flavor of certain hard candies, complicated by a pleasing tartness and crisp, bracing chocolate.

Name: Colombia Castillo Fruit Maceration Series (Strawberry)
Review: While the co-fermentation with strawberries is not obvious in the cup, there’s an overt berry throughline here that isn’t afraid to take over — an invocation of summer desserts.

Name: Balearic Beans
Review: A mashup of overlapping fruit narratives: candy, caramelized nuts, cocoa — an engaging blend for lovers of fruity coffees.

Name: Colombia Castillo Fruit Maceration Series (Peach)
Review: A fruit-forward, experimentally processed Colombia fermented with macerated peaches, a method that amplifies the stone fruit inclinations of the cup.

Name: El Triunfo Mexico
Review: Chocolaty, crisply sweet. Baking chocolate, Asian pear, almond brittle, pink grapefruit zest, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with round, balanced acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of pink grapefruit zest and maple syrup.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Tamiru Tadesse Anaerobic Natural Special Auction Lot
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A multi-layered, deeply rich, complex Ethiopia processed by the anaerobic natural method, with a candy-like sweetness and spicy floral resonance.

Name: Guatemala Finca Las Victorias Anaerobic Natural
Review: An invitingly complex, richly bittersweet Guatemala anaerobic cup enlivened by pleasing suggestions of sweet herb and stone fruit.

Name: Colombia La Esperanza 100% Geisha Hanashaku
Review: A pretty Colombia Geisha natural cup with clean fruit and spice-toned floral notes and crisp cocoa undertones.

Name: Kona Extra Fancy
Origin: Kona growing region, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A classic Kona: balanced and invigorating with deep chocolate, nut, fruit and floral impulses — rich chocolate in particular carries from aroma far into the finish.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Perla Negra
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Review: A fruit-centric natural-processed Costa Rica cup with a cocoa throughline and complex spicy-floral undertones.

Name: Ecuador COE 1st place Arashi Typica Mejorado Washed
Review: Complex and harmonious, intriguing and enigmatic as it unfolds, this washed Ecuador cup — which took first place in the Cup of Excellence this harvest year — is worth seeking out for its bright, confident aromatics that are born out in the rich, multi-layered cup.

Name: Burundi Natural Anaerobic Kibingo
Review: A sweet-tart-savory anaerobic natural Burundi with an abundance of both fruit and chocolate, supported by spice and aromatic wood impulses.

Name: Peru Gesha Limited-Release Homer Alarcón Gayoso
Review: A quietly confident, exceptionally sweet washed Peru Gesha cup with leading notes of caramel and stone fruit.

Name: Ethiopia Getu Kurume Natural
Review: An exemplary natural Ethiopia Yirgacheffe cup: bright, balanced, yet juicy and deep.

Name: Papua New Guinea Wahgi Valley Sigri Estate Peaberry
Origin: Western Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: A warming, spice-driven PNG cup complicated by tart fruit and rich flowers; high-toned and balanced.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Asali Peaberry
Review: An especially vibrant, juicy version of the classic Kenya cup: deep-toned, complex, very sweet and richly savory.

Name: Memories of Autumn
Review: A lively, cocoa-toned blend of Ethiopia and Colombia coffees that’s balanced and deep-toned — both richly chocolaty and vibrantly fruit-driven.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Morel Floral Kudume
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A delicate, crisply chocolaty washed Ethiopia cup with rich aromatic wood notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Gera Estate Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Djimma growing region, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: A dessert-like Ethiopia anaerobic natural: chocolaty, fruit-driven and deep, evocative of a tropical fruit melange, with vibrant acidity and lush body.

Name: Colombia Cauca Finca El Paraiso Rose Tea
Review: A Colombia anaerobic with tart fruit notes at the top of the profile and richly sweet floral undertones.

Name: Symphony Costa Rica Canet Caturra Raisin Honey
Review: A delicate, sweet-toned Costa Rica cup with notes of dried fruit, sweet nuts and crisp chocolate.

Name: Goddess Costa Rica Dota Tarrazu Geisha Natural
Review: A quietly complex, fruit- and herb-toned Costa Rica natural with an especially attractive, buoyant mouthfeel.

Name: Colombia Cauca Finca El Paraiso Double-Anaerobic Flor Lychee
Review: This Colombia anaerobic offers and unrestrained experience of sweet-tart fruit and rich florals that play off each other in synergistic harmony.

Name: Costa Rica Canet Musician Mozart
Review: A rich, deeply sweet Costa Rica cup that evokes the aromas of an American bakery.

Name: Colombia El Paraiso Floral Lychee
Review: A fruit-driven anaerobic cup complicated by savory, sweetly herbaceous impulses.

Name: Open Country Cafe Series
Review: A crisply chocolaty and sweetly nut-toned blend with generous floral notes and a nuanced herbaceous lean.

Name: Costa Rica Cerro Dragon Geisha Honey
Review: An invitingly complex Costa Rica honey-processed cup driven notes of tropical fruit, sweet herbs and crisp cocoa.

Name: Guatemala Washed El Injerto EI05 Mocca
Review: A vivid, lyrical washed Guatemala Mocca with layers of complexity, satisfying depth, and rich, balanced resonance that carries far into the finish — a thoroughly complete cup.

Name: Taiwan Natural Alishan Zhuo-Wu Geisha
Review: A gorgeous Taiwan Geisha driven by dried red berry notes at the top of the profile and deep, rich chocolate notes near the bottom; a complex and exciting cup.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Uraga Tome 74110 Lot K06
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: As elegant a fruit bomb as they come, tropical leaning with deep chocolate underpinnings and rich resinous aromatics.

Name: Kenya Gathaithi AA
Review: Dark berry and rich chocolate notes characterize this deeply aromatic, balanced cup. Attractive price for such a distinguished Kenya.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Dabaye
Review: A familiar, comforting washed-process Ethiopia cup enlivened by delicate cocoa, fruit and sweet herb notes throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia Biloya Washed G1
Review: A sweet-savory washed Ethiopia cup, cocoa-driven with undertones of sweet herb and spicy floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Benti Nenka Dry Process
Review: A quietly pleasing dry-processed Yirgacheffe cup with leading notes of citrus supported by sweet almond undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Birbisakela Washed G1
Review: A friendly, balanced Ethiopia cup: crisp, floral, delicately and brightly sweet.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Bensa Washed G1
Review: A multi-layered, quietly complex Guji cup with deep fruit and rich-toned  floral notes.

Name: Shut-Eye Decaf
Review: Rich aromatic wood notes provide a base for crisp cocoa and citrus highlights.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Tobutu Tuta G1 Experimental LOT 181NA2021
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A resonant, subtly complex Guji cup for those who enjoy balanced, layered fruit and crisp cocoa supported by the perfumy depth of sandalwood.

Name: Costa Rica La Toboba Red Honey
Review: A rich Costa Rica red honey with inviting sweet fruit and flowers and undertones of rich nut butter.

Name: Colombia Buesaco
Review: An easygoing, cocoa-driven natural-processed Colombia with berry notes throughout, supported by suggestions of rich aromatic wood.

Name: Colombia Jardines del Eden Pink Bourbon Wine Yeast Honey
Review: A uniquely composed cup: This honey-processed Colombia was fermented with passionfruit, reinforcing an intoxicatingly tropical profile.

Name: Kenya AA
Review: A delicate yet juicy Kenya cup with a floral throughline and savory-sweet herbal notes.

Name: Ethiopia Bekele Heto Natural
Origin: Worka-Sakaro, Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, Ethiopia
Review: Redolent of wild berries growing in an oak forest, this natural Ethiopia is balanced, confidently fruity and crisply cocoa-toned.

Name: Kenya Karindundu AB
Review: A multi-layered Kenya cup centered around red fruit and savory-leaning florals. Nuanced and engaging.

Name: Kenya Ichuga AA
Review: A classic Kenya cup: sweet, savory, bright, juicy, expressing equal parts fruit and flowers.

Name: Costa Rica Canet Raisin Honey
Review: A rich, engaging honey-processed Costa Rica cup with a throughline of sweet herb and flowers.

Name: Birhanu Sisters’ Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup with stone fruit and citrus notes at the top and resonant ballast from cocoa nib and fragrant aromatic wood.

Name: Bat Country Dark Roast Ethiopia
Review: Chocolaty, citrusy, floral-toned, this washed Ethiopia is roasted to a tactful darkish medium, emphasizing its depth and intensity.

Name: Kenya Gichithaini AA
Origin: Mathira West District, Nyeri County, Kenya
Review: A pleasing cup for those who prefer a deeper, savory-leaning Kenya profile to the brighter style. Particularly lively, lilting mouthfeel.

Name: Colombia Cerro Azul Enano
Origin: Trujillo, Valle del Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: This rare Enano (dwarf Geisha) excites with high-toned fruit, crisp cocoa, and rich floral notes throughout.

Name: Peru Incahuasi
Review: Laden with tropical fruit notes, this unusually composed natural-processed Peru excites with its vibrantly sweet-tart structure and deep floral and herb tones.

Name: Colombia Aponte’s Guardians
Review: A balanced, inviting washed Colombia cup saturated with notes of stone fruit and rich florals, animated by juicy-bright acidity.

Name: Nicaragua Flor de Dalia Natural
Origin: La Dalia, Matagalpa Department, northern Nicaragua
Review: A refreshing, very sweet natural-processed Nicaragua cup with pretty citrus and spicy floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha G1 Natural
Review: A quietly confident natural-processed Ethiopia Geisha cup — invigoratingly tart, balanced by sweet nut and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Reina de la Asuncion Ecuador
Review: A flavor-saturated, pungently bright washed Ecuador cup with elegant floral top notes on a base of citrus, stone fruit and perfumy aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga More Floral Kudume Washed
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: Pitch-perfect aromatics carry into a bright, perfumed, fruit-toned cup with an especially appealing mouthfeel, viscous and syrupy.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga More Floral Kudume Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A fruit- and floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup: deeply chocolaty, with lift from dried stone fruit and spice-toned florals.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Hill
Review: A richly sweet, savory-leaning Kenya coffee with the distinct currant notes characteristic of the origin, along with bittersweet citrus zest and umami impulses.

Name: Blue Ridge Blend
Review: A deftly, darker-roasted blend, richly sweet and chocolaty and delicious with a splash of whole milk if you’re so inclined.

Name: Kenya AA TOP Nairobi Rose
Review: A classic Kenya cup: balanced, lively, juicy, fusing sweet with richly savory impulses.

Name: Purple Tipsy Night
Review: A richly fruit-toned blend animated by crisp cocoa and aromatic wood notes throughout.

Name: Kahiko
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An exceptional Kona Typica cup deftly roasted to bring out rich dark chocolate and high-toned citrus notes in satisfying balance, with a throughline of tropical floral notes.

Name: Kenya Ndumberi Peaberry
Review: A classic sweet-savory Kenya cup: balanced, deep, rich, and intriguingly spice-toned.

Name: Ethiopia Gera Reserve Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Djimma growing region, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: A berry-driven anaerobic natural Ethiopia cup with an especially long, lingering finish — juicy, bright, balanced, floral.

Name: Kenya Ngaita Peaberry
Review: A vibrant fruit- and chocolate-driven Kenya with elegant floral notes throughout; especially long, lingering finish.

Name: Ka‘ū Champagne Natural Half-Caf
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review:
A partially decaffeinated coffee of exemplary quality and distinction.
Coffees of three traditional varieties are separately processed using Miguel Meza’s “champagne” method, blended, and subjected to partial decaffeination with no use of solvents. The result is a delightfully fruit-driven, chocolaty, low-caffeine cup.

Name: Kenya AB
Review: Juicy, high-toned, balanced and deep, with particularly full yet vibrant mouthfeel.

Name: Ecuador Pichincha Finca Flora
Review: A spice-toned, floral Ecuador cup, simultaneously sweet and intriguingly savory.

Name: Vietnam Robusta Carbonic Maceration
Review: An exceptionally sweet, complex Canephora (Robusta) cup from Vietnam, processed by carbonic maceration to intensify the fruit character.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Maganjo AB
Review: A straight-ahead Kenya cup: chocolaty, spice-driven, deeply sweet.

Name: Kona Noir
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A distinctive Kona cup from the rare Kenya-derived SL34 variety of Arabica, worth seeking out for its confident fruit and nuanced spice notes.

Name: Kona Red Bourbon
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: This Big Island Red Bourbon fermented with wine yeasts displays an intriguing cup profile that juxtaposes tart fruit with rich chocolate notes — juicy, deep, balanced and bright.

Name: Kenya Washed Nyeri Hill Farm AA Top
Review: An exceptionally lush, balanced, intricate Kenya cup that delights with sweet and savory turns, a transparently lyrical structure that carries far into the long finish.

Name: Ethiopia Nano Genji
Origin: Agaro Gera, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: A high-toned, classic washed Ethiopia cup: cocoa-toned, citrusy, floral.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama Abebe 74110
Review: An enticingly fruit-forward natural-processed single-variety Ethiopia cup with ballast from dark chocolate and caramelized hazelnut notes.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji TAMIRU 74158 Kakalove Lot
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A nuanced, enigmatic Ethiopia natural cup that rewards patience with its lyrical expressiveness and holistic integration.

Name: Guatemala Los Santos
Review: A juicy, balanced Guatemala cup with tart fruit, crisp chocolate, and deeply sweet hazelnut notes throughout.

Name: Finca Cerro Azul Aces Lot
Review: A richly aromatic, fruit-toned anaerobic natural cup with deep chocolate and sweet floral notes and a throughline of intentional winey ferment well integrated into the profile.

Name: Mexico Maya Vinic
Review: A satisfyingly familiar Mexico cup: crisp, chocolaty, balanced, harmonious.

Name: Chiapas Chimhucum Semi-Washed
Review: A quietly nuanced, honey-processed Mexico cup with dried stone fruit, cocoa and citrus.

Name: Mexico Chiapas Las Margaritas Pache Natural
Review: A paradoxically lush and crisp natural-processed Mexico with top notes of tropical fruit and undertones of sweet herb.

Name: Capitan Maragogype
Review: A compelling umami-leaning Maragogype cup with savory floral and complex fruit and spice notes.

Name: Mexico Ozolotepec
Review: A classic Mexico cup — sweet, balanced, chocolaty and nut-toned.

Name: Mexico Nyarita Canela
Review: A quietly confident, gently fruit-forward natural-processed Mexico cup from the coastal region of Nyarit, not typically associated with coffee.

Name: Mexico La Cañada Oaxaca Organic
Review: A friendly, accessible Mexico cup, sweetly nutty with gentle fruit and floral underpinnings.

Name: Mexico FTO
Review: A subtly nuanced Mexico cup with crisp apple and sweet herb notes with a throughline of richly sweet nut tones — certified Fair Trade/Organic.

Name: Gachatha Kenya
Review: A lush, nuanced, deep Kenya cup, classic in its balance of sweet and savory impulses, with a tart verticality that promotes structural complexity.

Name: Geisha Spirit
Review: A yellow honey-processed Colombia Geisha with notes of stone fruit, rich florals, and cocoa nib throughout, and an especially pretty mouthfeel, silky and subtle.

Name: Colombia Sudan Rume
Review: An excitingly complex natural-processed Colombia Sudan Rume, layered and deep, with sweet tropical fruit notes and an umami foundation.

Name: El Duende Peru
Origin: Huarango, San Ignacio, Cajamarca growing region, Peru
Review: A pretty, floral-driven, cocoa-toned Peru cup with a particularly distinctive, buttery mouthfeel.

Name: Conejo Añejo
Review: An intentionally fermenty, richly sweet blend of an aged natural Dominican Republic and a washed Honduras — a distinctively composed cup with notes of chocolate, cherry and citrus.

Name: Colombian Anaerobic
Review: An unabashedly candy-sweet anaerobic cup with balancing depth from rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Haitian Hound Haitian Blue Dark Roast
Review: An organic Haiti Blue Mountain cup, deftly darker-roasted, with rich chocolate and sweet tobacco notes. Nice with a splash of whole milk.

Name: Rwanda Agasaro
Review: A fruit-toned, complexly bittersweet natural Rwanda cup — a special microlot produced by women farmers of the COCAGI Cooperative.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1 Idido Natural
Origin: Gedeo Zone, SNNP Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A juicy-bright, fruity and chocolaty Ethiopia natural cup with spicy floral underpinnings and a buoyant, levitating structure.

Name: Colombia Pink Bourbon Filadelfia
Review: A classically complete Colombia Pink Bourbon cup crisply focused around complex floral, citrus, and delicately sweet herb notes.

Name: Taiwan BA LU NA
Review: A straightforward, inviting cup from still rare Taiwan-grown beans — sweet, balanced, quietly confident.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Botabaa G1 Lot.22/01
Review: A multi-layered, sweetly tart washed Ethiopia cup with deep floral and high-toned berry notes.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: deep-toned, lively, balanced, bright, and aromatically complex.

Name: Kenya
Review: A classic Kenya coffee: juicy, bright, balanced and deep with a lively, aromatic spark throughout the profile.

Name: Peru
Review: An invitingly sweet, very chocolaty Peru cup with a pleasing crispness and especially plush mouthfeel.

Name: Karen J Kona Red Bourbon
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: This classic Kona coffee unfolds over time to reveal intriguing complexity, exciting vibrancy, and deep, harmonious balance.

Name: Nicaragua La Bastilla Estate Anaerobic
Review: A uniquely composed anaerobic Nicaragua cup with a decidedly lactic tang and candy notes layered with more traditional floral and earth tones.

Name: Ethiopia Worka Sakaro
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A berry extravaganza of a coffee – think boysenberry, mulberry and raspberry — grounded by rich chocolate and sweet herb notes.

Name: Colombia Geisha
Review: A richly perfumed, deep-toned anaerobic Colombia Geisha intense with fruit, floral and chocolate notes.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Dabaye
Review: An elegant, floral-driven washed Ethiopia cup, richly sweet with honey and narcissus throughlines.

Name: Colombia Don Ruiz Anaerobic
Review: A fruit bomb, but a sophisticated one — balanced, inviting, confidently bright — also delicious cold.

Name: Colombia FUDAM Nariño
Review: A nuanced, complex washed Colombia cup with leading notes of stone fruit and spicy florals supported by deep nut and sweet herb.

Name: Peru Walther Acuna
Review: An easygoing Peru cup, very sweet, with an especially plush mouthfeel.

Name: Sumatra Aceh Gayo Mountain Musara Honey Process
Review: A honey-processed Sumatra with stone fruit and baking spice notes at center, supported by sweet florals and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Buku Saysa Natural Process
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A gently fruity, balanced natural-processed Guji cup: sweetly chocolaty, crisply fruity, with pretty florals throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Durato Bombe
Review: More a floral and cocoa bomb than a fruit bomb, but a bomb nevertheless. Big, intense, intricate.

Name: Papua New Guinea Timuza Organic
Review: This Papua New Guinea is a classic coffee in the smoothly bright, high-grown style. Clean, orangy and almondy with an undercurrent of fragrant cedar.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochere
Review: A crisply brisk style of washed Ethiopia, roasted toward the dark end of medium, with more spice than flowers and savory berry balanced by orangy cocoa.

Name: Ethiopia Botabaa
Review: A paradoxically strong-charactered yet light-footed washed Ethiopia, original in its layered date- and pistachio-toned aromatics.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama
Origin: Mirado Village, Bensa District, Sidama Zone, Ethiopia
Review: The crisply bittersweet structure and orange and floral-toned aromatics combine grace and authority.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Washed
Origin: Bombe Village, Bensa District, Sidamo growing region, Ethiopia
Review: A classically and smoothly bright cup with Ethiopian aromatic intrigue: vanilla-leaning flowers and tart berry, in particular.

Name: Papua New Guinea Baroida Estate Natural
Review: The unusual aromatics of this big-bodied coffee simultaneously suggest florist shop, lemonade parlor and cigar humidor. Take your time with this one — its originality emerges best with attention and patience.

Name: Bean Series Ethiopia Guji Raro
Review: Complex vanilla and floral suggestions emerge in a softly lively structure.

Name: El Salvador Monte Verde
Origin: Monte Verde, Santa Ana Department, central El Salvador
Review: A subtly seductive, easy-drinking cup with quiet but absorbing aromatic intrigue.

Name: Colombia Laboyano
Origin: Pitalito growing region, Huila Department, Colombia
Review: A classic cup in the Latin American, particularly Colombian, tradition: brightly tart but roundly sweet with notes of stone fruit and soft citrus.

Name: Pantan Musara Sumatra
Review: Processed by the traditional washed method rather than the wet-hulled variation more typical in Sumatra. Integrated and high-toned with notes of stone fruit and cocoa nib at center.

Name: Sumatra Takengon Gayo Natural
Review: A natural-processed Sumatra that is much more fruit-forward than coffees processed by the typical Sumatra wet-hulled method: juicy, gently bright, nuanced.

Name: Ethiopia Djimma Gera Anaerobic
Review: A sweet, fruit-toned anaerobic Ethiopia cup with particularly viscous, creamy mouthfeel and inviting tropical fruit notes.

Name: Colombia Los Pinos Robeiro Sarmiento
Review: A friendly, accessible, crisply sweet coffee with dried fruit, floral, and rich nut tones.

Name: Vietnam Cau Dat Mercafe Lotus
Review: A sweet, chocolaty Vietnam Arabica with undertones of nuts, florals, and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Nano Genji #7
Origin: Agaro Gera, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Review: A trifecta of fruit, flowers, and sandalwood in this delightfully high-toned, bright but balanced, classic washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Panama Auromar Camilina Geisha Natural
Origin: Piedra Candela, Chiriqui Province, far western Panama
Review: A vibrantly expressive, nuanced natural-processed Geisha cup with spice-toned floral and complex fruit notes throughout.

Name: Tio Conejo Colombia
Origin: Vereda Santa Rita, Manizales, Caldas, Colombia
Review: A high-toned, citrusy and floral washed Colombia cup with spice-driven undertones.

Name: Panama Auromar Ironman Geisha Washed Process
Origin: Piedra Candela, Chiriqui Province, far western Panama
Review: A classic washed-process Panama Geisha cup: cocoa-toned, floral, richly sweet and balanced.

Name: Cruz Loma
Origin: San José de Minas, Pichincha Province, Ecuador
Review: A complex, multi-layered washed anaerobic Ecuador cup — bright, juicy, cleanly fruit-toned, alive with tropical floral notes.

Name: Panama Elida Washed Gesha
Review: A tropical fruit powerhouse with pretty florals and rich cocoa notes: bright, balanced, juicy, exciting.

Name: Dancing Tiger
Review: A confidently tart-leaning blend of two natural-processed coffees: fruit-toned and quite chocolaty.

Name: Ethiopia Bidimoo Chelelektu Natural
Review: A juicy, richly fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with distinct raspberry notes throughout, supported by dark chocolate.

Name: Rider Blend
Review: A sweetly wood-framed, gently fermenty blend influenced by aging in whiskey casks.

Name: El Salvador Finca La Esperanza
Review: A fruit-toned, natural-processed El Salvador coffee with leading notes of dried berries supported by deep nut and cocoa tones.

Name: Dark Texas Twist
Review: A darker-roasted blend with pleasing smoke-toned chocolate and sweet floral notes throughout — sweet, crisp, bold.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Super Mario Geisha Yeast Washed
Review: A lush, rich-toned, yet delicately perfumed washed Geisha cup with exhilarating acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Anasora Extended Natural Special Lot
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A uniquely composed anaerobically processed coffee with sweet-tart-savory impulses in balanced harmony.

Name: Canet Musician Series Mozart Raisin Honey
Review: A pretty honey-processed Costa Rica cup with distinct berry notes and lush florals.

Name: Ethiopia Honey Yirgacheffe Idido G1
Origin: Gedeo Zone, SNNP Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An intricately, almost mysteriously nuanced coffee with bittersweet citrus and florals in front and ballast from crisp cocoa nib and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Taiwan Natural Alishan Ching-Ye Farm
Review: A richly chocolaty, fruit-forward, spice-toned natural-processed Taiwan Alishan cup.

Name: Trident Carmo de Minas
Origin: Carmo de Minas growing region, northeastern Minas Gerais State, Brazil
Review: A friendly, straightforward Brazil cup, sweetly nut-toned with support from citrus and floral notes.

Name: Hawaii Ka‘ū Bourbon Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An anaerobic natural from the Big Island of Hawai’i that evokes the tropics with its rich fruit and floral tendencies — the bright, juicy acidity is a bonus.

Name: Chelchele Ethiopia
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A complex, enticingly subtle washed Ethiopia cup laden with spicy floral, sweet stone fruit, and rich cocoa notes.

Name: Colombia Antioquia Magico
Review: A deeply aromatic, chocolate-toned washed Colombia cup from the rare Chiroso variety, redolent of stone fruit, spicy florals, and sweet herbs.

Name: Honeyed Floral
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed-process Ethiopia cup with especially vibrant acidity and spice-toned floral notes throughout.

Name: Karamo Ethiopia Sidama Natural G1
Review: An invitingly sweet, crisply tart, chocolaty natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Caramel Rocher
Review: A quietly confident natural-processed Costa Rica cup with sweet herb and spicy floral notes supporting a stone fruit throughline.

Name: Rwanda Karambi Station Natural
Review: A clean natural-processed Rwanda cup with an especially appealing, satiny body and a balance of citrus, chocolate and herb notes.

Name: Lone Peak Cafe Series Blend
Review: A chocolaty and richly aromatic cup with sweet nut, fruit and floral tones supported by fragrant, cedar-like wood.

Name: El Salvador Aida Batlle La Florida Natural
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered natural-processed El Salvador cup, elegantly floral, deeply fruit-forward and intricately balanced.

Name: Colombia Geisha Cordillera
Review: A triangular sensory experience of fruit, florals and chocolate with an especially integrated and satisfying finish — an exacting and exciting coffee.

Name: Ethiopia Raro Boda
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: sweet, tart, citrusy and cocoa-toned with a pleasingly complex structure and vibrant acidity.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Gathaithi
Review: A balanced, floral-toned Kenya cup with distinct notes of black currant, a pleasing savory fruit attribute often associated with classic Kenya coffees.

Name: Honduras Marcala
Origin: Marcala growing region, La Paz Department, Honduras
Review: A fine Honduras cup, richly nut-toned with a butterscotch throughline and a plush mouthfeel.

Name: Costa Rica Hacienda Sonora Honey
Origin: Carrillos Alto de Poás, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica
Review: Produced by a farm known for its pioneering work in the honey methods of processing green coffee, this classic version of the type offers a focused sweetness, dried fruit notes and pretty florals.

Name: Ethiopia Shantawane Buncho Honey
Review: A richly fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with a tropical throughline and particularly juicy acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Gigesa Natural
Review: A deeply fruit-toned Ethiopia natural cup with richly tart undertones and a plush, viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Colombia Huila Finca Villabetuila Anaerobic Honey
Review: A berry-toned, richly chocolaty anaerobic honey cup from Colombia — almost dessert-like in its sweetness.

Name: Costa Rica Bounty Gesha
Origin: Dota, Tarrazú growing region, Costa Rica
Review: A balanced, delicately fruit-driven Costa Rica Gesha supported by rich cocoa nib and sweet, citrusy herb.

Name: Panama Static Gesha Natural
Review: An aromatically intense, deep-toned Panama coffee with focused fruit, floral and sweet herb notes.

Name: Costa Rica San Gabriel SL28 Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Mercedes Sur, Turrubares, San José Province, Costa Rica
Review: An appealingly oddball anaerobic coffee from Costa Rica with umami depth, zingy acidity and an eccentric, unconventional flavor profile.

Name: John Co. Train Blend
Review: A friendly, easy-access blend driven by notes of pear, almond and citrus zest, with undertones of sweet florals and aromatic wood.

Name: Burundi Kibingo Intenso
Review: A washed Burundi processed with the addition of a yeast designed to intensify the green coffee’s inherent sensory properties. Especially balanced acidity and resonant finish.

Name: Colombia Planadas Ibague
Review: An invitingly bittersweet Colombia Pink Bourbon processed by the anaerobic natural method: chocolaty and citrusy with floral undertones.

Name: Burundi Kabarore Commune
Review: A friendly, accessible washed Burundi cup; crisply chocolaty and nut-toned throughout.

Name: Ecuador Peñaherrera AAA
Review: A compelling berry- and chocolate-driven Ecuador cup with juicy acidity and a plush mouthfeel.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Porton 5N49 Gesha Natural
Review: A dynamic, exhilarating Panama Gesha driven by flowers and big, balanced fruit throughout.

Name: Kona SL34 Champagne Natural Uluwehi Farm
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A Kona from the admired SL34 variety processed by a proprietary method that promotes a distinctly rich, juicy, fruit-driven cup.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Adado
Review: A fine, classic washed Ethiopia Yirgacheffe cup: high-toned, driven by sweet florals and stone fruit.

Name: Costa Rica Cordillera de Fuego
Review: A sweetly spice-driven cup with warm notes of baking spices and both bright and dark fruits.

Name: Tanzania Mbeya Mimba
Origin: Mbozi, Mbeya growing region, southwestern Tanzania
Review: A deeply pleasing Tanzania cup, multi-layered and complete — richly sweet, deeply savory, spice-toned and floral.

Name: Costa Rica La Chumeca
Origin: Santa Maria de Dota, Costa Rica
Review: A harmonious, integrated natural-processed Costa Rica cup: juicy, deep-toned and fruit-driven.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Yirgalem
Review: A sweet, fruit-first natural-processed Ethiopia cup with a blueberry and chocolate throughline.

Name: Gesha Spirits
Review: A complex, nuanced Colombia Gesha cup processed by an elaborate variation on the traditional washed method.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Hill Farm AA TOP
Review: A classic Kenya cup: deeply sweet, richly savory, balanced and juicy-bright with both sweet (narcissus) and spicy (lavender) floral impulses.

Name: Philippines Sitio Belis 1017
Review: A deeply aromatic Philippines cup evoking tropical fruit and rich cocoa.

Name: Philippines Sitio Belis 1014
Review: An attractive anaerobically processed Philppines cup with an especially viscous, syrupy mouthfeel.

Name: Costa Rica Tarrazu Dota El Diosa Geisha
Review: A pretty Costa Rica Geisha processed by the honey method. Floral-driven with ballast from cocoa notes.

Name: Ethiopia Gedeb Worka Single Variety 74110 G1
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A friendly washed Ethiopia cup with notes of pear and crisp chocolate as throughlines.

Name: Costa Rica Las Montañas Honey
Review: A paradoxically bright yet deep honey-processed Costa Rica cup with a sweet herb throughline.

Name: Colombia Finca La Guaca Ají
Review: A focused but lush cup from trees of a rare indigenous Ethiopian landrace variety grown in Colombia called Aji — tropical-leaning with a cocoa backbone.

Name: 44˚N 68˚W Bar Harbor
Review: A solid, medium-roasted Costa Rica/Sumatra blend that offers deep earthy sweetness juxtaposed with crisp fruit.

Name: Panama Finca Santa Teresa
Review: A floral-toned, chocolaty, and very affordable Panama cup with particularly vibrant acidity.

Name: Zambia Mafinga Hills Natural
Review: An interesting, rare natural-processed Zambia coffee, worth seeking out for its unique cup profile and leading notes of dried fruit and resinous amber.

Name: Mexico Altura Natural Water Process Decaf
Review: A solid decaffeinated Mexico coffee, processed without harsh solvents, that preserves pleasing chocolate and florals in the cup.

Name: Area Code 207
Review: A sweet-toned darker-roasted blend with notes of dark chocolate and spicy florals, complicated by hints of gently scorched, smoky cedar.

Name: Karatina Kenya
Review: An elegantly powerful, classically composed Kenya cup with rich aromatics and a range of lively fruit, flowers and chocolate on the palate.

Name: Karamo Ethiopia
Review: A spice-toned, floral-driven natural-processed Ethiopia cup with bright fruit notes and juicy acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Shakisso Mormora 74112
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An engaging, cleanly natural-processed single-variety Ethiopia cup: bright, chocolaty, floral and fruity.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Shakisso Mormora 74112
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A complex, nuanced washed Ethiopia cup alive with spice-toned florals, richly bittersweet citrus, and distinct cocoa.

Name: Classic Blend
Review: A friendly, accessible, balanced cup: richly cocoa-toned with crisp fruit and lush mouthfeel.

Name: Ethiopia Keramo Natural
Review: A confident, fruit-forward, cocoa-toned Ethiopia natural cup with an impressively smooth mouthfeel.

Name: Costa Rica Los Torres Microlot Black Honey
Origin: Rivas District, Chirripo Region, Costa Rica
Review: A cleanly fruit-forward, invitingly floral Costa Rica cup processed by the black honey method.

Name: Colombia Tres Dragones
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle de Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A sweetly fermenty fruit bomb with both vibrantly bright and savory-deep impulses, juicy and complex.

Name: Colombia Quindio Anaerobic Natural
Review: A deeply satisfying, savory-sweet Colombia anaerobic with wide-ranging aromatics and dried fruit and warming spices on the palate.

Name: Colombia Pink Bourbon
Review: A focused, complex Colombia Pink Bourbon with top notes of wild berry and cocoa nib and a throughline of spicy-sweet florals and citrus zest.

Name: Philippine Heritage Microlot
Review: A balanced, rich-toned, darker roasted coffee from smallholding farmers in The Philippines — chocolaty, floral, and driven by notes of baking spices.

Name: Colombia Cumbarco Lot 397
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle de Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A classic washed Colombia cup with crisp stonefruit notes, balanced acidity, a richly sweet structure.

Name: Meridiano Ecuador
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered Ecuador cup that’s paradoxically both bright and deep.

Name: Malaysia Sabah Honey
Review: A fine cup from the Malaysian state of Sabah, which occupies part of the island of Borneo: sweet, spice-toned; original and rare.

Name: Ruby Sweet Lychee
Review: A friendly, gently fruit- and floral-driven washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Fruits Island
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A quietly inviting natural-processed Ethiopia cup with tart fruit and distinct aromatic wood notes.

Name: Peru Gesha
Review: A high-toned, spice-driven, very floral Peru Gesha cup. A good value for this impressive, rare, usually expensive coffee variety.

Name: Ecuador Loja Hacienda La Papaya Bourbon Sidra 168hr Anaerobic Natural
Review: An integrated, sensorially diverse experimental Ecuador cup characterized by savory floral notes, unabashed fruit, and exciting aromatics.

Name: Santa Elena Colombia Caturra Natural
Review: An easygoing, approachable natural-processed Colombia cup with a sweetly tart cup profile complicated by hints of cocoa nib and spicy florals.

Name: Decaf Colombia Finca Las Nubes
Review: A balanced, crisply sweet decaffeinated Colombia cup with an especially plush mouthfeel.

Name: Nicaragua Selva Negra
Review: A resonant Nicaragua natural cup with a throughline of grape candy and chocolate fudge.

Name: Colombia UVI Cochidas
Review: A fine Colombia cup — sweet-toned with lively citrus and baking spice notes — by a collective that supports emerging farmers.

Name: Panama Finca Deborah Afterglow Geisha Natural
Origin: Volcán growing region, Chiriquí Province, Panama
Review: An inviting, harmoniously complex, multi-layered natural Geisha cup with particularly deep, vibrant aromatics.

Name: Colombia Exótico De Altura
Review: A multi-layered washed Colombia cup with leading notes of dark chocolate and blackberry — intensely aromatic, balanced, deep.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Yerihar AA Top Lot 21/01
Review: A juicy Kenya cup with deep fruit and florals, supported by a confident sweet-savory structure.

Name: Colombia Wush Wush Dynamic Natural
Review: A multi-layered, deeply complex yeast-fermented Ethiopia Wush Wush cup with deep fruit, crisp cocoa, and a subtle sweet ferment redolent of wine barrel.

Name: Rwanda Gatare
Review: A confident, complex Rwanda cup with rich fruit, deep chocolate, and spicy floral notes.

Name: Guatemala ASPROCDEGUA Women Producers
Review: A balanced, inviting women-farmed Guatemala cup.

Name: Costa Rica Naranjo Danilo Salazar Arias
Review: A lively, juicy-bright natural-processed Costa Rica cup with inviting fruit and floral notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Kahunyo AA
Review: A savory, richly Kenya cup with appealing floral notes and a bright sweetness supported by deep aromatic wood impulses.

Name: Honduras COMSA Oscar Omar Alonzo
Review: Delicately sweet-tart, deeply aromatic. Baking chocolate, apricot, grapefruit zest, hazelnut butter, rhododendron in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. The nut-toned finish is lifted by rhododendron-like florals.

Name: Rwanda Gasharu Natural
Review: A friendly, easygoing Rwanda cup, cleanly natural processed, with deep fruit, floral, and nut tones.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Shakiso G1 Honey
Review: A fruit and flower medley, this honey-processed Ethiopia cup is berry-toned with a richly floral throughline and supporting notes of dark chocolate.

Name: Yemen Haraaz Red Mahal Aqeeq ul Station Natural
Review: A gorgeous stunner of a classic Yemen cup: fruit-laden, floral and sweetly herbaceous — a heady coffee, both aromatically and on the palate.

Name: Brazil Fazenda Samambaia Natural Fermentation Arara
Origin: Santo Antônio do Amparo, Minas Gerais State, Brazil
Review: A plush, sweet-toned, experimentally processed natural Brazil cup with a pleasing suggestion of grappa-like spirits.

Name: Brazil Ipanema Premier Cru Gold A49 Cherry
Review: A friendly, crisply sweet, anaerobic natural Brazil cup with a particularly expansive, fruit-toned aroma.

Name: Brazil Natural Veloso Estate
Review: A quietly transcendent Brazil natural cup, harmonious and integrated.

Name: Sítio Pedra Menina
Origin: Alto Caparaó, Minas Gerais State, Brazil
Review: A vibrant, juicy, floral- and citrus-toned cup with complicating sweet herb undertones.

Name: Brazil Sítio Ponte Fazenda Ponte
Origin: Chapada Diamantina region, Bahia State, Brazil
Review: A quietly confident Brazil cup redolent of caramel apple, framed in fragrant aromatic wood notes suggesting cedar.

Name: Brazil Red Catuaí Double-Anaerobic
Review: A quietly confident anaerobic natural Brazil cup, chocolaty, deep, floral, fruit-toned.

Name: Brazil Legender Sitio Taquara Natural
Review: Classic Brazil: richly sweet, deeply nut-toned, chocolate-edged.

Name: Brazil Mogiana Aparecid Farm
Origin: Mogiana growing region, Sao Paulo State, Brazil
Review: Delicate cocoa, crisp orange, and a fine, satiny mouthfeel distinguish this quietly original Brazil.

Name: Costa Rica Canet Musician Series Bach Raisin Honey
Review: A deep-toned, fruit-driven honey-processed Costa Rica cup with an especially inviting aftertaste and a whisper of appealing whiskey barrel-like ferment.

Name: Peru Amazonas Los Santos Geisha Natural
Origin: Utcubamba Province, Amazonas region, northern Peru
Review: A spice-toned, richly aromatic, floral-driven Peru Geisha cup that evokes a tropical garden — the cup’s flavor notes are especially balanced and exciting.

Name: Ethiopia Odola Washed
Origin: Uraga, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A pretty, quietly confident washed Ethiopia cup that foregrounds notes of wild berries and spicy florals — elegant, exciting and inviting.

Name: Minanga Village Sulawesi
Origin: Toraja growing region, south-central Sulawesi, Indonesia
Review: A top-notch Sulawesi cup with a sweet-herb throughline, rich chocolate, crisp herb, and balanced fruit and floral notes, with a long, lingering finish.

Name: Ka‘ū Tropical Punch Washed
Review: A playful, aptly named blend of washed-process coffees from two different Ka‘ū farms, fermented with several yeast strains and redolent of tropical fruit and cocoa nib.

Name: Birambo Village DR Congo
Origin: South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A solid DR Congo cup with notes of stone fruit, florals, cocoa nib, nuts, and sweet herbs.

Name: Kenya Kamgogo Small Lot Reserve
Review: A balanced, appealing Kenya cup: deep-toned, richly savory, and thoroughly chocolaty.

Name: Ethiopia Belayneh Bariso Natural
Review: A classic natural-processed Sidama cup: balanced, fruit-focused, cocoa-toned and richly sweet.

Name: Kuta Kofi Papua New Guinea
Origin: Upper Waghi Valley, Jiawaka Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: An imminently welcoming PNG cup, classic in its profile, with leading notes of caramel and bittersweet citrus.

Name: Rwanda Gatare Natural
Review: A pretty natural-processed Rwanda cup, fruit-forward and nutty with floral undertones.

Name: Rock the House Blend
Review: A solid house blend from Madison’s JBC Coffee Roasters — balanced, affordable, pleasingly familiar.

Name: Kona SL34 Champagne Natural Uluwehi Farm
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A complex, multi-layered Kona SL34 cup processed by an experimental method designed to intensify aromas and flavors — juicy, bright, harmonious, richly sweet.

Name: Yemen Al Mashtal Al Burhani
Review: An impressive, intensely aromatic Yemen cup with both sweet and tart fruit notes and an integrated aromatic wood throughline that result in a lively, integrated cup profile.

Name: Ka‘ū Lactic Natural
Review: A uniquely composed, experimentally processed Ka‘ū cup, produced in very small quantities and worth seeking out.

Name: Sumatra Yellow Bourbon
Review: A Sumatra cup that’s atypical in its processing method (conventionally washed rather than washed and wet-hulled like traditional Sumatras) and almost Kenya-like in its sweet-savory balance.

Name: Colombia Finca El Paraiso Castillo Red Plum
Review: A uniquely composed, double-anaerobic washed Colombia cup that’s flavor-saturated and harmoniously sweet-tart-savory — unusual and inviting.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Tebe Burku Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: An integrated, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia cup, fruit-driven, with an especially rich, creamy mouthfeel.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Konga Natural
Review: A rich-toned natural Yirgacheffe cup with an invitingly savory-leaning structure and especially viscous mouthfeel.

Name: Costa Rica Brunca Rivense Las Moras Black Honey
Review: A resonant black honey-processed Costa Rica cup with intense berry and dark chocolate notes and an intriguing hint of oaky wine.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Hama Washed
Review: A delicately high-toned, crisply sweet-tart washed Yirgacheffe cup with a floral throughline.

Name: Guatemala Antigua Bella Carmona
Review: A balanced, resonant Guatemala cup animated by inviting floral, chocolate, and dried fruit notes.

Name: Peru Washed Santa Monica Gesha
Review: A dreamy but bright, fruit-toned Peru Gesha — tropics in a cup.

Name: Taiwan Washed Alishan Ching-Ye Farm SL34
Review: A complex, intriguing coffee from Alishan, a region in Taiwan famous for its tea production. Honeyed berry and spicy flowers predominate.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Odo Shakiso
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A fruit-forward, natural-processed Guji cup with a hint of sweet ferment and deep nut and cocoa undertones.

Name: Colombia Beasaquito
Review: A balanced, friendly, cleanly natural processed Colombia cup with sweet throughlines of chocolate and honey.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Karamo
Review: A beautiful classic washed Ethiopia cup with complex citrus, delicately deep floral, and sweet herb notes.

Name: Gigesa Ethiopia
Review: A deep-toned Ethiopia natural: cleanly fruity, richly chocolaty, juicy-sweet.

Name: Oahu Triple-Bourbon “Sparkling” Yeast Ferment
Origin: Maunawili growing region, southeastern Oahu, Hawaii
Review: An unusual coffee in almost every respect: From trees of three Bourbon-related varieties of Arabica grown on the Hawaiian island of Oahu and dried in the fruit after a yeast-inoculated ferment, culminating in an original, complex cup.

Name: Rayo del Sol Peru
Review: A woman-farmed Peru, lush, floral and deep-toned in the cup.

Name: Colombia Ibague Tolima
Review: A sweetly herbaceous Colombia natural cup that gets ballast from bright fruit notes at the top and deep cocoa underneath — subtly juicy and savory.

Name: Monte Alban Mexico
Review: A brightly sweet Oaxaca cup, chocolaty, tart and floral-toned.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Buku
Origin: Kebele Buku Sayisa, Guji Zone, Oromia region, Ethiopia
Review: A tartly and cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with rich nut and chocolate complications.

Name: Flores Peru
Origin: El Diamante, San Ignacio, Cajamarca Department, Peru
Review: A very pretty Peru cup with especially full mouthfeel and crisp notes of chocolate and stone fruit.

Name: Glory Days
Review: A women-farmed Mexico cup that’s deftly darker-roasted, with notes of chocolate fudge and Fig Newton.

Name: Costa Rica Anaerobic Cordillera de Fuego
Review: A floral-toned anaerobic Costa Rica cup with warming spices — clove, cinnamon, nutmeg — throughout.

Name: Nyakibanda Rwanda
Review: An engaging, confident Rwanda cup: crisply chocolaty, delicately floral, citrus-driven.

Name: Guatemala Antigua Pastores
Review: A friendly, balanced Guatemala cup with rich, sweet nut tones and crisp, citrusy herb.

Name: Kenya Karatu
Review: A classic Kenya cup with notes of sweet fruit and spicy florals, along with a rich toffee throughline.

Name: Kibingo Burundi
Review: A sweet-savory cup with stone fruit and chocolate in front and background notes of fresh goat cheese.

Name: Costa Rica Cattleya Anaerobic
Review: A berry-driven, citrus-toned anaerobic natural Costa Rica, complex and multi-layered.

Name: Ecuador Taza Dorada Finca Cruz Loma
Origin: San Jose de Minas, Pichincha, Ecuador
Review: A beautifully structured, floral-toned Ecuador cup with elegantly bright acidity and lyrically plush mouthfeel.

Name: Costa Rica Los Cedros
Origin: La Piedra de Rivas, Chirripó, Costa Rica
Review: A balanced, harmonious Costa Rica cup driven by notes of stone fruit, spicy florals, and richly sweet nut tones.

Name: Kona Bourbon Champagne Natural Uluwehi Farm
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A uniquely composed, experimentally processed cup that’s well worth a detour to enjoy a brilliant tweak on the familiar Kona profile, with especially vibrant acidity.

Name: Peru Pangoa
Review: A caramelly and citrus-driven Peru cup complicated by pleasing sweet nut and floral tones.

Name: Guatemala Campamento Alto
Review: An engaging, multi-layered, quietly confident Guatemala cup.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Washed
Review: A deftly darker-roasted Geisha cup with distinct notes of chocolate fudge throughout, supported by creamy nut and sweetly spicy flowers.

Name: Peru Garden of Eden Farcent Geisha Anaerobic Washed
Origin: Villa Rica District, Pasco Department, Peru
Review: An odd though compelling Peru Geisha cup, wide-ranging and original in its flavor and aromatic nuance yet complete and integrated.

Name: Pointu Laurina
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: Here a darker roast amplifies the intricate resonance of Hula Daddy’s rare Pointu Laurina, a naturally low-caffeine bean that sacrifices nothing in flavor.

Name: Ecuador Finca Cruz Loma
Origin: San Jose de Minas, Pichincha, Ecuador
Review: A complex, multi-layered Ecuador cup, with distinct floral and chocolate tones and an enticing whiff of smoked almond. A splash of cream can make this coffee exhilaratingly dessert-like.

Name: Aged Sumatra Semiga
Review: An intriguing aged Sumatra, deftly roasted to bring out musky spice notes, pipe tobacco and dark chocolate.

Name: Indonesia Sumatra Kerinci Valley
Review: A deceptively nuanced, enigmatic Sumatra cup with enticing aromatics that lean toward a sweet earthiness.

Name: Ka’u Classic Dark
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: This Ka’u Typica strikes a lovely balance between the depth of a classic dark roast and the levity of a fruit- and floral-driven, medium-roasted Typica cup.

Name: Odin’s Viking Brew
Review: A classic darker-roasted Sumatra cup — sweetly earth-toned, richly chocolaty, deep.

Name: Dark Side of the Bloom
Review: A resonant, confident, sweetly earthy Sumatra-based blend roasted to the very beginning of the “second crack,” where the influence of dark-roast character first makes itself felt.

Name: Jlove99
Review: A roast-rounded, complex Kenya cup with classic currant and crisp chocolate notes and an especially vibrant acidity, particularly given the darker roast.

Name: Kenya Auction Lot
Review: A fine Kenya roasted in Peet’s classic dark style, which here encourages surprising depth while retaining the crisp coherence of the classic Kenya profile.

Name: Black Magic Blend
Review: An appealingly roasty-sweet blend with leading notes of dark chocolate and roasted walnut and an especially lush mouthfeel.

Name: Dark Canyon
Review: Unabashedly smoky with chocolaty depth, this Peru/Honduras/Mexico blend offers comfortingly classic dark-roast aromas and flavors.

Name: Sumatra Dark
Review: An earth-toned Sumatra cup with subdued acidity, gently dry cocoa notes, and rich aromatic wood suggestions.

Name: Major Dickason’s Blend
Review: The popular Peet’s blend, here roast-prominent and sweetly wood-framed, with undertones of cocoa powder.

Name: Pike’s Place Blend
Review: This blend retains its popularity, despite what reads here as a flat, bitterish cup, with only some backgrounded sweetness and nuance.

Name: Sumatra Boru Batak
Review: A wide-ranging, deeply nuanced Sumatra cup — complex, enigmatic, floral, chocolaty, tropical.

Name: Honduras Reserve Luis Nolasco Nanolot
Review: A balanced, satisfying Honduras cup produced in partnership with Catracha Coffee, a profit-sharing export and development organization focused on improving the coffees and livelihood of farmers in the community of Santa Elena.

Name: Barokah Honey Sumatra
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered, richly aromatic Sumatra cup characterized by notes of baking spices and citrus zest — and a serious bargain as well.

Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Kochere Shifo Washed G1
Review: A floral-driven, spice-toned washed Ethiopia cup with rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Colombia Finca La Primavera Sidra
Review: A gorgeous rendition of the Sidra variety of Arabica from Colombia: complex, lyrical, nuanced, deep.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Dasaya SP
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A deep, enticing natural-processed Ethiopia cup with crisp and dried berry notes and sweet florals throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Anaerobic Shantawene
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A pungent, multi-layered anaerobically processed Ethiopia cup offering a particularly wide range of aroma and flavor notes.

Name: Ethiopia Bensa Asefa Qonqana
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An harmonious, inviting washed Ethiopia cup in which fruit, flowers and chocolate gracefully commingle.

Name: Ethiopia Durato Bombe
Origin: Bombe mountains, Sidama Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An engagingly vibrant, deeply sweet, richly tart and chocolaty natural-processed Ethiopia.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Shantawene
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An elegant stone fruit-driven washed Sidama cup with leading notes of nectarine and citrus and a cocoa-toned throughline.

Name: Indonesia Sumatra Natural Aceh Musara SC19
Review: An unusual natural-processed Sumatra cup, redolent with stone fruit and baking chocolate with umami underpinning.

Name: Kenya Washed Kabingara AA
Review: Red fruit and crisp cocoa notes characterize this deeply aromatic, richly complex, classic Kenya cup.

Name: Honduras Blue Hole Estate
Review: Spicy florals, crisply sweet nut tones, and distinct berry notes dominate in this inviting natural-processed Honduras cup.

Name: Honduras Anaerobic Natural
Review: An experimentally processed Honduras with a complex cup that includes notes reminiscent of Sweet-Tarts candy.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Jungle Estate Red Cherry SLD Anaerobic Natural
Review: A strangely compelling anaerobic Kenya cup that takes both savory and sweet impulses to their extremes, and somehow manages to integrate them.

Name: Democratic Republic of Congo Mighty Peace Mapendo
Origin: Lake Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo
Review: An integrated, classic DR Congo cup with especially high-toned, balanced acidity.

Name: Lugmapata Ecuador
Review: A harmonious, intricate Ecuador cup with leading notes of stone fruit, sage, almond and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Red Sunset by Andres Cardona
Review: A pretty, delicate, confident honey-processed Colombia animated by both stone fruit and tropical fruit notes throughout.

Name: Macarena Colombia
Review: An aromatically nuanced Colombia cup, deep-toned and complex, processed by an experimental method.

Name: Haraaz Red Yemen
Review: An intoxicatingly spice-toned cup — warming, resonant, rich.

Name: Nicaragua Sabino Maria
Review: An impressively balanced, bright Nicaragua cup with sweet herb undertones.

Name: El Salvador Anarquia Pacamara
Review: A complex, nuanced, multi-layered El Salvador Pacamara cup, equal parts sweet and savory.

Name: Tanzania Peaberry
Review: A complex, deep-toned, floral Tanzania cup, at a very attractive price.

Name: Ethiopia Karamo Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A tropical-leaning natural-processed Ethiopia cup driven by high-toned fruit and deep floral tones, with a cocoa nib throughline.

Name: Guatemala Reserve Las Moritas Yellow Pacamara
Review: A flavor-saturated, confident Guatemala Pacamara cup, chocolaty and rich.

Name: Colombia Sidra Natural Signature Selection
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle de Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: An exquisitely structured Colombia Sidra cup processed by an experimental method that highlights notes of rich fruit and sweet whiskey.

Name: Colombia Finca El Paraiso Geisha Letty
Review: This double-anaerobic Colombia Geisha has a remarkable and surprising cup profile that is, at turns, fruity and floral, tart yet singingly sweet.

Name: Monarch Estate Pacamara
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A nuanced Kona Pacamara cup with deep-toned stone fruit, dark chocolate and sweet floral notes and an umami undercurrent suggesting candycap mushroom.

Name: Uluwehi Farm Kona SL34 Yeast-Fermentation Washed Peaberry
Origin: Holualoa, Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An inviting, complex, unusual cup with notes of tropical fruit, spicy flowers and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Ka’u IPA Natural
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An experimentally processed Red Catuai grown on Hawai’i Island and processed with beer yeast, promoting a uniquely brisk and complex cup.

Name: Honduras Finca Cerro Azul Yellow Pacas
Review: A confident expression of the Yellow Pacas variety of Arabica, richly sweet with notes of stone fruit complicated by a hint of coriander-like spice.

Name: Ecuador Finca Lugmapata Mejorado
Review: An elegant, rich, deep-toned Ecuador cup driven by floral and spice notes, with an especially bright, balanced acidity.

Name: Monarch Estate Hawaiian Gesha
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An inviting, straightforward Kona Gesha cup, balanced and bright, with pleasing suggestions of tart fruit and spicy florals.

Name: ‘Ōpio Kona
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An easy-drinking medium-roasted Hawaiian Gesha cup, deep and chocolaty.

Name: Hawai’i Ka’u Classic Dark
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: Sturdy, chocolaty, smooth, rich — also makes a good espresso shot.

Name: Guatemala Finca Buena Esperanza
Review: A classic washed Guatemala cup with notes of stone fruit, sweet nut, chocolate and spicy flowers.

Name: Session Blend
Review: A balanced, vibrant, chocolaty and floral-toned Ethiopia-Guatemala blend.

Name: Honduras Relationship Coffee Norma Lara
Review: A balanced and integrated washed Honduras cup with deep floral notes throughout, supported by citrus and cocoa.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Goro
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A sweet-toned, fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup with delicate florals and perfumy resin notes throughout.

Name: Sumatra Batak Triple-Picked
Review: A chocolaty, confidently savory, classic Sumatra wet-hulled cup.

Name: Honduras COMSA Natural
Review: A sweet, nut-toned Honduras natural cup with stone fruit notes throughout and especially juicy acidity.

Name: Shakiso Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A complex, fruit-centered Guji cup with richly sweet floral and deep citrus and nut tones.

Name: Cerro Azul Geisha Honey Process
Review: Deep, floral and fruit-driven, with notes of dried stone fruit, spice-toned flowers, and rich cocoa.

Name: La Esmeralda Diamond Mountain Washed Coffee
Review: An appealing washed Panama cup with richly spice-toned florals and citrus zest as throughlines.

Name: Yirgacheffe Specialty Coffee
Review: A crisp, cleanly fruit-toned Ethiopia natural cup.

Name: COE Sidama Bona 74110
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A nuanced, balanced washed Ethiopia cup with deep tropical fruit, cocoa, and spicy floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Adorsi G1
Review: A chocolaty, fruit-forward cup with undertones of rich florals and deep aromatic wood.

Name: Gayo Mandheling Specialty Coffee
Review: A rich, crisply chocolaty Sumatra cup laced with sweet-spicy flowers.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1
Review: A friendly, accessible natural-processed Ethiopia cup: crisply sweet, deeply chocolaty, with hints of spicy florals throughout.

Name: Karen J Kona Red Bourbon Natural Anaerobic
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A regular, much-anticipated Hula Daddy offering, this year’s Karen J Red Bourbon is lush, deep, balanced, and refined with aromatic intrigue that plays out beautifully on the palate.

Name: El Salvador Finca Mileydi Pacamara
Origin: Cantón El Tunel, La Palma, Chalatenango, El Salvador
Review: A rich-toned, floral and chocolaty Pacamara cup with ballast from notes of bittersweet citrus zest.

Name: El Salvador Las Veraneras Red Bourbon
Review: Paradoxically delicate and deep, this El Salvador anaerobic natural offers dried stone fruit notes at the top and sweet herb notes underneath for a wide range of sensory pleasure.

Name: Guo Mei Zhu
Review: A classic Colombia cup: bright, balanced, chocolaty and richly nutty.

Name: Spring Dawn
Review: A harmonious blend with chocolate and nut anchors and pleasingly bright fruit and spicy floral complications.

Name: Costa Rica Brunca Rivense La Guaca Passion Honey
Review: A rich-toned, gently fermenty Costa Rica cup processed by a variation of the honey method: sweet, fruity, chocolaty, enticing.

Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Yirgacheffe Gedeb Worka Banko Gotiti Natural
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A vibrant natural-processed Ethiopia cup with dried berry notes, bittersweet florals, and a throughline of crisp cocoa nib.

Name: Hunkute by Nordic Approach
Review: A richly aromatic, even perfumy, washed Sidama cup, with distinct notes of bergamot, plum, and spice-toned florals suggesting star jasmine.

Name: Colombia Aromas de Sur
Review:
A lush, fruity natural-processed Colombia cup with an especially mouth-
filling body.

Name: Costa Rica Termico
Review: Evocative of walking into an American bakery with its notes of nutmeg and clove, this Costa Rica coffee was processed by an innovative “thermic” method.

Name: Schweik’s Blend
Review: Evocative of a summer fruit pie, this blend of coffees from Africa is nuanced and complex, and a superb value, to boot.

Name: Whiskey Dreams Moka Java
Review: A classic Moka Java blend that evokes the depth of aroma and flavor of a high-end whiskey: fruity, earthy, decadent.

Name: Black Level Blend
Review: A chocolaty, sweetly herbaceous cup with an umami throughline — complex, nuanced, confident.

Name: Obsidian Mirror Blend
Review: A deftly darker roasted blend intended to honor the Mayan cultures central to the three green coffee origin countries contributing to the blend.

Name: 704 Blend
Review: A familiar, comforting blend with leading notes of dark caramel, rich nut tones, and pretty florals — a classic daily drinker.

Name: Memory Lane
Review: Designed to work equally well as pourover or espresso, this blend has deep sweetness, balanced fruit and florals, and undercurrents of baking spices throughout.

Name: New Wave Blend
Review: A compelling blend of coffees from Colombia (washed) and Ethiopia (natural) that nets a crisply chocolaty, fruit-forward cup.

Name: House Blend
Review: A straight-ahead, balanced and inviting blend of a washed Guatemala and a natural Ethiopia intended for both drip and espresso formats.

Name: Mo’ Better Brews Bleek & Indigo Blend
Review: A chocolaty, fruit-leaning blend with a spicy floral undercurrent.

Name: Valkyrie Blend
Review: A inviting medium-dark blend with a roast profile that particularly develops the pleasing chocolate tendencies of the green coffees.

Name: Karindundu Kenya
Review: A complex, nuanced Kenya cup with layers of tart fruit, spice-toned florals and cocoa notes throughout; especially lively acidity.

Name: Medium Roast
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A crisp, cocoa-toned Kona cup with undertones of pretty dried fruit, floral and nut.

Name: Medium-Dark Roast
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A confidently darker-roasted single-origin Kona cup, sweet and chocolaty.

Name: Colombia Geisha Natural
Review: A natural-processed Colombia Geisha; evokes a tropical fruit farm. Mango is the throughline, with ballast from cocoa nib and sandalwood.

Name: Pacas Estate El Salvador Natural
Origin: Los Naranjos, Juayua, Sonsonate, El Salvador
Review: A cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed El Salvador cup — juicy, bright, berry-driven.

Name: Caribbean Blue
Review: A classic island cup: nutty-sweet with gentle acidity.

Name: Colombia Caturra Anaerobic Natural
Review: Almost dessert-like in its sweetness, this anaerobically processed Caturra exhibits candy-like aromas and flavors with a savory edge.

Name: Cocaine for Coffee
Review: A friendly, accessible Bolivia cup, the proceeds of which helps farmers transition from the dangers of coca farming to coffee growing.

Name: First Love Blend
Review: A lush, umami-toned fruit bomb of a blend that shakes up any notion of an everyday coffee and may particularly appeal to open-minded fans of the latest experimental processing methods.

Name: Hunapu Natural Guatemala
Review: An attractive natural-processed Guatemala cup with deep-toned fruit, nut, and sweet citrus notes; especially engaging mouthfeel.

Name: Kabiufa Papua New Guinea
Origin: Kabiufa, Eastern Highlands, Papua New Guinea
Review: An exciting PNG cup with a grand aromatic range: bright fruit, sweet toffee, spicy florals, earthy depth.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Sidama TAMIRU 74158
Review: A poetically complex Ethiopia natural cup, uniquely composed with spicy florals, deep fruit, and decadent musk notes.

Name: Uganda Organic Sipi Falls Honey
Review: A chocolaty, nutty, deeply sweet Uganda cup with a particularly full, plush mouthfeel.

Name: Bedhatu Jibicho Natural
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered natural-processed Ethiopia cup, elegantly fruit-forward and intricately balanced.

Name: Sabana Redonda SL28 Costa Rica
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: Dried stone fruit and floral tones carry this fascinating coffee — a traditional Kenya variety grown in Costa Rica and processed experimentally.

Name: Gigesa Ethiopia
Review: A delicately aromatic washed Guji cup framed by citrus and sweet herb with a cocoa throughline.

Name: Ka’u Peaberry Hawai’i
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A friendly, familiar cup with a cocoa throughline and sweet nut, floral and fruit tones.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Gesha Village Dimma Illubabor Forest A6 Natural
Review: A harmonious, fruit- and floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia Gesha redolent of stone fruit and its flowers.

Name: Sumatra Siamang Forest
Review: A complex, multifarious cup that engages at both the upper and lower ends of the tonal range.

Name: Yemen Jabal Nabi Special Reserve
Origin: Hayma Dakhiliya growing region, Sana’a Governorate, Yemen
Review: A multi-layered, nuanced Yemen with an engaging sweet ferment at its center, supported by fruit and earthy tobacco impulses throughout.

Name: Kenya Gakuyuini AA
Review: A juicy, deep-toned Kenya cup with especially lively acidity and lasting flavor-laden finish.

Name: Colombia Manos Juntas
Review: A savory-leaning, berry-toned anaerobic natural Colombia cup, nuanced and deep.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Goro Bedessa
Review: A comfortingly familiar washed Ethiopia cup: juicy-bright with leading notes of stone fruit and cocoa nib.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela G1 Kudume Wolicho Honey
Review: A deeply fruit-toned honey-processed Ethiopia cup with leading notes of berries and spice-toned florals.

Name: Hacienda Esmeralda Ethiopian Accessions
Review: An interesting coffee story of heirloom Ethiopia varieties of Arabica grown in Panama — floral, spice-toned, richly sweet.

Name: Gelena Geisha
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An intentionally fermenty, deep-toned Ethiopia Geisha with rich chocolate notes and a whiff of whisky barrel.

Name: Ethiopia Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A resonant, uniquely composed, savory-sweet, fruit-laden anaerobic natural Ethiopia cup.

Name: Silver Monk Seasonal Blend
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A blend of two Ethiopia coffees by the same producer, a natural and a carbonic-macerated. Pleasingly floral-toned with notes of citrus zest and crisp walnut.

Name: Doho Classic Blend
Review: A friendly blend with leading notes of crisp chocolate and dried fruit notes.

Name: Holiday Reserve Roast — Costa Rica Termico
Review: A Costa Rica coffee processed by an experimental method that results in an inviting cup evocative of baking spices.

Name: La Cordillera Blend
Review: A nice daily-drinker, and intended as such: crisp, sweet, friendly, and even-keeled.

Name: Ethiopia Tamiru Tadesse Tesema Anaerobic Natural
Review: A complex, rich-toned, deeply aromatic, sweetly savory Ethiopia processed by the anaerobic natural method.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Washed G1 Uncle Select Lot 21/01
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup with leading notes of stone fruit and cocoa nib supported by a floral throughline.

Name: Decaf Xeno’s Fair Trade Organic Blend
Review: A solid decaf coffee, crisply bittersweet with nut snd cocoa notes.

Name: Skyway Fair Trade Organic Blend
Review: A blend that will appeal to fans of darker-roasted, earth-toned coffees.

Name: Granville Fair Trade Organic Blend
Review: An easy-going, very crisp cup with sweet nut tones as a throughline.

Name: Spice Island Blend
Review: A blend with a developed roast profile, slightly roasty and nicely cocoa-toned.

Name: Kona Tropical Punch Washed
Review: A very fruit-forward cup, and intentionally so; also delicious served cold.

Name: Gatomboya Kenya
Review: A classic Kenya cup with a grounding umami throughline suggesting ripe, juicy tomato, with undertones of black currant and crisp chocolate.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti Daniel Mijane
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: An easygoing, confident washed Ethiopia cup animated by an appealing sweet herbaceousness.

Name: Ethiopia Bedhatu Natural
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
