Review: A cocoa-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup, deeply fruity and sweetly herbaceous.

Name: Ethiopia Bedhatu Washed
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A friendly, balanced Ethiopia cup with pretty citrus and cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Colombia Huila Palmera
Review: A straightforward, accessible Colombia cup: sweet-toned, with crisp chocolate and nut framed by rich aromatic wood.

Name: Costa Rica Central Valley Brandy Ball
Review: A rich-toned natural-processed Costa Rica cup centered on spicy flowers, sweet citrus, and nut.

Name: Cerro Azul Geisha
Review: A lovely washed Colombia Geisha that’s equal parts high-toned and deep: juicy, bright, rich, floral.

Name: Panama Mama Cata Geisha Champagne Natural
Review: A gently tart, richly floral Panama Geisha cup processed by an experimental method that results in a restrained fruit-forward, floral-toned cup.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Worka Sakaro
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A bright, citrus-driven cup with ballast from notes of cocoa nib and sweet mint and nut impulses.

Name: Haraaz Red
Review: A spice-toned, crisply sweet-tart, classic Yemen cup.

Name: El Socorro Maracaturra
Review: A plush, richly sweet, multi-layered Guatemala Maracaturra offering both depth and levity.

Name: Guatemala Acatenango Gesha
Review: An impressive representation of the Geisha variety grown in Guatemala: delicate, floral, subtly layered.

Name: Costa Rica Luis Campos Termico
Review: A fruit-driven, resonant Costa Rica cup processed by an experimental method that results in an appealing savory-leaning cup — think dried mango and saltwater taffy.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga
Review: A surprisingly lush Kenya cup with leading notes of dark stone fruit and a rich chocolate throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Tetsu Process
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A crisp, delicate Ethiopia anaerobic honey coffee, sweetly nut-toned.

Name: Finca Huixoc Maracaturra
Review: A richly nutty and chocolaty Guatemala cup from the big-beaned Maracaturra variety of Arabica.

Name: Finca Santa Isabel
Review: A multi-layered Guatemala cup poised between floral and nut impulses.

Name: Kenya Nyeri AA Hercules
Review: A balanced, floral-toned Kenya cup with an especially plush mouthfeel.

Name: Proyecto Aurora
Review: A rich, floral-driven cup with pleasing stone fruit and cocoa notes. Harmonious and integrated.

Name: Las Moritas Yellow Caturra
Review: A richly nutty Guatemala cup with notes of dried fruit and a hint of spice-toned florals.

Name: El Pintado Classico
Review: A friendly blend of Bourbon and Geisha varieties from Guatemala that nets an accessible, familiar cup.

Name: 5a Poniente
Review: A sweet, chocolaty, earthy Guatemala cup with a roast profile on the darkish end of medium.

Name: Esperanza Villa Sarchi
Review: A straightforward Guatemala cup with inviting cocoa notes, deep fruit and gently sweet florals.

Name: Esperanza Bourbon
Review: A cocoa-toned, citrusy, sweetly herbaceous washed Guatemala cup.

Name: Finca San Carlos
Review: A robust, bittersweet cup, nut-toned and gently fruity.

Name: 5a Sur
Review: A darkish medium version of a classic Guatemala cup: sweet, balanced, gently nut-toned.

Name: Hacienda La Esmeralda Montañas 71AS
Review: A levitatingly aromatic coffee that evokes the tropics: delicate, complex, rich, harmonious.

Name: Ethiopia Nano Genji #5
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A graceful, harmonious washed Ethiopia cup with spicy floral notes throughout, supported by citrus and cocoa.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Aramo
Review: A juicy, high-toned washed-process Ethiopia cup with a particularly pleasing acidity. Sweetly spice-toned floral notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Gatomboya
Review: A classic Kenya with deep fruit and florals, supported by a juicy sweet-savory structure.

Name: Subrosa Ethiopia Kayon Mountain Organic Natural
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A natural-processed Ethiopia cup driven by tropical fruit and floral tones, with a throughline of cocoa nib.

Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Natural Gesha
Review: A complex, multi-layered natural-processed Gesha from Ethiopia: juicy, floral, cocoa-toned, balanced.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Gesha
Review: A pretty washed Panama Gesha cup evokes tropical flowers and ripe stone fruit, with lyrically bright, balanced acidity.

Name: Natural Ka’u Maragogipe
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A delicately complex Ka’u cup comprised of three big-beaned varieties of Arabica, mainly the rare Maragogipe — rich-toned, sweetly savory with tropical fruit notes.

Name: Costa Rica Volcan Azul San Isidro Red Honey
Origin: Poás Volcano region, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica
Review: A rich-toned, multi-layered red honey from Costa Rica: bright, deep, juicy, high-toned.

Name: Ethiopia Demeka Becha
Review: An elegant, balanced, classic washed Ethiopia cup that encourages meditation on its paradoxes: both juicy and deep, spicy and sweet, complex and inviting.

Name: Sweet Holiday Blend
Review: This sweet-toned holiday blend nails the winter theme with notes of dark chocolate, sweet citrus and baking spices.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Sidama Bensa Bombe
Review: A multi-layered floral-toned Ethiopia cup redolent with stone fruit, dark chocolate and a hint of sweet citrus zest.

Name: Panama Abu Geisha Lot 6
Origin: Cañas Verdes, Boquete growing region, Panama
Review: A deep, inviting natural-processed Panama Geisha cup with rich chocolate and dried berry notes and a floral throughline.

Name: Panama Finca Mi Finquita Geisha Afrodita Natural
Review: A distinctively composed fruit- and flower-bomb with an umami undercurrent.

Name: Panama El Burro Estate Natural Gesha
Review:
A vibrant natural-processed Geisha that leads with tropical fruit and sweet-spicy floral notes layered with wild honey and creamy macadamia nut and earthy
undertones.

Name: Panama La Viuda Natural Geisha 4 Hermanos
Review: A subtly nuanced coffee centered around notes of stone fruit, cocoa nib, and resinous aromatic wood with a levitatingly silky mouthfeel.

Name: Philippines Sitio Belis
Review: An intriguing washed anaerobic cup from the Philippines, reflecting a growing specialty coffee trend in that country. Complex, juicy, tropical.

Name: Colombia Huila Finca Monteblanco Rodrigo Sanchez
Review: Chocolate and crisp fruit lead in this classic washed Colombia cup from the rare Colombia Pink Bourbon variety.

Name: Ninety Plus Panama Gesha Estate MS Joseph Brodsky 2307
Review: A distinctively composed Panama Gesha cup that expresses balance and finesse, as well as restrained power with its fruit and floral dance.

Name: Ethiopia Bedessa
Review: An easygoing light-roasted natural-processed Ethiopia with especially lively acidity.

Name: Organic Ethiopia Shantawene Natural
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A clean natural-processed Ethiopia cup centered around citrus and cocoa notes with a backdrop of spicy florals.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Durato Bombe
Origin: Bombe mountains, Sidama Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A berry- and aromatic wood-framed natural-processed Ethiopia cup, sweet and gently inviting.

Name: Ethiopia Lecho Torka
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A deeply sweet, gently tart washed Ethiopia cup with nicely integrated aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Nano Genji #10
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A chocolaty, citrusy, sweetly herbaceous washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Guatemala CODECH Women’s Lot
Review: Produced by women farmers. A balanced, richly nut-toned Guatemala cup — sweet, deep, friendly, affordable.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Worka Sakaro Anaerobic
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A low-key anaerobically processed Yirgacheffe cup with bittersweet floral notes and a hint of lime zest.

Name: Kenya Kainamui AB
Review: A deep-toned, multi-layered Kenya cup with notes of tart fruit, rich nut tones, and sweet florals throughout.

Name: Kona Mocca®
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A juicy-sweet, richly aromatic coffee from the rare Mocca variety of Arabica with notes of citrus fruit and florals throughout.

Name: Karen J Kona Red Bourbon
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: We’ve said it before: This coffee emerges on our cupping table each year with consistent sensory success. This year’s version is lushly floral with elegant cocoa notes and a hint of citrus.

Name: Ethiopian Sweet Lily
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A deeply sweet natural-processed Ethiopia coffee with magnolia-like floral notes and an undercurrent of stone fruit and myrrh.

Name: Kenya Gachatha Nyeri
Review: Richly aromatic, deeply sweet, boldly savory, and very satisfying.

Name: Bolivia Apolo Latin America Microlot
Review: A crisp, richly full-bodied Bolivia cup with soft acidity and pleasing chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Gora Kone Sidamo
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An engaging natural-processed Ethiopia cup with tart fruit and spice-toned flowers.

Name: Organic 18 Rabbits Honduras
Review: A sweet, delicately nut-toned honey-processed Honduras cup.

Name: Ethiopia Olonso Qeka
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An intensely aroma- and flavor-saturated anaerobic-processed Ethiopia coffee: fruity, floral, richly chocolaty.

Name: Colombia La Estrella Carbonic Maceration
Review: A carbonic macerated coffee that meanders pleasingly through notes of candy-like sweetness and spicy florals, atop a base of sweet herbs and cocoa nib.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bensa Farmer Tamiru 74158 Natural
Review: Focused, elegant, high-toned, juicy: a complex, integrated, tropical fruit- and floral-toned single variety natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Honeydew Costa Rica
Origin: San Vito, Puntarenas Province, Costa Rica
Review: A crisp, balanced honey-processed Costa Rica cup with candy-like sweetness and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Chiayi Blend
Review: A richly sweet, nut-toned house blend with a narcissus throughline and especially inviting, creamy-smooth mouthfeel.

Name: Costa Rica Salazar Black Honey
Origin: Llano Bonito de Narajo, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica
Review: A quiet, gently sweet, very crisp black-honey processed Costa Rica cup.

Name: Holiday Coffee
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A complex, multi-layered, deep-toned holiday blend with sweet spice and floral suggestions, supported by rich chocolate throughout.

Name: Mama Cata Mokkita
Review: An opulent rendition of the rare Mokkita variety of Arabica, both sophisticated and a bit wild, with layer upon layer of tropical fruit notes ensconced in florals and chocolate — an extraordinary sensory journey.

Name: Ethiopia Tamiru Tadesse Anaerobic
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A deep, richly aromatic, lyrically sweet-tart Ethiopia anaerobic cup with a hint of elegant sweet ferment akin to hot buttered rum.

Name: Laura’s Reserve SL34
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A juicy, bright, inviting Kenya-esque Kona cup: balanced, intricate, complete.

Name: Ethiopia Tamiru Tadesse Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A clean, confident natural-processed Ethiopia cup with distinct stone fruit and chocolate notes and spicy floral undertones.

Name: Puna Arakawa Estate Lactic Natural

Review: A rich, fruit- and fragrant wood-framed natural-processed Colombia cup.

Name: Guatemala Santa Felisa Wild Yeast Natural Gesha

Name: El Salvador El Matazano Pacamara

Name: Ethiopia Guji Mormora Organic Natural

Name: Out of Africa Blend

Name: Colombia La Esperanza Anaerobic

Name: Ethiopia Guji Sakicha JH144

Name: FTO Ethiopian

Name: 414 Kenya SL34

Name: Jamaica Blue Mountain
Origin: Blue Mountain growing region, eastern Jamaica.
Review: A gently classic Jamaica Blue Mountain cup: cocoa-toned and crisply sweet, nuanced with hints of citrusy herbs and nougat.

Name: Kona Maragogype Peaberry Natural
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: This very rare bean, a peaberry grade of the enormous Maragogype variety, produces here a gorgeous, vivid, richly sweet-savory cup.

Name: Ecuador San José de Minas Double-Anaerobic
Review: A resonant, clean, vibrantly sweet-tart washed anaerobic Ecuador cup with an exhilaratingly complex range of aromatic expression.

Name: Colombia Bandida Lactic Natural
Review: A richly bittersweet Colombia cup processed with the addition of lactobacilli to the whole-cherry fermentation, resulting in a fundamentally sweet cup with savory undertones.

Name: Nyeri Hill Kenya
Review: A complete, expressive Kenya cup with tart fruit, sweet cocoa and spicy floral notes throughout.

Name: Las Flores Colombia
Review: A deep, chocolaty Colombia cup with ballast from spicy florals and sweet, creamy nut.

Name: Pandemic Pacamara Blend
Review: An adeptly medium-roasted all-Pacamara blend that emphasizes this big-beaned variety’s engaging balance of sweet and savory impulses.

Name: Nicaragua Yellow Pacamara Natural
Review: Nuanced and complex, a rare natural-processed Pacamara from Nicaragua. Deep, rich, and sweet-tart-savory in harmonious balance.

Name: Papua New Guinea Sigri Estate Medium Roast
Review: An understated, balanced PNG cup with pretty nut tones andcrisp  cocoa throughout.

Name: Ethiopia West Arsi Nensebo Natural G1
Review: A juicy fruit-bomb of a natural Ethiopia cup, the fruit complemented by spicy floral and buttery nut tones.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bona Sweet Natural
Review: A fruit-driven, spice-toned Sidamo natural cup with depth and complexity. Particularly juicy acidity.

Name: Congo Square
Origin: South Kivu growing region, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A uniquely structured Congo cup that is equal parts sweet, tart and savory. Resinous nut and mesquite suggestions complement sweet honey notes.

Name: Rwanda Rulindo Tumba
Review: A rich-toned, very deeply sweet, subtly savory Rwanda cup with cocoa and floral intrigue.

Name: Tanzania Sambewe
Review: A stunningly juicy, deeply rich, chocolaty cup, pleasingly complicated by notes of mulberry and almond brittle.

Name: Rwanda Kinini Village Natural
Review: A balanced, richly berry-driven natural-processed Rwanda cup, juicy and sweet.

Name: Tanzania Peaberry
Review: A Kenya-like Tanzania cup — richly pungent, resonantly sweet-savory, layered and complex.

Name: Rwanda Dukunde Kawa
Review: A deep-toned, chocolaty natural-process Rwanda cup with inviting aromatic wood notes.

Name: Burundi Mikuba Honey Microlot 1
Review: A subtly complex, balanced Burundi cup with engaging spice-toned floral and stone fruit notes.

Name: Rwanda Simbi
Review: A confidently structured, nuanced Rwanda cup, notably light-roasted, with leading notes of cocoa and tart fruit.

Name: Rwanda Akagera CWS Fully Washed Lot 9
Review: A deep-toned, chocolaty and floral Rwanda cup with lift from bright citrus suggestions.

Name: Burundi Kinyovu
Review: An inviting darker-roasted Burundi with deep, rich chocolate notes throughout, complicated by sweet florals, dried fruit, and a pleasingly smoky cedar.

Name: Tanzania Ngila Estate SL28
Review: A Tanzania produced from trees of the SL28 variety so closely associated with Kenya, and reminiscent of the best Kenyas with its nectar-like sweetness, deep complexity, and a surprising and disarming levity.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Sidama Nafasha 74158 21/01
Review: A nuanced, complex, uniquely composed washed Ethiopia cup offering it all: sweet elegance, playful tartness, rich depth.

Name: Ethiopia Tibe Haro Uraga
Review: A uniquely composed washed Ethiopia cup: citrusy, herbaceous, chocolaty, exceptionally and complexly nuanced.

Name: Taiwan Natural Alishan TFU’YA Kakalove Lot
Review: A juicy, richly fruit-toned, nougaty cup from Taiwan’s expanding Alishan growing region — sweet, balanced, juicy, bright.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Blue Donkey 21/01
Review: A harmonious, integrated natural-processed Ethiopia with bright berry and deep floral notes throughout, supported by fragrant sandalwood.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Gachatha Washed AB
Review: A classic Nyeri cup: floral- and fruit-driven, chocolaty, richly aromatic and punctuated with sweet herb undertones.

Name: Rwanda Natural Rutsiro Bugoyi 60-hour Fermentation
Review: An unusual Rwanda cup. The experimental processing method may accentuate the complexity of the cup, sweetly fruit-toned yet brisk and savory.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1 Mulugeta Tsige
Review: A multi-layered washed Ethiopia cup with resonant citrus, herb and cocoa notes throughout and a particularly exciting acidity, juicy and balanced.

Name: Kenya AA Top Gathambi Station
Review: A classic Kenya cup, equally sweet and savory, with the exhilarating tart fruit notes and sweet herb tones the origin is admired for.

Name: Ethiopia Keramo Village
Review: An intensely fruit-forward, richly chocolaty anaerobic natural cup — juicy, bright, sweetly herbaceous.

Name: Ethiopia Uraga Washed G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An integrated, satisfyingly complete washed Ethiopia cup in which fruit, florals and cocoa harmonize.

Name: Rwanda Nyruzisa Station
Review: Chocolate and flowers: crisp cocoa nib and resonant narcissus-like florals animate this graceful Rwanda cup.

Name: Kenya Lenana AA Plus
Review: A sweet cocoa-toned Kenya cup complicated by appealing bittersweet floral notes suggesting hop flowers.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Natural Water Decaf
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An impressive water-processed decaf from coffees produced in Ethiopia’s Guji growing area — sweet, chocolaty, with inviting aromatic wood notes.

Name: Grizzly Peak Blend
Review: A deeper-roasted, rich-toned blend that satisfies by foregrounding chocolate and floral notes.

Name: Kenya Karindudu AA
Review: A smooth, deeply sweet, richly savory Kenya cup, chocolaty and floral-driven, with an especially compelling mulberry note throughout.

Name: Colombia Cardona Natural
Review: An attractively fruit-toned, natural-processed Colombia with a winey aroma and flavor, supported by notes of rich chocolate and sweet florals.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Anaerobic
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A big, juicy, cleanly fruit-forward anaerobically processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Maypop
Review: The unconventional addition of fruit to the tank during a long ferment stage contributes to a vibrantly nuanced cup.

Name: Norte Peru
Review: A deeply sweet, richly aromatic Peru with a crisp chocolate throughline and hints of flowers throughout.

Name: Trivarietal
Review: A friendly, accessible, gently medium-roasted Colombia cup with an engaging hint of baking spices.

Name: La Soledad Colombia
Review: A bright, juicy-sweet Colombia Caturra — classically chocolaty with rich fruit and floral notes.

Name: Natural Mexico Ixhuatlan del Cafe
Review: A clean, lively natural-processed Typica grown in the Veracruz region of Mexico — bright, deep, elegantly fruit-forward.

Name: Colombia Huila Acevedo El Paraiso
Review: A cup from the admired Colombia Pink Bourbon that evokes the tropics: richly floral, and with a throughline of deep sandalwood notes.

Name: 100% Organic Specialty Arabica
Review: A deep, rich Chiapas cup deftly medium-roasted to emphasize chocolate and floral tones.

Name: Love of Desolate
Origin: Los Angeles, Sabanilla de Alajuela, Costa Rica
Review: A tantalizingly complex, balanced, juicy Costa Rica honey with lyrically vibrant acidity, exceptionally full, syrupy mouthfeel, and a flavor-saturated finish that goes on and on.

Name: Ethiopia Niguse Gemeda Mude Natural
Origin: Hayisa Village, Bure Woreda, Sidama Zone, Ethiopia
Review: A confident, inviting natural-process Ethiopia cup with engaging notes of cocoa nib, dried stone fruit, and spicy florals.

Name: Rwanda Nyamagabe Kigeme Lot #4
Review: A crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned Rwanda with pleasing floral and fruit nuance.

Name: La Estrella Carbonic Geisha Reserve
Review: Sweetly high-toned, layered, complex, an anaerobic natural for those who savor the bright side of lush.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Wush Wush Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An elegantly vibrant Ethiopia cup processed by the anaerobic natural method, netting a lyrical pungency and harmonious balance.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Wush Wush
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An intriguing, deeply nuanced coffee with savory-sweet impulses and an inviting kefir-like tang, all driven by explosive notes of tropical flowers.

Name: Tres Dragones Colombia
Origin: Caicedonia, Valle de Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A musky-rich, chocolaty, gently rum barrel-toned Colombia processed by an experimental natural method that encourages both high-toned sweetness and savory depth.

Name: Panama Elida Estate Catuaí Natural ASD
Review: A confident, unabashedly lactic-leaning anaerobic-slow-dried Catuai grown by renowned Geisha producer Elida Estate — sweet, tangy, juicy, intense.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Natural Anaerobic Wush Wush G1
Review: A richly low-toned, crisply chocolaty, sweetly earthy anaerobic Ethiopia cup.

Name: Peru Yanesha Geisha Double-Anaerobic
Review: A crisply chocolaty, spice-toned anaerobic washed Peru cup with pretty floral notes throughout, both vanilla and lavender.

Name: Elida Natural ASD (Panama)
Review: A dense and dessert-like coffee, sweet yet pungent, chocolate and cheese.

Name: Pink Bourbon Natural Anaerobic Colombia
Review: A uniquely composed Colombia Pink Bourbon processed by the anaerobic natural method — suggests a tropical breeze in its floral and gently fermenty, fruit-toned levity.

Name: Ethiopia Oromia Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A lovely darker-roasted Ethiopia processed by the anaerobic natural method, discreetly smoky and richly floral and chocolaty.

Name: Villa Loyola Carbonic Maceration
Review: Carbonic maceration may promote this coffee’s balance and quiet complexity: chocolate, citrus, herb, flowers.

Name: Castillo El Paraiso
Review: A juicy-bright cup for lovers of tart-leaning coffees — think passion fruit softened by cocoa nib.

Name: Panama Elida Estate Washed
Review: A deeply harmonious, buoyantly balanced Panama Geisha cup from the renowned Elida Estate redolent with notes of ripe stone fruit, crisp cocoa nib, explosive florals, resiny aromatic wood, and delicately sweet herbs.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Euphora Special Lot
Review: A pleasingly tart natural-process Ethiopia cup with a throughline of stone fruit and tangy floral notes.

Name: Finca Lerida Gesha Natural
Origin: Jaramillo, Boquete growing region, western Panama
Review: A rich, deeply pungent Panama Geisha cup deftly roasted to medium to promote particularly attractive caramel and floral notes.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Yabitu
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A quietly complex washed Guji coffee: crisp, smooth, richly drying and balanced.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Dabaye
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A friendly, accessible washed Ethiopia cup animated by delicate stone fruit, cocoa and sweet herb notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Dry-Process Guji Hambela
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A natural-processed Guji characterized by pleasing aromatic wood notes complicated by stone fruit and chocolate.

Name: Ethiopia Dry-Process Benti Nenka
Review: A quietly pleasing natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup with citrus and sweet nut undertones.

Name: Papua New Guinea Tsekaka
Origin: Banz, Jiwaka Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: Like s’mores in a cup: sweet, chocolate-driven with notes of marshmallow and graham cracker.

Name: Kona Maragogype Natural
Origin: Kainaliu, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A pretty, tropical-leaning, richly floral Kona Maragogype processed by the natural method — juicy, vibrant, complex, nuanced.

Name: Thung Chang Robusta Honey
Review: A Robusta coffee from Thailand that’s deftly darker-roasted to develop cocoa and deep nut tones.

Name: Colombia Jorge Eli Dussan
Review: A crisply chocolaty Colombia cup with deep fruit and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere G1
Review: A complex, richly fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with distinct dark chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Shakiso Dambi Udo Honey
Review: A gently fruit-toned honey-processed Ethiopia cup redolent with stone fruit, deep chocolate, and a hint of sweet garden herbs.

Name: Kenya Washed Nyeri Gichathaini Factory AB
Review: A classic Kenya cup with notes of red fruit, sweet florals, and a hint of pleasing umami (think sweet ripe tomato).

Name: Colombia Pink Bourbon Honey
Review: A lush, balanced, juicy-sweet Pink Bourbon from Colombia, lyrical in its balance and elegance.

Name: Karatina Kenya
Review: Classic Kenya through and through: high-toned, juicy-sweet, resonantly deep, rich and bright.

Name: Cerro Azul Geisha
Origin: Trujillo, Valle del Cauca Department, Colombia
Review: A meticulously and experimentally processed Geisha cup from one of Colombia’s most respected farms: juicy, playful, floral, fruity, complex.

Name: Kona SL34 Sweet Spot
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A compelling fruit- and floral-toned Kona cup, Kenya-esque in its bright acidity and complex aromatics.

Name: Haraaz Red
Review: A deep, rich, fruit-driven, spice-framed Yemen cup, nuanced and multi-layered, with intriguingly complex aromatics.

Name: Suyusama Colombia
Review: Equal parts chocolate- and fruit-driven, with crisp baking chocolate and sweet stone fruit as throughlines.

Name: Private Reserve Colombia Antioquia
Review: A crisply sweet, quietly vibrant Colombia cup, chocolaty and delicately floral-toned.

Name: Las Brisas Colombia
Review: A classic Colombia cup — crisp, sweet, chocolaty and floral  — with especially attractive acidity.

Name: Private Reserve Rwanda Huye
Review: A crisply chocolaty, nut-toned and aromatic wood-framed Rwanda cup.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo G2 Washed
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A friendly, accessible, balanced Ethiopia cup: crisp, floral, delicately sweet.

Name: Private Reserve Panama La Huaca
Review: A natural-processed Panama cup with notes of dried fruit, creamy nut, and a hint of gardenia-like flowers.

Name: Costa Rica Gesha Tobosi Natural
Origin: El Guarco, Cartago Province, Costa Rica
Review: A cleanly fruit-centered Costa Rica natural with suggestions of honeysuckle throughout the profile.

Name: Kenya Kiambu Kiriga AA
Review: A rich-toned Kenya cup driven by classic red currant notes, both richly sweet and deeply savory.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Heyilu Butiya
Review: A berry-bomb of an Ethiopia natural: clean, juicy, richly sweet.

Name: Sumatra Kerinci Highlands Honey
Origin: Kerinci Highlands, Jambi Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: A honey-processed Sumatra cup that leads with tropical fruit notes with undertones of savory-leaning spices.

Name: Rwanda Sholi
Review: Floral and spice tones drive this fine Rwanda cup with support from sweet nut and aromatic wood suggestions.

Name: Guatemala Villatoro Anaerobic
Review: An interesting sweet-savory cup profile with berry and chocolate in the foreground and undertones of a pleasantly tangy sensation akin to fresh goat cheese.

Name: Guatemala Monja Blanca
Review: An appealing Guatemala cup with crisp apple and sweet herb notes supported by a throughline of rich nut tones.

Name: Ethiopia Wuri Washed
Review: A friendly, balanced washed Ethiopia with notes of sweet melon, rich aromatic wood, and citrusy herb.

Name: Sumatra Ketiara
Origin: Bebesen District, Aceh Tengah, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: A classic wet-hulled Sumatra cup: sweet, savory, earthy, full-bodied.

Name: Ethiopia Amhara Natural
Review: A gently fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia with spice floral notes and a hint of citrus zest.

Name: Original Gold Coffee Pouches
Review: Those who want caffeine and the health benefits of coffee without perceived acidity may value and enjoy this subtle, herbal-tea-like beverage. Think cocoa puffs breakfast cereal without the sugar.

Name: Kona Mocca®
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A decadent, dessert-like cup from the rare Mocca variety of Arabica with a throughline of tropical fruit and a hint of sweet ferment.

Name: Panama Elida Green-Tip Geisha La Torre ASD
Review: A sophisticated fruit bomb of a coffee — the celebrated Geisha variety experimentally processed by world-class Elida Estate in Panama.

Name: Kona Peaberry
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A classic Kona Typica cup produced by a new sustainability-minded farm. And nicely priced for a fine Kona.

Name: Panama Finca Los Lajones Natural
Review: A high-toned yet resonant natural-processed Catuaí from Panama: sweetly tart, floral, evocative of the tropics.

Name: SL28
Origin: North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A classic Kenya-esque cup produced in Kona from the famous Kenya SL28 variety: juicy, deep, balanced, bright.

Name: Bourbon Pointu Natural
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A cleanly fruit-forward Bourbon Pointu cup from Kona supported by rich nut, sweet herb, and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Honey Honduras Comsa
Review: A delicate, perfumy honey-processed Honduras with throughlines of dried stone fruit and spice-toned florals.

Name: Honduras Los Amigos
Review: An unabashedly tart natural-process Honduras cup: clean, crisp, sweet and chocolaty.

Name: Miranda’s Farms Hawai’i Caturra
Origin: Ka'u District, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A savory-toned, chocolaty and berry-driven Ka’u cup processed by a hybrid method in which the whole fruit is subject to fermentation using wine yeasts.

Name: Uganda Utz Sipi Falls
Review: A friendly, accessible Uganda cup, deep-toned and chocolate-driven.

Name: Colombia Nariño
Review: A friendly, accessible (and accessibly priced) Colombia cup with engaging chocolate and raisin notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela Buku Abel Slow Dry Natural 2400m
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: An elegant natural-processed Ethiopia cup, fruit-toned with notes of sweet nuts and citrus zest.

Name: Papua New Guinea Baroida Natural
Origin: ainantu District, Eastern Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: A delicate yet confident, fruit-driven PNG natural cup, juicy and appealingly sweet-tart.

Name: Foundry Blend
Review: A blend named in homage to the rolled metal shop that once occupied the site of Propeller’s current roasting operation. Crisp, chocolaty, richly sweet-toned.

Name: Papua New Guinea Baroida Washed
Origin: ainantu District, Eastern Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: A quietly impressive washed-process PNG cup, delicate and deeply sweet.

Name: Papua New Guinea Baroida Honey
Origin: Kainantu District, Eastern Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: A honey-processed PNG cup, complexly fruit-toned with a backdrop of spicy flowers.

Name: Yemen Al Mashtal Al Burhani
Review: An impressive Yemen cup, deep-toned and cleanly fruit-centered with bright, juicy acidity and inviting spice notes throughout.

Name: Reina de la Asuncion Ecuador
Review: A balanced, vibrant Ecuador cup that leads with notes of sweet melon and spicy florals, supported by deep tones of ,cocoa and nut.

Name: Colombia Finca El Vergal Geisha/Java Natural
Review: An unusual blend of two varieties of Arabica, both natural-processed and both derived from Ethiopian landraces — the well-known, floral-toned Geisha and the lesser-known, more balanced Java.

Name: Nayamasasa Democratic Republic of the Congo
Origin: South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A classic D.R. Congo cup alive with notes of stone fruit, chocolate, nut butter, citrus zest.

Name: Colombia Chiroso Natural
Review: A vibrantly rich Colombia cup from the rare Chiroso variety of Arabica, grown only in parts of Colombia and offered by Paradise for the first time.

Name: Guji Ethiopia Washed
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A bright, crisply high-toned, floral-driven washed Guji with sweet herb undertones.

Name: Colombia Monteblanco Geisha
Review: A nuanced, elegant Colombia Geisha with notes of tropical fruit, spice-toned florals and rich cocoa nib.

Name: Ethiopia Gedeo Kochere Reko Natural
Review: A cleanly fruit-centered Ethiopia cup with intriguing notes of musk and an especially full mouthfeel.

Name: Belquis Ramirez Lemus Colombia Coffee for Peace
Review: A good-value, balanced Colombia cup, juicy and bright, with notes of stone fruit and cocoa nib throughout.

Name: Asprole Blend #1 Colombia Coffee for Peace
Review: A friendly, accessible Colombia cup — briskly sweet and richly chocolaty.

Name: Rwanda Sholi
Review: An inviting, high-toned Rwanda cup with especially vibrant, juicy acidity.

Name: Addis Katema
Review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: sweet, bright, balanced and juicy, with citrus and stone fruit notes supported by a cocoa throughline.

Name: Easter Sunrise Blend
Review: A deep-toned, richly sweet blend all at once chocolaty, floral and citrusy.

Name: Peru Jheyner Roman
Review: A friendly and appealing Peru cup with crisp, chocolaty depth and an aroma reminiscent of pralines.

Name: Colombia La Victoria
Review: A richly sweet, lingeringly aromatic Colombia cup with bittersweet floral notes.

Name: Aged Sumatra Ulos Batak 2015
Review: Paradise says, “This coffee reminds us of Paul Bunyan chopping his way through a great forest, wearing Old Spice cologne, smoking a cigar, and not giving a care.” In more explicit terms, this coffee is earthy, foresty, musky and fresh tobacco-toned.

Name: Kona Uluwehi SL34
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: Tropics in a cup, all fruit and spice-toned florals, supported by a syrupy mouthfeel and bright structure.

Name: Colombia Pink Bourbon Finca El Chaparote
Review: An integrated, harmonious Pink Bourbon from Colombia with high-toned floral and fruit notes throughout — richly aromatic, juicy and bright.

Name: Brazil Daterra Aramosa Anaerobic Honey
Review: A coffee from the just-developed Amarosa pre-cultivar processed by the anaerobic honey method — worth seeking out both for its rarity and its striking cup profile.

Name: Kona Classic Dark
Review: A deep, confident darker-roasted Kona Typica that would play well with milk.

Name: Thailand Huai Mae Liam White Honey
Origin: Huai Mae Liam, Chiang Rai, Thailand
Review: A delicate, gently sweet-tart cup from Thailand — friendly, easy-drinking, and very sweet.

Name: Estate Finca La Lina
Review: A friendly, easy-drinking Colombia cup with crisp chocolate and sweet nut  throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Neja Fadil
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A confidently fruit-driven natural-processed Ethiopia cup with depth, breadth, vivacity, and complexity.

Name: Congo Muungano
Origin: South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A classic Central Africa cup driven by notes of stone fruit and spicy florals supported by rich-toned aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Hambela G1 Natural
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An accessible, easygoing natural-processed Ethiopia cup: deeply sweet, crisply chocolaty, with hints of spicy florals throughout.

Name: Peru Buena Vista Valerio Almanza Ccahua
Review: A fine Peru cup with tropical aromatics, lively, balanced acidity and crisp, silky mouthfeel.

Name: Private Reserve Ethiopia Barrel-Aged
Review: A barrel-fermented Ethiopia cup with a light touch — just a hint of wine cask on the nose and palate — supported by sweet berry, floral and chocolate suggestions.

Name: Private Reserve Costa Rica Naranjo
Review: A cocoa-driven Costa Rica cup complicated by gentle notes of citrus zest, sweet fruit and florals.

Name: Private Reserve Guatemala Medina Estate
Review: A classic Guatemala cup: sweetly nut-toned, friendly, accessible.

Name: Panama Finca Santa Teresa Lot 9
Review: A pretty, confident, expansive Panama cup, richly fruit- and floral-toned.

Name: Guatemala Cobán Chicoj Cooperative Red Honey Fair Trade
Review: A stone fruit and cocoa-driven Guatemala cup. Crisp, bright, vibrant, balanced.

Name: Ethiopia Halo Hartume Daniel Mijane
Review: A high-toned, elegant washed Yirgacheffe cup with a floral and stone fruit throughline.

Name: Costa Rica La Pastora Honey
Review: A crisp, high-toned Costa Rica honey-processed cup. Notes of tart apple and sweet florals throughout, supported by deep nut tones.

Name: Colombia Cauca El Paraiso
Review: An exquisitely refined ultra-light-roasted coffee from Japan, all fruit and flowers, at turns delicate and mysterious, and consistently confident and engaging.

Name: Taiwan Songyue Geisha
Review: A fine Taiwan-grown Geisha, processed by the natural method, cleanly fruit-centered with spice-toned floral notes throughout the profile.

Name: Ethiopia Suke Quto
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, juicy washed-process Ethiopia cup with citrus and stone fruit notes up top and spice-toned florals underneath.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga Peaberry
Review: A rich-toned Kenya cup with classic black currant notes and both sweet and savory floral impulses.

Name: Project Congo Muungano
Origin: South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A chocolaty, sweetly nutty Congo cup from a highly regarded cooperative, one-third of whose members are women.

Name: Humanitarian Grounds
Review: Sweet floral suggestions complicate a base of richly aromatic cocoa and wood tones.

Name: Kenya Nyeri
Review: A classic Kenya cup: vibrant, sweet-tart, with bright acidity, rich florals and dark-berry fruit.

Name: Look for the Helpers
Review: 100% of the profits from the sale of this coffee go to support the Bellingham Food Bank in Washington State — and it’s a friendly, accessible daily-drinker, sweet and cocoa-toned.

Name: Nicaragua Women Producers
Review: A balanced, crisply sweet Nicaragua cup produced by a woman-owned farm.

Name: Josh Daniels Grateful Blend
Review: A rich, resonant blend of Papua New Guinea and Colombia coffees with an appealing cocoa throughline nuanced by sweet herb undertones.

Name: Ethiopia Quantit
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, gently spice-toned, delicately brisk washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: #She_Builds
Review: An interesting blend of two origins not often combined, Haiti and Ethiopia, netting a pleasing, richly sweet cup.

Name: Guatemala Acatenango Geisha
Review: A bright, balanced, juicy Guatemala Geisha driven by stone fruit, floral and sweet nut notes with undertones of sweet herbs.

Name: Memory Lane
Review: Friendly and appealing blend that is balanced, crisply fruit-toned, and satisfyingly chocolaty.

Name: Monte Alban Mexico
Review: A lovely Mexico cup from the Oaxaca region: rich and vibrant, with spice-toned florals and notes of berry and sweet hazelnut.

Name: Kimi Blend
Review: A carefully considered blend of coffees from three origins — Ethiopia, Colombia, Nicaragua — showing fine range and balance, with an especially pleasuring structure and bright, but not showy, acidity.

Name: Guatemala Las Victorias Euphora Special Lot
Review: A clean, deep-toned Guatemala cup, dried in the whole fruit and gently tart-leaning (think fresh raspberry).

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga Baragwi Karumandi AA
Review: Cocoa-driven, floral-framed, with rich cedar and dark red fruit notes throughout; a classic Kenya cup.

Name: Harimau Tiger Sumatra
Review: A richly sweet, harmonious, balanced Sumatra cup vivid with fresh earth notes juxtaposed with deep fruit and floral suggestions.

Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Washed
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A bold, resonant, richly floral washed Ethiopia cup, confident in its high-toned citrusy and honeysuckle-redolent aromatics.

Name: San Antonio Guatemala
Origin: San Cristobal Cucho, San Marcos Department, Guatemala
Review: A sweetly nut-driven coffee -- think pistachio -- with sweet herb and aromatic wood undertones.

Name: La Esperanza Colombia Estate
Review: A very affordably priced microlot Colombia: berry-driven and chocolaty, with notes of rich nut brittle and sweet herbs.

Name: La Coipa Peru
Review: A deeply sweet Peru cup distinguished by rich fudge-like chocolate suggestions with berry and aromatic wood nuance.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Washed
Review: A lovely washed-process Ethiopia cup with notes of both stone fruit (apricot) and stone fruit flowers (plum blossom) with a bright, juicy structure.

Name: Thailand Pink Valley Natural
Review: An unabashedly fruit-forward coffee, redolent of a whole range of sweet berries. Deeply floral as well.

Name: El Salvador La Guachocha
Origin: Canton Lomas de San Marcelino, Coatepeque, Santa Ana, El Salvador
Review: Richly chocolaty and spicily floral with a hint of citrus for lift, this rare Orange Bourbon is a balanced, pleasing cup.

Name: El Salvador Malacara B Orange
Origin: antón Montañita, Volcán Santa Ana, El Salvador
Review: An especially high-toned, juicy-bright El Salvador cup comprised entirely of the rare Orange Bourbon variety of Arabica.

Name: Kenya Gachatha
Review: Richly spice-toned, floral- and fruit-driven, a complete expression of the great Kenya profile.

Name: Ethiopia Gera Limu
Review: A balanced, juicy washed Ethiopia cup driven by notes of stone fruit and cocoa nib — classically composed and deeply satisfying.

Name: Peru Tambopata
Review: A resonant Peru cup with notes of deep florals, stone fruit and citrus zest.

Name: Panama Pacamara Natural
Review: A deep, brooding, balanced Panama Pacamara cup — a cleanly expressed natural with resonant notes of chocolate fudge and sweet florals throughout.

Name: Panama Geisha
Review: An elegant, assertive anaerobically processed Geisha from Panama, roasted to a darkish medium to develop notes of dark chocolate that complement heady fruit and florals.

Name: Costa Rica Cloza Estate
Review: A pleasing, delicately spice-toned, richly nutty Costa Rica cup, classically balanced.

Name: Ka’u Pink Honey
Origin: Ka'u District, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An exciting Ka’u cup that is equal parts lushly fruit-forward and elegantly floral.

Name: Kona Maragogype Pink Honey
Origin: Kainaliu, Kona District, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A cleanly fruit-forward, uniquely composed Hawai’i cup from the huge-beaned, very rare Maragogype variety of Arabica.

Name: Ecuador La Hormiga “Naty”
Review: An unassuming, quietly complex natural-processed Ecuador cup with added intrigue from a partial anaerobic fermentation step.

Name: Guatemala Coffea Diversa Geisha Queen Honey
Review: An elegant, understated Guatemala Geisha processed by the honey method — deeply sweet and richly aromatic.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Gotiti Natural
Review: Flowers and fruit distinguish this natural-processed Ethiopia cup: crisp, clean and chocolaty with undertones of warm baking spices.

Name: Ethiopia Demeka Becha
Review: A Red Rooster exclusive coffee, and one worth seeking out: a classic washed Ethiopia profile with generous floral and complex citrus notes supported by crisp cocoa nib.

Name: Costa Rica Anaerobic
Review: An anaerobically processed coffee with rich structure and original and intriguing aromatics: think walking into a bakery redolent with yeast and cinnamon.

Name: Rwanda Triple-Washed
Review: A friendly, classic Rwanda cup: balanced, deep, floral and nutty with fruit undertones.

Name: Trust the Process — Full Natural
Origin: Los Naranjos, La Argentina, Huila Department, Colombia
Review: An intricately original natural-processed Colombia cup that evolves as it cools — lyrically sweet, mysteriously savory, invitingly tart.

Name: Colombia Finca El Caucho Pink Bourbon
Review: A sweetly evocative presentation of Colombia Pink Bourbon, a rare and possibly misnamed variety particularly associated with the Huila region of Colombia. Classically wet-processed and driven by spicy floral, sweet citrus and tropical fruit notes.

Name: Colombia Antioquia Natural Carbonic Maceration Caturra
Review: A rich, complex, decadently sweet cup processed by an unusual anaerobic natural fermentation method. Jammy, chocolaty, floral.

Name: Colombia La Gallera Estate
Review: A honey-processed Colombia with the vibrant sweetness and elegant balance we might expect from a coffee composed of the distinguished Sidra and Bourbon varieties.

Name: Colombia Pink Bourbon/Pink Lemonade Collaboration
Review: A crisp, delicate yet confident Colombia cup — classically sweet and cocoa-toned with juicy acidity.

Name: Colombia Finca El Paraiso
Review: Processed by an experimental anaerobic fermentation method that nets a savory, sweetly spicy and gingery, intriguingly unconventional cup.

Name: Aces La Juntas
Review: A lively, crisply chocolaty and sweetly berry-driven cup with a particularly poised, suavely balanced structure.

Name: Colombia Finca Potosi
Review: A rich, delicately floral Colombia cup with suggestions of sweet citrus complicated by attractive hints of aromatic wood.

Name: Finca La Maria Geisha Natural
Review: A rich, resonant natural-processed cup with pretty floral and stone fruit notes complemented by suggestions of sweet herb and nut.

Name: Colombia Java El Edén Limited Edition
Review: A deep, complex Colombia processed by an elaborate experimental  anaerobic method that encourages engaging lactic tones enveloped in rich fruit and floral sweetness.

Name: Colombia Diofanor Ruiz
Review: A uniquely composed natural-processed coffee with unusual yogurt-like nuance layered with chocolate, fruit and floral suggestions.

Name: Bright Minds
Review: A vibrantly spice-driven cup with a throughline of bright floral and deep chocolate suggestions.

Name: Finca Potosi Anaerobic
Review: An intentionally fermenty anaerobic-processed Colombia cup with a jammy, gently alcoholic aroma and flavor and undertones of baking chocolate and fresh-cut oak.

Name: Angamaza
Review: An elegant, subtle Ecuador cup driven by juicy berry notes and spice undertones, all harmonious and integrated.

Name: Colombia La Virgen Microlot
Review: A straight-ahead washed Colombia cup with sweet fruit and flowers throughout and undertones of aromatic wood.

Name: Rayo del Sol
Review: A very sweet, floral-toned coffee with a chocolate throughline. This is a micro-lot produced at a woman-owned farm.

Name: Rock the House Blend
Review: Over the years this JBC house blend has been consistently solid-scoring, always accessible and friendly, balanced and affordable.

Name: Honduras Catuai/Bourbon
Review: An impressively straightforward, balanced, sweet-toned Honduras cup with creamy nut and rich floral notes throughout.

Name: Kona Geisha Champagne Natural
Origin: Kealakekua, Kona, Big Island of Hawaii
Review: A coffee of the celebrated Geisha variety grown in Kona and processed by an experimental wine-yeast-fermented natural method designed to encourage Champagne-like acidity.

Name: Dafis Abafita Natural Ethiopia
Review: A rare single-farm Ethiopia, meticulously grown and processed by Dafis Abafita: elegant, deep, lively, compelling.

Name: Berg Wu Championship Sidamo Washed G1 Lot 20-02
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A headily perfumed cup grounded by cocoa nib. Paradoxically both high-toned and exhilarating while paradoxically deep and brooding.

Name: Ka’u Yellow Bourbon
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai'i
Review: An exceptional Yellow Bourbon grown in the Ka’u region of the Big Island of Hawai’i: expressive, nuanced, complex, juicy.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Hambela Wate
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A high-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with a hint of sweet ferment and rich floral and chocolate undertones.

Name: Kenya Nyeri
Review: A solid, classic Kenya cup, cocoa-toned with layers of dark fruit.

Name: Kinini Village Rwanda
Review: A rich, resonant Rwanda cup with both depth and breadth: berry-toned and chocolaty.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Uraga G1 Lot 20-05
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A multi-layered, floral-inclined natural-processed Ethiopia cup with an umami undercurrent: a trifecta of sweet, tart, savory impulses.

Name: Ethiopia Honey Yirgacheffe Koke
Review: Like blueberries? If so, you’ll enjoy this cleanly natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup with dark chocolate undertones.

Name: Ka’u Lehua Black Honey
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai'i
Review: A deep, meditative Ka’u cup processed by the black honey method: rich, round, intensely aromatic.

Name: Taiwan Taitung Luan Mountain Valley of Tears
Review: A savory, pleasantly salty, chocolate-driven Taiwan cup, experimentally processed using anaerobic fermentation.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Muchoki Estate AA
Review: A richly chocolaty Kenya cup with deep floral notes throughout and a particularly lively, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel.

Name: Thailand Robusta Panid Choosit
Review: An especially sweet specialty Robusta cup from coffee sourced by Miguel Meza during a research trip to Thailand in search of quality non-Arabica coffees.

Name: Bright House Signature Coffee
Review: A rich-toned, chocolate-driven blend with stone fruit and citrus undertones, bright and juicy.

Name: Ethiopia Uraga Dambi Uddo Wet-Fermented
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An enticing washed-process Ethiopia cup with especially compelling acidity and pretty spice-toned floral notes throughout.

Name: Guoxing Taiwan Coffee
Review: A berry- and chocolate-toned natural-processed Taiwan cup — clean, friendly, approachable.

Name: Peru El Corazon Gesha
Review: Simultaneously deep and high-toned, saturated with notes of stone fruit, dark chocolate, sweet nuts, and rich aromatic wood — a persuasive presentation of the admired and still-rare Gesha variety.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Cleopatra Natural
Review: A deep, sweetly savory, floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia, complex and nuanced.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Benti G1 Washed
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, classic Ethiopia wet-processed cup: stone-fruit, citrus and sweet florals throughout.

Name: Taiwan Alluring Scent Estate Natural
Review: A high-toned, spice-driven, sweet-tart coffee grown in Alishan, Taiwan, a region highly regarded for its teas.

Name: Revolution Medium Roast
Origin: Central Plateau, Blue Pine Forest, Haiti
Review: A friendly, accessible Haiti cup with pleasing nut and chocolate tones.

Name: Guatemala Sierra Roja Geisha
Origin: San Cristobal Acasaguastlán, El Progreso Department, Guatemala
Review: An elegantly bright structure supports a compelling range of classic Geisha aroma and flavors.

Name: Independence Dark Roast
Origin: Central Plateau, Blue Pine Forest, Haiti
Review: A dark-roasted Haiti cup that highlights sweet smokiness and chocolaty nut tones.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Dumerso G1 Natural
Review: A cleanly berry-driven natural Ethiopia cup with sweet floral and deep caramel undertones, lively and engaging.

Name: Guatemala Acetenango Gesha Lot 2
Review: A harmonious washed-process Gesha, grown in Guatemala and displaying pleasing notes of cocoa, stone fruit and cinnamon-like spices.

Name: Guatemala Santa Felisa Solar Eclipse Gesha Natural
Review: A delicate, lively natural-processed Guatemala Geisha cup, sweetly fruit- and floral-toned, with particularly vibrant acidity.

Name: Guatemala Acatenango
Review: A satisfying, richly sweet Guatemala Geisha cup with spice-toned floral and stone fruit notes supported by sweet, pistachio-like nut.

Name: Kenya Gachatha AB
Review: An austere, brightly sweet Kenya cup with a spice throughline suggesting floral pink peppercorn.

Name: Coral
Review: A pretty, berry-driven, richly sweet-tart Pacamara processed by the natural method.

Name: Zafiro
Review: A nuanced, multilayered Peru Pacamara processed by the experimental anaerobic method: floral, savory and sweetly herb-toned.

Name: Colombia La Esperanza Winey Natural
Review: A natural-processed Colombia cup with grapey and musky sweetness deepened by notes of dark chocolate and aromatic wood.

Name: Costa Rica Cumbres Del Poas Anaerobic
Review: A savory-leaning experimentally processed Costa Rica animated by sweet herb and spice-toned floral notes.

Name: Super Instant Coffee
Review: Chocolate and caramel notes animate this lightly and crisply bittersweet instant.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Red Honey
Review: A red-honey-processed, sweetly fruit-centered Costa Rica cup, lively and engaging.

Name: Papua New Guinea Kenta
Origin: Western Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Review: A solid PNG cup, deeply sweet and balanced, with an especially attractive, vibrant acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Goro Muda Washed G1
Review: An elegant, juicy washed Ethiopia with interesting sweet-herb undertones; graceful acidity, bright but not bracing.

Name: Ethiopian Guji Ana Sora Alcoholic Natural G1
Review: A perfumy, intentionally fermenty natural-processed Ethiopia with forward alcohol notes and deep florals, balanced by tart stone fruit notes.

Name: Rum Barrel Aged Kauai Coffee
Review: A nicely balanced barrel-aged coffee from Kauai driven by chocolate, fruit and floral suggestions.

Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Gesha
Review: A classic washed Geisha from the celebrated Hacienda Esmeralda farm in Panama. A relative bargain for a coffee of this provenance and distinction.

Name: Ethiopia Cup of Excellence Guji Natural
Origin: West Guji Zone, Hambela Wamena Woreda, Ethiopia
Review: A delicate, high-toned Ethiopia cup with sweet herb undertones, ethereal in its perfumy complexity.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Telamo FTO Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An exceptionally clean, balanced natural-processed Ethiopia cup: integrated berry and citrus notes out front with cocoa undertones and a hint of sweet herb.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Laayyoo Natural
Review: A juicy, cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia, high-toned and fruit-driven.

Name: Peru Wilmer Alarcon Mirez
Review: A rich, floral-driven Peru cup with stone fruit and citrus complication.

Name: Hawai’i Ka’u Champagne Natural
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An experimentally processed coffee from the Big Island’s Ka’u region, tropical in its suggestions, dessert-like in its sweetness.

Name: Guatemala Bella Carmona
Review: A richly floral, deeply chocolaty Guatemala cup.

Name: Thailand Omkoi Sopa’s Estate
Origin: Omkoi District, Chiang Mai Province, Thailand
Review: A subtly distinctive, rare coffee from Thailand, worth seeking out for its nuanced, layered lyricism.

Name: Burundi Buhorwa
Review: A delicately perfumed, floral-toned Burundi with a throughline of resiny amber-like notes.

Name: Jose Cienfuegos Mexico
Review: A solid Mexico cup with organic/fair trade credentials: crisp chocolate balanced by high-toned fruit.

Name: Cual Bicicleta
Review: A pleasing Honduras cup: citrus-forward with a throughline of warming spices (cinnamon, clove, nutmeg).

Name: Pena Blanca Black Honey
Review: A cup paradoxically both delicate and deep, floral-driven with ballast from crisp chocolate notes.

Name: La Joya
Review: A very balanced, cleanly composed, natural-processed Honduras cup with delicate and lively berry notes throughout.

Name: Magic Cat Kenya Civet AFCA TOH NO.2 Gatuya Factory New Murarandia AA
Review: A Kenya coffee experimentally manipulated in a lab to mimic the sensory impact of digestive processing by civet cats or luwaks. Sweet-savory, bright, rich-toned.

Name: Magic Cat Civet Ethiopia Sidamo Shantwene Litchi Rose Washed
Review: A classically bright, aromatic Ethiopia coffee experimentally manipulated in a lab to mimic the sensory impact of digestive processing by civet cats or luwaks.

Name: Ethiopia Grade 1 Chelchele
Review: A very pretty, elegant washed Ethiopia cup saturated with deeply sweet honeysuckle-like floral tones.

Name: Ethiopia Keramo Zero Oxygen Natural
Review: A juicy anaerobically processed coffee with the complex, bright lift we’ve come to expect from a nice Ethiopia with added depth from a processing method involving limited-oxygen, whole-fruit ferment.

Name: Panama Elida ASD Natural
Review: A heady experimentally processed cup with delicate alcohol notes enveloped by saturating chocolate, flowers, and fruit.

Name: Sumatra Mutu Batak
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Review: A classic Sumatra cup: earthy-rich, deeply chocolaty, with a floral-toned lift.

Name: Peru Chacra Don Dago
Origin: Villa Rica, Oxampampa, Pasco Department, Peru
Review: A Peru cup evocative of winter with notes of baking spices and deep chocolate suggestions.

Name: Colombia Planadas
Review: A balanced, easygoing Colombia cup: chocolaty, nutty, and deeply sweet.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bensa Bekele
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A friendly, accessible natural Ethiopia cup, cleanly fruit- and cocoa-toned.

Name: Bowstring Christmas Blend
Review: A friendly, accessible blend designed to evoke the warmth and spirit of the holidays with dried fruit, roasted nut, and chocolate tones throughout.

Name: Peru Yanesha Geisha
Review: A complex, multi-layered Geisha from Peru characterized by notes of stone fruit and rich florals, with support from nut and aromatic wood — bright, juicy, balanced.

Name: Honduras El Retono
Review: A delicate natural-processed cup that leads with tart fruit and vanilla-like floral notes, elegant and subtly inviting.

Name: Flower Queens of Africa Blend
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An easygoing, cleanly fruit-forward natural-processed cup with big floral notes and delicate citrus and herb suggestions.

Name: Umoja Organic Red Bourbon
Origin: South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Review: A solid DR Congo cup, balanced, engaging, pleasantly reminiscent of eating a candy apple.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Chembi
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A beautifully composed natural-processed Ethiopia cup centered around clean tropical fruit tones supported by rich chocolate and deep vanilla-like florals.

Name: Kenya Nyeri
Review: A classic, deftly balanced Kenya coffee — vibrant, harmoniously sweet-tart, deep-toned.

Name: Kona Red Bourbon Anaerobic Washed Uluwehi Farm
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A lyrically composed, intricately balanced, multi-layered Red Bourbon from Kona that rewards drinkers at every level of engagement.

Name: Wush Wush
Review: An elegant, silky, deeply aromatic Ethiopia coffee of the rare Wush Wush variety — would make a great gift for any lover of coffee esoterica.

Name: Kona Lactic Natural Black Rock Farm
Review: A coffee fermented using a yeast strain aimed at developing lactic acid rather than fruit alcohol notes, producing a cup that is impressively complete yet unorthodox, ideal for the coffee adventurer or a palate looking for a recharge.

Name: Ka’u Yellow Caturra Anaerobic Natural
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A berry-centered cup, dessert-like in its sweetness, suggesting strawberry shortcake or raspberry trifle.

Name: Organic Red Honey Ramirez Estate Microlot
Review: A delicate red-honey processed coffee from the Dominican Republic — a percentage of sales is allocated by the farm to improve education in the farm’s region.

Name: Coffea Diversa Yellow Dalle Honey
Review: A sweet-toned, citrusy-herbaceous cup from a rare tree variety most of us haven’t ever heard of, much less tasted.

Name: Honey Typica Anaerobic
Origin: North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An enigmatic, uniquely structured Kona Typica cup, processed experimentally to amplify tangy fruit and spice-toned floral notes supported by a compelling savory depth.

Name: Geisha
Origin: North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A stately and balanced Kona Geisha cup, paradoxically both deep-toned and delicate, with a particularly lush mouthfeel.

Name: Holiday Blend
Origin: North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A 100% Hawaiian blend of both washed and natural-processed coffees that evokes holiday baking with notes of cinnamon and nutmeg, along with dark chocolate, as throughlines.

Name: Natural Typica Anaerobic
Origin: North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An experimentally processed, cleanly sweet-tart Kona Typica with distinct raspberry and cocoa notes.

Name: Panama Abu Natural ASD Geisha BOP GN11
Review: An unusual aroma and flavor profile, and a very successful one — dessert-like and savory-tart-leaning (think fresh-made yogurt) with nuanced complexity, concentration and balance.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Boji
Review: A bright, balanced, deep-toned Ethiopia cup carried by lyrical stone fruit and rich floral notes.

Name: Panama Finca Minerva-Mirage Pacamara BOP PAC04
Review: A splendid Panama Pacamara, its complexity and unique sweet-tart-savory structure accentuated and further complicated by a tangy lactic lift from the unusual carbonic maceration processing.

Name: Tanzania Shimiligwanda
Review: A complex, deep-toned Tanzania cup evoking baking spice and the aroma of moist, freshly-turned earth, supported by a particularly attractive, syrupy mouthfeel.

Name: Kona SL34
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A floral-driven Kona SL34 cup, deftly roasted to medium-dark to bring out a sweet depth suggesting almond brittle.

Name: Kona Pointu Laurina
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An intricate, delicately perfumed cup from the rare Pointu Laurina variety of Arabica, compellingly complex and inviting.

Name: Costa Rica Naranjo Cattleya
Review: A cleanly sweet natural-processed Costa Rica that pleases with a mélange of berry notes with rich undertones of chocolate and florals.

Name: K7 Sweet Spot
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A friendly, accessible, cocoa-driven cup with deep nut tones framed by rich aromatic wood.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Blue-Donkey 2020
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: Elegantly juxtaposes intriguing savory depth suggesting earthy sweet mushrooms with sweet dry persimmon and zesty citrus notes.

Name: Colombia FUDAM Nariño
Review: A friendly, balanced Colombia cup with pleasing stone fruit and rich nut notes as throughlines.

Name: Kenya Washed Peaberry Rnyeusi
Review: A deep-toned Kenya cup that prioritizes depth over fireworks — solid cocoa, nut and sweet fruit notes predominate in this engaging and accessible coffee.

Name: Ethiopia COE 2nd place Washed Sidamo Rumudamo
Origin: Arbegona, Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An elegant, light-footed, deeply floral washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural Haru Suke G1
Origin: Gedeo, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A clean, juicy, bright natural Ethiopia cup with pretty tropical fruit notes balanced by deep nut and floral tones.

Name: Finca Sophia Gesha Washed
Review: A lush, ethereal, complexly seductive experience of Panama Geisha, with intricate floral notes (plumeria, freesia, lilac, musk) interwoven with tropical fruit and cocoa.

Name: Colombia Granja La Esperanza Java Anaerobic
Origin: Valle del Cauca growing region, Colombia
Review: A startlingly unusual yet inviting anaerobically processed Colombia Java, ideal for the coffee adventurer with its original aromatics conveyed in layers of sweetness, savory depth, and lactic tang.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Super-Natural Decaf Water Process
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A sweet-toned decaf suggesting chocolate-covered raisins complicated by gently smoky aromatic wood notes.

Name: Shantawene Ethiopia Daya Bensa Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A complex, multi-layered natural-processed Ethiopia cup, cleanly fruit-forward and crisply chocolaty.

Name: Tigesit Waqa
Review: Concentrated, berry-driven natural Ethiopia with deep, enveloping chocolate notes.

Name: Kenya AA FAQ
Review: A big, floral Kenya cup with deep chocolate notes throughout and a particularly engaging, lively acidity.

Name: Ardent Ethiopia Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A natural-processed Ethiopia cup unique and thrilling in its dried fruit and floral aromatics carried by a flawless structure: high-toned, elegant, complex, complete.

Name: Kona Mocca®
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: A celebratory coffee — invitingly chocolaty and rich with a whisper of Cognac underneath lush suggestions of tropical fruit.

Name: Holiday Coffee
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Review: An enigmatic blend of coffees, one or more of which were clearly processed using experimental methods, netting an entertaining and unique cup with aromas redolent of holiday associations.

Name: La Union
Review: A classic southern Colombia cup carried by delicate cocoa and citrus notes and an especially attractive, quite syrupy, mouthfeel.

Name: Kaguyu
Review: A complex but balanced, easygoing Kenya with classic red currant notes throughout and a plushly smooth mouthfeel.

Name: Halo Hartume
Origin: Gedeb District, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A nuanced, spice-toned cup centered around floral and citrus notes with undertones of sweet garden herbs.

Name: Ethiopia Dur Feres Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A cleanly berry-forward natural Ethiopia cup with sweet floral and deep caramel undertones, enticingly vibrant and rich.

Name: Ethiopia “Ear Candy” Uraga Guji
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A gently fruit-centered natural-process Ethiopia with deep chocolate and aromatic wood notes throughout.

Name: “Double A Train” Kenya Kabunyeria AA
Origin: Kericho County, Rift Valley region, Kenya
Review: A friendly, balanced Kenya cup, caramelly and floral-toned.

Name: GW01 Finca Sophia Olympus Geisha
Review: This Best of Panama winner also won us over with its layers of floral tones (lavender, violet, jasmine, freesia) delicately ensconced in cocoa and tropical fruit notes, all complicated by a lightly bracing bittersweet citrus.

Name: La Esperanza Colombian Natural X.O.
Review: A berry-driven Colombia cup with background notes of sweet herbs and a dark chocolate throughline.

Name: Taiwan Geisha Honey
Review: A delicately sweet, floral- and fruit-toned Taiwan Geisha, available for the first time in the U.S. market from Paradise Roasters.

Name: Camilina Geisha
Origin: Piedra Candela, Chiriqui Province, western Panama
Review: A delicately intense natural-processed Panama Geisha cup: exciting, unique, aromatically compelling.

Name: Hacienda La Esmeralda Buenos Aires Geisha Natural
Review: Balanced, citrusy, deeply cocoa-toned, and engagingly tart leaning, with very juicy, bright acidity.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga Peaberry
Review: A juicy, rich-toned Kenya with bright citrus notes and dark chocolate throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bona Washed G1
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: This classic washed Ethiopia cup offers vibrant acidity and lively aromatics across a range of floral, fruit and cocoa notes.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Bona Sweet Natural G1
Origin: idamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A lush, deeply fruit-toned, sweetly fermenty natural Ethiopia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Nectar Natural
Review: A pleasantly wood-framed, intentionally fermenty and fruit-toned Ethiopia cup.

Name: Sidama Extreme Papilio Washed
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Sidama cup, both delicate and rich, with pretty stone fruit notes and zesty acidity.

Name: Sidama Extreme Papilio Natural
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A fusion of fruit (blueberry) and savory (fine musk) drive the cup, punctuated by citrusy brightness.

Name: Finca Santa Isabel
Origin: Cobán growing region, Alta Verapaz, Guatemala
Review: A resonant, flavor-saturated Guatemala cup with especially bright, engaging acidity; exquisitely balanced.

Name: Finca San Carlos
Review: A rich-toned, resonant, complex Guatemala cup, sweetly fruit- and floral-toned.

Name: Finca El Pintado
Review: A complex, rich-toned Guatemala cup with pretty floral and stone fruit notes supported by sweet, pistachio-like nut tones.

Name: La Esperanza Villa Sarchi
Review: A friendly, accessible cocoa-framed Guatemala cup with suggestions of citrus and spicy florals throughout.

Name: La Esperanza Borbón
Review: A sweet, tart, pleasantly wood-framed Guatemala cup with notes of stone fruit and delicate florals.

Name: The Aurora Project
Review: Balanced, crisp, perky: a friendly, sweet Guatemala cup.

Name: 5a Sur
Review: An accessible, sweetly nutty and cocoa-driven Guatemala cup.

Name: 5a Poniente
Review: A classic dark roast Guatemala cup with barely perceptible acidity and nice chocolate and nut tones; ideal with a splash of milk.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji D Minor Special Lot
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A uniquely structured naturally processed coffee that delivers sweet-tart, fruit-centered richness, juicy-bright acidity, vibrantly viscous mouthfeel. An intricately layered roller coaster of sensory pleasures.

Name: 2020 Savage Auction Deborah Carbonic-Macerated Natural Geisha
Origin: Chiriqui, Boquete growing region, western Panama
Review: An inviting, enigmatic Panama cup, experimentally processed, that rewards with umami richness as well as classic sweet-tart impulses.

Name: Costa Rica Cordillera del Fuego
Review: A spice-driven coffee redolent of winter baking. A uniquely composed and compelling experimentally processed Costa Rica cup.

Name: Ethiopia Bombe Mountains
Origin: Bombe mountains, Sidama Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A clean, deeply sweet, very complexly expressed fruit-forward coffee.

Name: Ethiopia Guji 1 Natural Hambela Lot 215
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Review: A clean, delicate natural-processed Ethiopia cup, balanced and cocoa-toned with hints of spicy florals throughout.

Name: Kenya Giakanja
Review: A deep-toned, rich, chocolaty Kenya cup with a balanced structure and round acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1 Natural Asfaw Maru
Review: A dessert-like fruit bomb of a coffee with deep chocolate and enticing sandalwood notes throughout.

Name: Costa Rica Termico
Review: A fruit-forward Costa Rica cup with savory undertones contributing balance and depth.

Name: Finca El Jardin Guatemala
Review: A solid Pacamara cup with savory undertones characteristic of this variety, nicely developed in the roast to encourage chocolate notes.

Name: Coffea Diversa Rume Sudan Winey
Review: A fruit and floral bomb of a coffee from Ethiopia stock processed experimentally, encouraging an intricate array of tropical-leaning sensory notes.

Name: Hawai’i Puna Anaerobic Washed
Origin: Puna growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: An unusual, exciting anaerobic-processed coffee that is all fruit and honey, with especially high-toned acidity.

Name: Colombia Hacienda Casablanca
Review: An unusual blend of the workhorse Castillo and celebrated Geisha varieties of Arabica produced this bright and juicy, cocoa-rich Colombia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Kercha Lot Riverside
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: The mint and persimmon suggest autumn in a cup: a richly sweet natural-processed Ethiopia, cleanly fruit-centered, with deep chocolate and spearmint suggestions.

Name: San Diego Natural
Review: A clean, gorgeous natural-processed Costa Rica cup: bright, juicy, fruit-toned, without a hint of ferment.

Name: Buna Boka #1
Origin: idamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A complex, compelling washed Sidama cup with spicy floral notes and bittersweet citrus tones.

Name: El Jardin
Review: First-place prize winner in Antioquia, Colombia’s Best Cup competition and imported by Coffee For Peace, an organization dedicated to ending drug trafficking in Colombia.

Name: Ethiopia Shantawene
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A pretty, delicate but confident Sidama cup, with a clean, washed-process profile particularly animated by spice tones.

Name: Monte Alban
Review: A friendly, chocolate-toned Oaxaca cup with a sweet almond throughline.

Name: Colombia Antioqiua
Review: Described by the roaster as “funky,” and in the best sense: fruit-toned, chocolaty and floral, all with a sweet-savory twist.

Name: Colombia Tolima
Review: A heady Colombia cup from the admired Ethiopian Wush Wush variety, processed by the natural method to bring out sweet but distinctive alcohol-ferment notes.

Name: Kenya Wachuri
Review: Richly spice-toned floral- and fruit-driven, roasted to a dark medium to enhance the chocolate notes inherent in the green.

Name: Kenya Baragwi Guama AB
Review: A classic Kenya cup in its spot-on balance of sweet (stone fruit) and savory-umami (ripe tomato) throughlines.

Name: Kenya ARES
Review: Classic Kenya cup profile with concentrated notes of black currant and cocoa throughout, complicated by sweet-toned herb and floral notes.

Name: Empress Kenya
Review: A balanced but exciting Kenya cup: rich, floral-toned, sweetly herb-toned and resounding.

Name: Kenya Kiambu AB Top Lot
Review: A classic Kenya cup saturated with distinct black currant notes, supported by spice-toned florals and chocolate-nut undertones.

Name: Kenya Kiambu Maua Lot AB
Review: A vibrant floral- and cocoa-toned Kenya cup, juicy and sweet, with a particularly appealing mouthfeel.

Name: Kenya Thunguri AA
Review: Classic Kenya presentation of sweet and savory in harmony: dark berry and umami elements frame the cup.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga Kabare Karani AA
Review: This Kenya cup leads with notes of sweet florals and red berries supported by an undercurrent of petrichor, the pleasing first aroma of rain on dry earth.

Name: Kenya Kirinyaga Kii
Review: A deep, perfumy cup characterized by sweet berry and herb notes with a refreshing rain-on-earth note.

Name: Kenya Rungeto
Review: A pretty, confident, tropical-leaning Kenya cup with coconut notes throughout pleasantly complicated by spicy florals and dark chocolate.

Name: Kenya AA Top Gatomboya
Review: Alive with intrigue in aroma and flavor: dark berry and deep chocolate notes with undertones of perfumy aromatic wood.

Name: Honduras
Review: Engaging and accessible, a Honduras cup characterized by warming spices and chocolate and almond notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti
Origin: Kochere, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: An elegant, crisply sweet, floral-driven washed Yirgacheffe cup anchored by deep cocoa suggestions.

Name: Ethiopia Yabitu Koba
Review: A washed-process Guji cup with leading notes of stone fruit and spicy florals and an engagingly juicy, citrus-leaning structure.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti
Origin: Kochere, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A delicate, spice-forward washed Yirgacheffe cup with deep, sweet-herbal aromatics.

Name: Ethiopia Chelbessa Danche
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, richly floral natural-processed Ethiopia cup redolent with sweet berry tones throughout the profile.

Name: Rhapsody of Dreams
Review: A creative blend of two exceptional green coffees that nets a multi-layered and engaging cup: spice-toned, deeply chocolaty, richly floral.

Name: Laura’s Reserve SL34
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai'i
Review: A Kona coffee worth its price: elegant and sophisticated, balanced and bright, juicy and smooth.

Name: CBD Coffee Dark Roast
Origin: Kona growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Review: A CBD-infused Kona dark roast whose chocolate notes may be further amplified by a splash of milk or cream.

Name: Kona Pumpkin Spice Anaerobic
Review: A subtly nostalgic, playful holiday coffee appropriate for welcoming autumn with notes of warming spices and cocoa.

Name: Taiwan Natural Medium Roast
Review: A crisp, cleanly fruit-toned Taiwan cup presented by a New York roaster specializing in coffees from the island of Taiwan. A good resource for North Americans who want to sample the production end of the exuberant Taiwanese coffee scene.

Name: Thailand Doi Pangkhon Dark Roast
Review: A balanced, richly darker-roasted coffee from Thailand’s burgeoning Doi Pangkhon growing region — sweet, chocolaty, and enlivened by notes of citrus zest.

Name: Ethiopia Reko Yirgacheffe
Review: A harmoniously composed washed Ethiopia coffee with stone fruit and spice-toned floral notes at its heart.

Name: Colombia Asobombo Inza
Review: A beautifully structured, elegantly bright Colombia coffee with lush mouthfeel and deep aromatics.

Name: Panama Boquete Torre Lot #1 Geisha Honey
Review: A sweetly subtle, nuanced Geisha cup processed by the honey method at Panama’s famed Elida Estate.

Name: Honduras Buenos Aires
Review: A deep-toned Honduras cup with a throughline of cocoa, dried fruit, and crisp nut notes.

Name: Nicaragua El Poste Pacamara
Review: A friendly, accessible Nicaragua cup, classically balanced and appealing in its engaging sweetness.

Name: Yellow Caturra (special lot)
Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big island of Hawai’i
Review: A resonant, confident alternative-processed Ka’u cup with pretty notes of tropical fruit and cocoa nib and an especially vibrant, lively structure.

Name: Memory Lane
Review: An engaging, harmonious blend designed to evoke pleasant memories of fine traditional coffee experiences.

Name: Cordillera del Fuego Costa Rica Termico
Review: A deeply sweet Costa Rica coffee processed by an unusual variation on the honey method, promoting a pleasingly nuanced profile with a range of spice notes supported by subtly tart, yogurt-like hints.

Name: Hawai’i Kilauea Volcano Yeast Fermentation Washed
Review: A shockingly coherent, wildly various experience of coffee, a delightful roller coaster that hits all the sensory notes.

Name: Kona Pink Honey Black Rock Farm
Review: A uniquely composed coffee processed by a twist on the traditional honey method that results in a sweet, tart, high-toned, lyrical cup.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: Fruit, flowers, and chocolate come together in harmonious balance in this impressively deep-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Blue Ridge Blend
Review: A blend of medium- and darker-roasted coffees that nets a rich, sweet cup, chocolaty and floral.

Name: Benti Nenqa #209 Ethiopia
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
