Origin: Simalungun Regency, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: An impressively clean, crisp, cocoa-toned (and atypical) natural-processed coffee from Sumatra.

Name: Sumatra Pantan Musara
Origin: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: For lovers of depth and sweet-savory resonance — those who enjoy the roundly sweet/tart/savory character of a fine ripe tomato, for example.

Name: Sumatra Aceh Gayo Mountain Kenawat Raisin Honey
Origin: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: An unusual honey-processed coffee from Sumatra: graceful, balanced, quietly original.

Name: Ketiara Sumatra
Origin: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Review: Attractive choice for lovers of the traditional Sumatra wet-hulled profile: earthy, pungent, yet bright, offering bonus satisfaction for supporters of progressive, women-led cooperatives.

Name: Sumatra Lintong
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Review: Bright and vivacious, yet resonantly deep: a Sumatra for all seasons.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Hambela G1 Bishan Fugu
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A rich-toned, resonant, cleanly fruity natural-processed Ethiopia cup with delicate florals and sweet musky notes throughout.

Name: Tanzania Tarime AB
Review: A high-toned yet deeply savory Tanzania cup with resonant stone fruit and spicy floral notes throughout.

Name: Panama Baru Geisha Black
Review: An intentionally ferment-toned Geisha cup with exquisite balance: notes of passionfruit on the sweet end of the spectrum and hops on the savory, with dark chocolate running through the whole.

Name: Kenya Safari AB Top
Review: Superb and classic Kenya, intense in structure, layered and resonantly intricate in aroma and flavor.

Name: Brazil Para Ela Natural
Origin: Campos Alto district, Minas Gerais State, southeastern Brazil
Review: A beautiful berry-centric natural-processed coffee from Brazil, with especially high-toned acidity and deep cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Tumba Rwanda
Review: An attractively savory-leaning Rwanda cup whose leading descriptor is sweet squash; this unusual but pleasing note is supported by sweet herb and spicy floral suggestions, rounded by a rich cocoa.

Name: Ethiopia Harrar
Origin: Harar (also Harrar) growing region of eastern Ethiopia
Review: Crisp, chocolaty, roast-toned cup, with a zesty edge.

Name: KonAroma Direct Trade Kona
Origin: Kona growing district, Big Island of Hawaii
Review: A plush, smooth roast-touched Kona.

Name: Mellower Blend
Review: A round, rich-toned cup with a whisper of grappa-like sweet ferment.

Name: Peru Chirinois
Origin: San Ignacio Province, Cajamarca Region, northern Peru
Review: A beautifully balanced Peru cup: fruit, flowers and nuts in crisply sweet harmony.

Name: Ecuador Finca La Papaya
Review: A solid Ecuador cup, balanced and friendly, with appealing cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Peru Natural Utcubamba
Origin: Utcubamba Province, Amazonas Region, north-central Peru
Review: A natural-processed Peru cup with an appealing hint of cordial-like sweet ferment animating a layering of fruit, floral and tobacco notes.

Name: Ecuador Los Eucaliptos
Review: An entertaining Ecuador coffee with an unusual profile that pleasingly suggests root beer, punctuated by bright herb and sweet-toned spice notes.

Name: Ecuador Pichincha Typica
Review: An elegant, balanced Ecuador cup saturated with notes of tropical fruit and spicy flowers.

Name: Ecuador Finca Carolina Fausto Romo
Review: An impressive Ecuador cup: big, resonant, layered with sweet stone fruit and rich nut tones.

Name: Bolivia Yungas Caranavi Alasitas Geisha Natural
Origin: Caranavi Province, La Paz Department, west-central Bolivia
Review: An appealingly eccentric coffee: think deep, fruity sweetness juxtaposed with rich umami notes.

Name: Geisha Pasco Oxapampa Peru
Review: An ultra-sweet Peru Geisha cup resonating rich floral and deep nut tones throughout.

Name: Finca Tasta Peru
Origin: Satipo Province, Junin Region, central Peru
Review: A cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed Peru cup, ringing with spicy floral and rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Peru La Salina
Origin: Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, northern Peru
Review: A nuanced Peru coffee characterized by red fruit notes, rich aromatic wood, and a throughline of sweet musk-like notes.

Name: Bolivia Yungas Caranavi Finca Las Alasitas Peaberry
Origin: Caranavi Province, La Paz Department, west-central Bolivia
Review: A graceful natural-processed Geisha cup, understated and elegant in its clean fruit and deep cocoa notes.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Alaka
Origin: Hambela Wamena District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced, classic Ethiopia wet-processed cup: cocoa- and citrus-toned with sweet florals throughout.

Name: 100% Kona Bourbon
Origin: Captain Cook, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Review: An inviting cup from the classic Bourbon variety as grown in Kona, complex and sweet-savory.

Name: Kona Naturals
Origin: Captain Cook, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Review: A fruit-driven natural-processed Kona Typica cup with a pleasing hint of grappa-like sweet ferment.

Name: Rwanda Rulindo Tumba
Review: A rich, pleasing Rwanda coffee with berry notes, vanilla-like florals, and an appealing hint of sweet herbs.

Name: Guatemala Quejina
Origin: Region Concepción Huista, Huehuetenango growing region, Guatemala
Review: A citrus-driven, quite bright Guatemala cup with a pretty floral note akin to candied violet.

Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Black Honey
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A crisp, richly sweet, berry-driven black honey from Costa Rica.

Name: Eaagads Estate Kenya
Review: A beautiful Kenya cup with layers of intrigue, from the classic cocoa-toned currant note to the pleasing twist of sweetly savory herbs.

Name: Ethiopia Guji
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: An aromatically saturated, flavor-deep cup that hits all of the classic Ethiopia notes: fruit, florals, cocoa and aromatic wood.

Name: California Grown
Review: A splurge coffee, crisply classic in the cup, rare and precious in its aspiration and story.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1
Review: A pretty, floral-toned Ethiopia cup with particularly vibrant acidity and plush mouthfeel.

Name: Kenya Karindundu AA Small Lot Reserve
Review: A perfectly structured coffee alive with aromatic intrigue. It gave us far too many positive descriptors to list. Just a few more: dried mulberry, blood orange zest, raw honey.

Name: Rwanda Kanzu
Review: Big, characteristic Rwanda sweet-tartness juxtaposed with savory depth, with a supporting intrigue of spice, flowers and complex fruit.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Natural
Review: A deeply satisfying, impeccably clean natural Ethiopia cup: a chocolate bomb lifted by pretty notes of dried berries and high-toned florals.

Name: Cirque Tarrazu F1 Natural
Review: One of the better specialty instants we’ve tested, with persuasive brightness, deep sweetness, and a plush, appealing mouthfeel.

Name: Mocha Java Blend Fair Trade Organic
Review: A balanced, richly sweet-tart Ethiopia-Sumatra blend that’s also fair trade and organic-certified.

Name: Sumatra Tano Batak
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Review: A classic Sumatra coffee: aromatically seductive, with deep florals and sweet fruit notes, supported by a fresh, foresty earthiness.

Name: Moonbow Decaf
Review: A very impressive decaf, tested here for drip or other non-espresso applications: Sweet, balanced, cocoa-driven.

Name: Colombia La Guamera Honey
Review: A deeply sweet, subtly fruit-toned cup processed by the honey method, unusual for coffees from Colombia.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
Review: A deftly darker-roasted Yirgacheffe cup centered around notes of dark chocolate and spicy florals, with a particularly satisfying mouthfeel.

Name: Rwanda Mushonyi Natural
Review: A fine Rwanda natural: clean, bright, juicy, mesmerizing.

Name: Rwanda Mushonyi
Review: A sweet-toned Rwanda cup with pretty floral and stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Kochere
Review: A floral- and tropical fruit-toned wet-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Feku Double
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic wet-processed Ethiopia cup: bright and vibrant, with leading notes of stone fruit and cocoa.

Name: Ethiopia Tadese Yonka
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A distinctive wet-processed Ethiopia cup with resonant stone fruit and crisp chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Nano Challa Ethiopia
Review: A pretty Ethiopia coffee characterized by tropical fruit and spice-toned flowers.

Name: Colombia La Cabana
Review: A confident, savory-leaning, rich-toned Colombia cup.

Name: Kenya AB
Review: A deeply sweet Kenya cup with a developed roast profile that equally prioritizes flowers and chocolate.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Natural Organic
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A spice-driven, fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup: rich, resonant, clean, deep.

Name: Tanzania Ngorongoro Ridge Peaberry
Review: A lush Tanzania cup laden with red fruit and deep chocolate tones throughout, lifted by a bright acidity.

Name: Bombe Natural Sidama
Review: An especially clean natural-processed coffee: a fruit bomb tempered by rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Botabaa G1
Review: A citrus-driven wet-processed Ethiopia cup with fragrant aromatic wood notes throughout.

Name: 100% Kona Bourbon Pointu Laurina
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Review: A bright, juicy, berry-toned Hawaii cup from the extremely rare tree variety Pointu Laurina, worth a splurge for its clean fruit and sweet, cocoa-laden richness.

Name: Ethiopia Haro Wachu
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A high-toned wet-processed Ethiopia cup, expertly roasted to a darkish medium to amplify the rich chocolate notes without obscuring the sweet-tart tropical fruit.

Name: Banco Gotete Ethiopia
Review: A nuanced, multi-layered washed Ethiopia cup with a deep floral profile and energetic lift from an elegant spice throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochere
Review: Citrus-driven, sweetly herb-toned, very delicate yet aromatically rich.

Name: ASOPAP Colombia
Origin: Planadas, southern Tolima growing region, Colombia
Review: A solid Colombia cup, classic in its deep, balanced sweetness and cocoa throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Deri Kochoha
Origin: West Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southeastern Ethiopia
Review: A poised and melodic wet-processed Ethiopia coffee, centered on complex citrus notes supported by sweet spice and cocoa.

Name: Kenya Ruthaka Peaberry
Review: A high-toned, nuanced Kenya cup, classic in its presentation of sweet-tart currant and deep chocolate notes.

Name: Ethiopia Gora Kone Sidamo
Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia

Name: Honduras Las Flores Parainema
Review: A subtly but strikingly original Honduras coffee: deep, complex and sweetly spice-toned.

Name: Kivu DR Congo
Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo

Name: Santa Luzia Brazil
Origin: Cerrado Mineiro growing region, Santa Luzia, Brazil
Review: A quiet, integrated fruit-forward coffee from Brazil, with leading notes of brandy-toned strawberry and chocolate.

Name: Porfirio Castellanos Honduras
Review: A rich, savory-leaning Pacas cup with tremendous depth of aroma and flavor.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Awassa
Review: A high-toned, juicy Yirgacheffe cup, classic in its balance of bright fruit, sweet floral and cocoa tones.

Name: Panama Ninety Plus Perci Lot 50

Name: Colombia Sidra
Review: An engaging coffee from the unusual Sidra variety—rich, floral, balanced and bright.

Name: Colombia Geisha
Review: A splendid Colombia Geisha: deep floral and fruit tones juxtaposed with underlying umami intrigue.

Name: Select Reserve Guatemala El Aceituno “El Bonito” Microlot
Review: A resonantly sweet Guatemala cup with notes of warming spices and cocoa powder throughout.

Name: Foothills Series Hambela Ethiopia
Origin: Alaka District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A fruit-forward, natural-processed Ethiopia cup with a throughline of sweet aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Gugi
Review: A cleanly crisp yet plushly fruit-toned, natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Kenya Murunga New Gatanga FCS Mukurwe Factory AB
Review: An opulent Kenya carried by spice notes (both floral and peppery) that balance the coffee’s deep sweetness.

Name: Brazil Recreio Selectivo
Review: A friendly, richly nut-toned Brazil cup, a bit reminiscent of nutella, with pleasing notes of fresh-cut fir and pear throughout.

Name: Ethiopia WORKA
Review: A balanced, richly floral natural-processed Ethiopia cup redolent with crisply sweet fruit tones throughout.

Name: Guatemala Hunapu
Review: An impressive sweetness is complicated by a brisk edge in this big-bodied, apricot- and cocoa-toned Guatemala.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Dhadhato Washed
Review: A classic version of the Yirgacheffe cup, all seductive flowers, soft citrus, and cocoa.

Name: Kenya Rugeto Peaberry
Review: A balanced and engaging Kenya: high-toned with spicy floral and delicate cocoa notes.

Name: Gayo Aceh Sumatra

Name: Kenya Karuthi AA
Review: A big, lavishly complex, high-toned Kenya cup alive with berry and tropical fruit, spicy florals and deep chocolate.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Nudurutu Factory AB

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Washed Saona Lot

Name: Ethiopia Guji Natural Dasaya
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A cleanly and seductively fruit-forward, richly chocolate-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Auromar Geisha Natural

Name: Holiday Blend

Name: Kith & Kin

Name: El Salvador Pacamara
Review: A washed-process Pacamara cup that leads with bright stone fruit notes, balanced by bittersweet citrus zest and aromatic wood.

Name: Guji Oraga Tabe
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Name: Baru Gesha

Name: Flowery Nekisse

Name: Colombia El Obraje Gesha

Name: Holiday Sweet Blend

Name: Camilina Geisha

Name: Mama Cata Geisha Washed

Name: Panama Finca Lerida Geisha Black Honey

Name: Panama Finca Lerida Geisha Washed
Origin: Alto Quiel, Boquete growing region, western Panama
Review: Another essay in delicately lush extravagance and aromatic originality from the great Geisha variety.

Name: Wei Rong Blend
Review: The blender’s art at its finest: an original and complete cup.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A classic natural-processed Ethiopia cup: balanced, driven by fruit and floral tones, with an elegant cocoa throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Reko
Review: A high-toned wet-processed Ethiopia cup with balanced vivacity.

Name: 100% Arabica Freeze-Dried Colombian (Instant Coffee)
Review: A appealing 100% Colombia coffee in instant format that largely preserves the character of the green coffee.

Name: Colombia El Sauce
Review: A crisply sweet Colombia cup driven by engaging floral notes and hints of red apple and fresh-cut fir.

Name: Kiunyu Peaberry
Review: A rich-toned Kenya carried by pleasing savory notes that support and balance the coffee’s deep sweetness.

Name: El Aguila SL28 El Salvador
Review: A subtle but persuasive version of the resonantly pungent, berry-and-flowers Kenya-style cup.

Name: Nano Challa
Review: A spirited, high-toned Ethiopia cup with vivacious floral spice notes throughout.

Name: Kona Mocca®
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Review: A marvel of a coffee, inviting and esoteric, chimerical and grounded, all at once.

Name: Kibugu Kenya
Review: A classic Kenya with an umami intrigue that balances the rich sweetness of the cup: multi-layered, paradoxical yet complete.

Name: Kenya Gikirima Kibugu
Review: A deeply sweet, richly savory Kenya cup, with pleasingly intense notes of aromatic wood (think fresh pine forest) underneath melon and cocoa tones.

Name: Kenya AA Top Gachatha
Review: A classically balanced Kenya cup with pretty fruit and floral tones and a bright, engaging acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1 Chachale Natural
Review: A cleanly fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup, redolent with ripe berry notes.

Name: Quejina Guatemala
Review: A friendly, straightforward, pleasing Guatemala cup.

Name: Christmas Blend
Review: A chocolaty coffee fragrant with spice notes that invoke the winter holidays.

Name: Thanksgiving Blend
Review: A pleasing chocolate-first holiday blend for those who prefer an adeptly darker-roasted coffee.

Name: Elida Estate Geisha Natural Dragonfly Reserve

Name: Costa Rica Geisha Honey COE 2018 2nd Place

Name: Guatemala Pacamara Natural

Name: La Providencia Guatemala Maragogype

Name: Finca Insul Guatemala Pacamara
Review: A balanced, richly sweet coffee driven by notes of stone fruit punctuated by spice tones throughout.

Name: Cuxinales Guatemala
Review: A deep, chocolaty cup with crisply sweet fruit and floral tones.

Name: Nicaragua La Benedicion Pacamara

Name: El Salvador Finca El Cerro Pacamara Black Honey

Name: Nicaragua Mierisch Finca La Huella Yellow Pacamara Honey

Name: El Salvador Finca Himalaya Pacamara
Review: A solid, balanced Pacamara cup: richly sweet, with a chocolate throughline.

Name: Y-3 Geisha Hacienda Esmeralda
Review: A crisp, balanced Gesha cup with pretty notes of cocoa and spicy florals throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Misti Valley
Review: A finely balanced, vivaciously high-toned washed Ethiopia cup animated by sweet floral and tart fruit notes.

Name: Ethiopia Guji
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A balanced washed-process Ethiopia cup with pleasing notes of stone fruit and baker’s chocolate as throughlines.

Name: Kenya Kabingara
Review: A classic Kenya cup: juicy and bright, layered with fruit and floral intrigue.

Name: Guatemala Huehuetenango
Review: A tactfully darker-roasted Guatemala, richly bittersweet and chocolaty in the cup, supported by notes of smoky aromatic wood.

Name: Adanech Ethiopia Guji
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Name: El Salvador Loma La Gloria Black Honey

Review: A crisply fruit-forward, inviting black honey-processed coffee with gentle acidity.

Name: Yemen Haraaz

Name: Kenya Konyu
Review: A multi-layered Kenya coffee with a perfect balance of sweet, tart and savory notes — in particular, dried berries and richly bittersweet flowers.

Name: Guatemala Finca San Gerardo
Review: A friendly, floral-toned Guatemala cup with undercurrents of rich hazelnut.

Name: Hacienda La Esmeralda Cabana Geisha Natural

Name: Finca La Aurora Camilina Geisha

Name: Costa Rica Microlot Series San Cristobal Natural

Name: La Union (Colombia)

Name: Colombia Luis Alberto Montoya Antioquia

Name: Karimikui Kenya

Name: Kenya Baragwi Thimu Peaberry
Review: An elegant, spice-toned Kenya cup loaded with red fruit notes and exhilarating, high-toned florals.

Name: Kariru Kenya
Review: A rich, savory-leaning Kenya cup with a vivid spicy-floral throughline.

Name: Esmeralda Estate Porton Geisha Natural

Name: Kenya Kiambu
Review: A classically appealing Kenya cup: juicy, sweet-toned with a savory ballast and spicy floral notes.

Name: Kenya Gatuya
Review: A complex, chocolaty and floral Kenya cup with pretty stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia
Review: A sweetly fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia with spicy-floral intrigue.

Name: Kenya Gatuyaini

Name: Kenya AA Top Lot
Review: A pleasingly rich Kenya cup, deftly roasted to medium-dark, with chocolate and stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Kainamui
Review: A deep, nuanced Kenya cup with notes of tart fruit, sweet florals, and rich aromatic wood.

Name: Kenya Kariru PB
Review: A lively citrus- and cocoa-driven, richly sweet-tart Kenya cup.

Name: Organic Ethiopia Sidama Natural

Name: Kenya Mwiria
Review: A chocolate-toned, floral Kenya cup, with bittersweet notes of citrus zest, pleasingly roasted toward the darker end of medium.

Name: Colombia Narino Excelsio

Name: Cupid Blend
Review: A chocolaty blend with notes of tropical fruit and sweet earth tones.

Name: Kenya Ritho FCS Handege Factory AB
Review: One of the most riveting Kenyas we’ve cupped all year: bright, deep, juicy and intricately nuanced.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Botabaa Washed
Review: A bright, richly sweet, invitingly tart and complex washed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Sidama Sasaba Natural
Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A cleanly balanced natural-processed Ethiopia coffee with throughlines of dried stone fruit, cocoa and deep florals.

Name: Kenya AA Kirinyaga
Review: A classic Kenya cup: balanced, muscularly fruit-toned, elegantly floral.

Name: Ethiopia Limu
Origin: Limu Woreda, Oromia region, southwest Ethiopia
Review: A sweetly and intriguingly herb- and citrus-toned washed-process Ethiopia cup, delicately bright yet rich.

Name: Ethiopia Bensa Segra Natural

Review: An invitingly clean, crisp natural-processed Ethiopia with hints of ginger-like spice notes.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Natural

Review: A fruit-forward, crisply sweet natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain

Name: Guatemala Huehuetenango La Garita
Review: A gently brisk, sweetly nut-toned Central America cup: smooth, balanced, friendly.

Name: Roba Ethiopia (Chelbessa)

Review: A richly sweet, savory-edged Ethiopia cup, both spice-toned and redolent of tropical fruit.

Name: Ethiopia Hambela Hasam

Review: A cocoa-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup, deeply fruity and sweetly herbaceous.

Name: Kenya Kabare AA
Review: A spice-driven, floral-toned Kenya cup with balanced, bright acidity.

Name: El Salvador Finca Nombre de Dios Honey

Name: Ethiopia Gera Limmu Oromia
Origin: Limu Woreda, Oromia region, southwest Ethiopia
Review: A bright and zesty, floral- and spice-driven wet-processed Ethiopia cup.

Name: Kenya Kabare Konyu
Review: A classic Kenya cup, juicy-sweet, with leading notes of black currant backed up by cocoa and spicy florals.

Name: Costa Rica Francisco Ruiz
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Review: A roundly sweet-tart Costa Rica honey-processed cup with pretty notes of stonefruit and molasses, framed by aromatic wood notes.

Name: Alemu Bukato Ethiopia
Review: A classic washed Yirgacheffe cup: juicy and crisply sweet-tart with notes of stone fruit, citrus blossom and chocolate throughout.

Name: ASOPEP Colombia
Review: A sweet, chocolaty FTO Colombia cup with umami intrigue.

Name: Tarime Tanzania

Name: Guachepelin Costa Rica

Name: Berlina Geisha
Review: A soaring Gesha cup: balanced, both delicate and rich, deeply floral and stone fruit-laden.

Name: Gatugi Triple
Review: A confident Kenya with a classic cup profile: bright, juicy, with prominent fruit and floral tones grounded by a resonant current of umami.

Name: Sulawesi Toarco
Origin: Toraja growing region, south-central Sulawesi, Indonesia

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural
Review: A fruit-and-chocolate-saturated natural-processed Yirgacheffe, lush and syrupy. For lovers of fine ports and fruit-bomb California red table wines. Casual coffee drinkers who assume all coffees taste about the same should try this one.

Name: Brazil Conquista
Review: A chocolaty Brazil cup with sweet nut notes throughout, animated by dried stonefruit and floral suggestions.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Natural
Review: An accessible natural-processed Ethiopia cup, slightly darker-roasted than is typical, with notes of tropical fruit and a pleasing brandy-like ferment.

Name: Via Instant Veranda Blend Blonde
Review: We enjoyed the caramel, nut and cocoa and the relative cleanness of the cup, though a salt-toned wood lurked.

Name: KANU Colombia Mild Roast Americano (Instant Coffee)

Name: Augie’s Ethiopia Layo Teraga Natural (Instant Coffee)
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: The juicy, lushly sweet-tart character of a fine natural-processed Ethiopia largely makes it through the rigors of solubilizing in this top-of-the-line instant coffee.

Name: Premium Coffee (Instant Coffee)
Review: At 20 cents per serving, inexpensive. Not much else positive to say about it.

Name: Augie’s Ethiopia Layo Teraga Washed (Instant Coffee)
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: Rewards patience, which should reveal, beneath the fresh-cut wood, the crisp, sweet grace and complex aromatics of a fine washed Ethiopia.

Name: Taster’s Choice House Blend (Instant Coffee)
Review: Not a pleasant experience.

Name: Coava Costa Rica Los Nacientes (Instant Coffee)
Review: A creditable effort to deliver the clean, classic character of a high-grown Costa Rica in instant format.

Name: Ethiopia Duromina (Instant Coffee)
Review: Quietly lively washed Ethiopia that preserves some of the lemony citrus, cocoa and perfumy sandalwood of this treasured type in instant coffee format.

Name: Kochere Yirgacheffe Ethiopia (Instant Coffee)
Review: An instant that captures some of the zesty, lemon-and-cocoa character of a good Yirgacheffe, with a subtle whiff of flowers and sandalwood as well.

Name: Rayos del Sol Peru Light Roast (Instant Coffee)
Review: The balanced grace of Peru is sustained in this instant coffee. The cocoa notes are particularly pleasing, the hints of salty wood less so.

Name: The Blend Sumiyaki Coffee (Instant Coffee)
Review: An unapologetic darker roasted instant coffee in the smoky Japanese style.

Name: Via Instant Colombia Medium Roast (Instant Coffee)
Review: Not much survives the dark roast and the solubilizing, and what does is not particularly pleasing.

Name: Finca El Socorro Maracaturra
Origin: Palencia, Fraijanes Plateau growing region, central Guatemala
Review: A lovely example of the big-beaned Maracaturra variety: sweetly savory with notes of deep stone fruit and rich, sweet florals.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Debo Washed Gellana
Review: An intricately classic expression of the great Yirgacheffe wet-processed type, lemony and floral with a fragrant sandalwood base.

Name: Guatemala Huehuetenango Miralvalle Washed
Review: Impressive medium-dark roasted Guatemala, pungently fruit-toned, briskly structured, sweetly floral.

Name: Ethiopia Gotiti Natural
Review: Flowers and fruit carry for miles in this natural-processed Ethiopia cup: clean, crisp, and chocolaty, too.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain Natural
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A deeply sweet natural-processed Ethiopia coffee with narcissus-like flowers and pungent, resiny myrrh as throughlines.

Name: Colombia Jairo Alcaraz
Review: A rich-toned Colombia cup, deftly roasted to foreground chocolate and spice notes.

Name: Ethiopia Girma Eshetu
Origin: Bita Genet District, Keffa Zone, southwestern Ethiopia
Review: A classic, on-point washed Ethiopia cup: floral-toned, with bright berry and zesty citrus notes, all enveloped in delicate cocoa.

Name: Organic Dulce de Guatemala
Review: An intriguing Guatemala cup, classic yet idiosyncratic, redolent of stone fruit and sweet nuts, and an excellent value at $11.95 for 12 ounces.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural Grade 1
Review: A friendly, fruit-forward natural-process Ethiopia coffee with berry and floral notes alongside rich aromatic wood.

Name: Guatemala Finca El Limonar Hugo Chavez Mendez
Review: A bright, crisp, cocoa-toned Guatemala coffee with a throughline of sweet herbs suggesting a fragrant lemon verbena.

Name: Colombia Finca La Loma Antonio Gualguan
Review: A crisp, sweet-toned Colombia cup with engaging stone fruit and chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Deri Kochoha
Origin: West Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Review: A good coffee choice for those who value softly stated brightness with delicate melony and floral aromatics.

Name: Guatemala Finca Las Terrazas
Review: A subtly original and pleasing Guatemala: sweet and honey-toned with a delicately brisk complement of aromatics.

Name: Suyusama Program Colombia
Review: A coffee with strong character situated on the intersection of sweet, tart and savory, with a crisp array of aromatics suggesting, in part, a fragrant potpourri of dried flowers.

Name: Static Peru Valle de Chingama Peru
Review: A fine Peru, with the round, pungently chocolaty character of the type supported by crisp floral top notes and a plump, smooth mouthfeel.

Name: Static Chirinos Peru
Review: A quietly rich Peru, sweet yet briskly zesty.

Name: Kenya Muranga Gondo
Review: A pretty Kenya cup with bright notes of stone fruit and spicy florals throughout, supported by an undercurrent of rich, aromatic myrrh.

Name: Costa Rica Esteban Zamora
Review: A classic wet-processed coffee from Costa Rica: crisp, balanced, sweetly herb-toned.

Name: El Salvador Loma La GLoria Natural
Origin: El Boquerón growing region, El Salvador
Review: A lively, bright, fruit-forward natural-processed coffee from a highly regarded producer in El Salvador.

Name: Kenya
Review: A friendly Kenya cup that leads with crisp chocolate and deep floral notes, with a medium-dark roast profile that encourages a pleasing suggestion of smoky aromatic wood.

Name: Burundi Nkonge Hill Red Honey
Review: A tactfully medium-roasted coffee with caramel and date as sweet-toned ballast to notes of richly savory hop-like flowers.

Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Review: A richly sweet-tart, lively and complex Ethiopia coffee with deeply pleasing notes of mango and jasmine.

Name: Tano Batak Sumatra
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Review: A multi-layered Sumatra cup with berry and tropical flowers as primary notes, balanced with fine pipe tobacco, sweet herbs and rich chocolate.

Name: Zambia AAA/AA
Review: A chocolaty and fruit-toned coffee from Zambia in south-central Africa, deftly roasted to medium-dark.

Name: Sumatra Batak Naga Saribu M-Plus
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia

Name: Ethiopia Guji Natural Dasaya G1
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, south-central Ethiopia
Review: A richly sweet, multi-layered natural-processed Ethiopia cup: berry- and cocoa-toned, with an inviting touch of sweet ferment, redolent of elderflower liqueur.

Name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Adado Shara

Name: Kenya Embu Uteuzi Jimbo

Name: Sumatra Batak Naga Saribu
